author: J. Ng
title: Stays on!
content: Great headphones and they stay on no matter what kind of exercise I do. If other headphones have trouble staying on when you're active, these will fit you really well! Worth the 20 bucks I dropped!

author: Li Jia
title: Good for the price, not for audiophiles
content:
This pair of earbuds is decent. It's not great, you get what you get for the price.

First, the sound quality. The sound quality is definitely not audiophile level. It's good for 20 bucks. You can turn the volume up quite loud, but it can't go extremely quiet. Nevertheless, it doesn't leak sound that much. I think that the audio is fine for most people. If you're an audiophile, I don't know why you're looking at 20 dollar earbuds.

Next up, the design and material. I quite like the design of these. The earbuds and ear hooks are black. The rubber piece that connects them is a nice red color. I do have a few complaints. One, the ear hooks are not adjustable. They're flexible and you can bend them however you want, but they don't quite fit around my ears. If you plan on running, I can't guarantee that these will stay in, since I only use the for casual music listening. Also, they are a bit large and stand out a little. After some time using them, I got used to that.

Lastly, the performance. The battery lasts a good few days of constant use. They charge up really fast too - under an hour. To turn them on, you press the power button on the right earbud for a few seconds and it'll beep when connected. The volume buttons are also on the right earbuds. The order is a bit weird though. When wearing them, the volume up button is behind the volume down button. That threw me off a bit. It's nice, however, that there isn't a dangling piece on the wire for the control buttons, which usually make the weight distribution uneven.

I like these earbuds, but if you have a higher budget, I strongly suggest investing in a better pair. I'm not saying that these are bad, Im just saying that for a higher budget, you could probably get something a lot better. If you're budget is tight, these are fine.

EDIT:
For some reason the left earbud now doesn't work. It only works when the rubber wire is in a certain position. You should probably buy the new version instead of this one.

EDIT:
I contacted customer service and they were able to send me a new pair. The communication took a few days because of the different time zone but good customer service nonetheless.

author: Dr Peter Cumberland
title: If you want hassle free headphones over bluetooth then look elsewhere there are much better options.
content: The headphones themselves are of a decent quality and the volume level beats the Plantronics hands down. However there is a drawback and that has to do with bluetooth. It is a rare occasion when any bluetooth compatible device can see the headphones let alone connect successfully to them. And it doesn't seem to matter if these headphones are the only bluetooth device when you try and connect from a PC or tablet or cell phone (all with bluetooth compatibility).Invariably the headphones are never found and if they are they fail to connect. Replace them with Plantronics and success every time. So this is an issue only for these headphones. If you want hassle free headphones over bluetooth then look elsewhere there are much better options.

author: Fadi A.
title: Good for the price!
content:
I needed wireless headphones for working out and decided to give these a try since I bought another pair of Otium wireless headphones before and was satisfied with the product. The headphones are as pictured and it comes with the case, extra earbuds, and a charging cable. Pairing it with my phone was easy; all I had to do is hold the power button for about 6-7 seconds until it entered pairing mode and it connected easily to my phone. I still haven't tried it at the gym since I just got it, but I tried shaking my head and it didn't fall or even feel like it is going to fall. The reason I gave it 4 stars is because the sound quality could be better in my opinion; however, since I'll be using it only when working out, I don't really care about the sound quality as much as long as it is good enough since I already have other headphones that I use when I want to listen to music while I'm chilling or not doing extreme physical activity.  I just hope that it won't fall out of my ears when working out and that it holds up well over time.
Overall, the headphones are good for the price.

author: Joy
title: Comfortable, waterproof and sounds good.
content: These headphones exceeded my expectations. The fact that they come with three different sizes of covers was really appreciated since that style of headphones doesn’t usually fit me. They came in a zipper pouch which is always nice to keep them in. My biggest complaint about my previous Bluetooth headphones was that they were always being pulled out of my ears when I turned my head. Because the “remote” is on the earpiece, they stay in my ears even when I turn my head. I have also been really impressed how long the battery lasts. Overall an awesome buy!

author: Amazon User
title: Great when they work, but on my 3rd pair
content:
I use these almost entirely at the gym, so they see about 4-5 hours of use a week. I bought them mainly because of their advertised water resistance - I tend to sweat heavily when working out, and have had poor luck with other headphones.

The good: The battery life, and charge time, both seem great. My "charging habits", such as they are - mean plugging them in in my car a couple times week when I happen to think about it. Usually for less than 20 minutes. I've never once been caught by a dead, or even low, battery - so that's nice.

They stay in place, for me, very well. No amount of activity, changing position, or running seems to shake them loose - which is another reason I like these, with the small ear-wraps, over the in-the-ear-only ones.

They also pair very quickly and easily - exactly like Bluetooth stuff is meant to.

The bad: Acknowledging the sweat issue, I've had poor luck with reliability on these. My first pair lasted maybe 4 months. I ordered a second pair, figuring I had gotten my moneys worth from the first. The second pair worked once. The very second time/day I went to use them they were totally dead.

Amazon replaced the two day old set with my current pair. They're now about 6 or 7 weeks old, and I'm beginning to hear the telltale crackle I did right before my pair stopped working.

EDIT: To their credit, I followed up with Otium when the third pair finally died a couple months in. They sent me a new pair, under warranty, with very little hassle. We'll see how long the new set lasts.

author: Matt Koppenheffer
title: Good, maybe even better, depending on you and your use
content:
Let me start by saying you'll have trouble doing a whole lot better on the price/performance mix. I paid $19, and I can't expect a whole lot more for that price. That said, I rated three stars because these just haven't worked out well for what I primarily bought them for: that is, bluetooth headphones for running.

First, the pros:
- Easy to pair
- Good sound quality
- Comfortable enough wearing around the house
- Pretty decent water-resisting performance (more on this below)
- Nobody's complained about sound quality when I've taken phone calls on these
- Battery life is solid (I can go at least three or four runs without charging)

Cons:
- When I'm running they just don't stay in my ears. I have to wear a headband and pull it down a bit over the buds to keep them from falling out completely while I'm running. Even so, I end up having to push them in and adjust them constantly during my run. Ear shapes are different though, so that may not be the case for everyone.
- They can get really uncomfortable when they get sweaty. For me at least, when sweat gets into my ears, these can suction into my ears really, really tightly and get very uncomfortable. At that point I have to pop them back out and... oh, hey they're falling out again.
- One half of the volume/track change is no longer working. I'm pretty sure this happened due to sweat and moisture exposure. I haven't been particularly kind to these as far as moisture goes, but they are listed as waterproof.
- The rubber connector between the two buds always seems to swing to one side or the other and then catch on my neck and pull out one of the buds if I move my head. Not sure if that makes sense, but the bottom line is that the "stickiness" of that rubber connector causes a lot of pulling and discomfort.

The bottom line is that if you want these just as a solid, low-cost pair of bluetooth headphones for around the house, walking around the city, making the occasional phone call, and doing lower-impact sports (like biking maybe?), these could be a good choice. But if you're looking for a pair of running headphones, these may not be the right pick -- your ears are probably shaped differently than mine, and these may stay in better for you, but I've gone through months of frustration trying (unsuccessfully) to keep these in my ears.

author: Slacker-Senpai
title: Not Bad
content: I'm a pretty active runner and boxer and these are absolutely perfect for the exercises I do on a near daily basis. When I would go on a run with normal headphones they would always pop out or my dumb arms would get tangled up in them. These headphones are great for running because they're lightweight and have a piece of rubber which wraps around your ear itself to keep hold. They are a bit uncomfortable at first if your ears aren't used to the plastic fitting that goes in the ear itself, but you will quickly get used to that. As for boxing I use these with music to keep rhythm when shadow boxing or using the heavy bag and they surprisingly stay snug in my ear during the high intensity movements, something other headphones aren't good at doing, plus no stupid cable to get in the way. The sound quality is amazing and the buttons are such a big help so I don't constantly have to pull my phone out and waste time fumbling to get in and change a song or artist I'm listening to. They also seem to handle swear well, and the battery life is phenomenal. I've gone 2 days without needing a recharge, meaning 2 full work outs and listening to music at work for 2 days. I couldn't be happier with this $20 pair of headphones.

author: Amanda S
title: Love these, especially for the price.
content:
These are good headphones for the price with a few exceptions.

When they are low battery, you might as well stop using them, this is especially frustrating mid workout.  They will continue to beep and tell you low battery every minute or two and then eventually shut off.  There is not way to gauge how much charge they actually have.

The loops to go around your ear are also worthless, they don't even touch you ear and the earbuds themselves stick out about an inch or so from your ear so they look a bit ridiculous.

Overall quality and sound however is good and they do stay in place.  I have yet to do any outdoor runs but on a walk, the wind was definitely an interference.

***EDIT for 1 year use***
I stand by my past review but would like to update even further after almost 1 year of use.  The loops around your ear, I will edit to say, I found if I twist the entire piece back they sit much better.

This update is mainly for their customer service.  One ear bud fell off while I was at the gym, not sure how but it was hanging by the wire.  I contacted Otium and reference their 1 year warranty.  They gave me the best customer service, emailing promptly with updates and I received a brand new pair not even a week later.  I'd buy from them again and again.

Oh, and I have yet to run with them outdoors so I still am not sure about wind interference there.  I'm guessing it should be fine though.

author: 42 Cogs
title: Met Expectations Plus!
content:
It's been just under a year since I bought these an I am just now getting to a point where I need to replace them.  I use them during work, a complete shift and it has kept its charge as promised.  Connection has been solid and accurate with the Stop/Play power switch.  Great noise-cancelling and fits comfortably around the ears.
I honestly think these would've lasted longer but, like I mentioned, I literally used these every day through my work day.  I work in commercial printing and I'm constantly moving, throwing cases and handling paper.  The cord between both ear pieces I think started to become strained and, although they technically still work, the sound is now shoddy when I move my head about.
On that note, I also will at times keep only one ear piece in while listening to podcasts and the second piece easily "clips" to my collar.  Worth every penny.  I'm aiming to get two more so I have some for the house as well as work.

author: Jenn
title: They lasted so briefly, that they almost seem disposable...
content:
Liked them well enough for the price...until they died on me less than three months after purchase for no discernable reason. I haven't reached out to customer support yet, but the fact that they simply stopped with no warning was very upsetting.

It doesn't respond when I click the power button or when I plug it into my computer or a wall plug for charging. When plugged in for charging, the light goes to red briefly before going blue; which is not how it worked before today. In the past my wireless headphones have been replaced due to simple loss, and this is the first time one died on me, much less so quickly.

Very dissapointing.

author: L. Green
title: These are great headphones if you hate music
content:
I am not an audiophile. I can't imagine shelling out $100+ on nice headphones. I have an $8 pair of wired Panasonic earbuds that I think are great (minus the annoying cord) -- and indeed, those are my baseline for comparison purposes with the Otium headphones.

The Otium headphones are inferior to my $8 earbuds in every possible way except for the fact that they do not have a cord that gets tangled as easily. The noise that comes out of them is flat and lacks richness. It has plenty of bass -- especially if you turn the volume up -- but it's like they had a meeting and said, "If we crank the bass, nobody will notice the otherwise-terrible sound quality!" I was listening to new music and hated all of it because of the quality issues and the small, nearly-imperceptible skips in the playback (I'm on a hardwired fiber connection; it isn't my internet). To say that these earbuds play "music" is like calling pasta sauce smeared on a saltine cracker "pizza." And again, this is from someone who thinks $8 earbuds are great.

And let's just say I got a defective model, and they don't all sound this bad (I think they all sound this bad; mine sounded bad but not "holy cow this is defective!" bad): these are SUPER UNCOMFORTABLE. The only adjustment you can make to the fit is by changing out the rubber tips. That's better than nothing, but since the over-ear piece is entirely non-adjustable, all the weight (and relatively speaking, it is a lot of weight) sits on your inner ears. I don't think I could wear these for more than an hour or two before I'd have to take a break from them. I also find myself wishing there was a joint between the "ball" of the earbud and the bulkier, outer-ear piece, which might make it easier to get a better fit.

The good: they came with few extra sets of rubber tips in different sizes, a nice case, a little cord-keeper (to help take up some of the slack in the cord between the ear pieces), and they were packaged in a cardboard box instead of a plastic clamshell (thank you!)

**UPDATE**
The seller contacted me in response to this review to offer to send me a new pair of headphones because I found the first ones so unsatisfactory. They did not ask me to change my review, which I appreciate. I'm not taking them up on the second pair because regardless of sound quality, I don't think they'll be any more comfortable than the first pair, but I appreciate their effort to resolve the issue and have left feedback saying as much on their seller page.

author: KN4TX
title: Good Headphones (at the Price) for Running
content:
I'm on my 3rd pair of Otium headphones. Here's the good and bad. Great battery life, lasts for several running sessions before needing to charge. Provides battery level on my phone under the bluetooth settings. Nice to know battery status, as there is no other indicator.
The sound quality is good.
The buds don't insert far enough in my ear to act as sound canceling headphones, which means they don't work well in loud environments. I use them while running, so they generally work just fine. They do appear sweatproof.
As I said, this is pair #3. My original set stopped working cold after about 6 weeks. I reported the problem and was shipped a replacement pair and received them in about 2 days. Great customer support. I've not had a similar issue with pairs #2 or #3.
My only real issue is the fit. My left ear canal must be "normal," as the bud inserts cleanly and the ear clip holds the bud in just the right place. My right ear must NOT be 'normal' because I never seem to get the same snug fit. Oddly, it fits better when I wear the lanyard in front of me rather than behind my neck. There is no angle adjustment or clip adjustment (as far as I can tell), so after a long run, I find the right earphone begins to slip in and out as I sweat more and more. But it works well enough that for the price, it's hard to beat.
As for why I had to get another pair (pair #3), my second pair was stolen along with my wallet from my car. I would guess it is a good sign that I like these headphones since I bought another set to replace the ones that were taken.

author: Chris
title: Company does not honor the warranty...
content: These headphones worked for a couple of months and then died.  They will no longer take a charge or operate.  Although the company did answer my email and ask for my address on November 26th, they have not honored their warranty; and they have not answered 3 follow up emails. Basically money thrown down the drain.  I am going to try and call Amazon corporate to complain and ask for a refund.

author: DT
title: Value for the money.
content:
Battery life seems to be pretty good, I generally start using then around 8am and at noon they're still at 90%.

The Bluetooth pairing is quick, the range seems decent have walked 30-40' away, also walked about 20' away with a wall between my phone and them and connection remained.

I'm no audiophile, the quality of the sound isn't terrible, a bit bassy so it can sound muddy at times. I adjusted the EQ on my phone and it helped.

They slightly larger than powerboats and the earhooks are just soft rubber so there's no shaping them. Overall they seem to stay in there ear.

The case is your typical free accessory case but doesn't feel super cheap. Comes with plenty of extra buds of various sizes and ofcourse a short charging cable.

Cant speculate on the life but still worth the price in my opinion.

author: Rocky
title: Updated: 7/10/17 ... Best $20 or $40-50) in-ear Bluetooth headset you'll find anywhere.
content:
Ok, Yes, I'm surprised by this little dynamo.

(Updated 7/10/17 at bottom)

I am not a huge fan of most in-ear headsets, so i was already sitting on low expectations.  These came today, even though Amazon said they'd come tomorrow (yes, Jul 4? They deliver?)  Anyway, they arrived.  I will probably mention this again, but these cost $20.

Now, i reviewed over the ear headphones that were sub-par in every category, so these couldn't be any good, right?

Opened the box, a cute little hard case with a carabiner to attach to something.  The headphones, and 2 extra ear bud sizes and a short USB.. So, all the basics and really the case is not bad if you don't want them in your pocket.a little big but thats being picky.

Upon inspection, about the only negative thing I'll say is the L / R letters are printed really small... come on guys.  Do better than 3pt type for us not young guys.

I should disclose I'm an audio guy, so I know music, and know what sound should sound like.

I'll lead off with the good, since there's no real bad. Without BS, these are maybe the best <$100 BT in ear buds i've heard.  Better than Bose?  Nah, but who is?  But, for the price, these beat a wide array of other headphones I've tried and/or own myself. Many cost a lot more.

I don't like stuff in my ears, and while I don't really like these, they are tolerable for more than a few min.  I've left them in for 2 hours and still they're ok.  These look kinda cool, are comfortable, the ear loop keeps them on without even loosening.  It is just silicone so it won't conform but it fit me ok as is.  The buttons are all on the right ear, no extra piece on the wire. Main button does most everything with a rocker for vol up and down. Minor nitpick, it seems backwards to me. + vol should be forward, holding them, it looks correct, wearing them it's backwards.  A voice tells you what you did.  It dings when you're at min/max sound. Automatically quiets on phone sounds like email or text messages.. Goes off if the phone rings.

Oh but how do they sound? Wow.. Just fabulous.  With really low expectations I was shocked.  Rich, clear tone without overbearing, enough bass without adding it electronically, sharp enough without adding it, even sounds well balanced with EQ off.  IF you know who Jennifer Nettles is, she was the lead in Sugarland.  Her voice is unique and has a really distinct edge to it.  Just sounded perfect.  Leonard Cohen has a deep, raspy voice, and he sounds perfect.  Alicia Keys singing Fallin, breathtaking.  Elle King rocks.  I tried a few test tracks and they all were within optimum target ranges..  which means the sound is reproduced in the way it was supposed to sound.  Subtle sounds like an oboe don't fall off.  Music sounding like it's supposed to sound is kinda cool.

FYI.. These don't have ANC, but if you fit them correctly, it blocks out a lot of ambient noise, honestly more than the ANC headphones i didn't like much.  I have the TV on and at a moderate volume, with music playing i don't hear the tv at all .

The rest: Decent phone sounds on both sides, in-ear was pretty good, checked the phone side and also decent.

Ok, I should point out I PAID for these..  I am not being paid for this review, nor did i get these for free.  Maybe they'll send me a 2nd pair.. :)  I almost bought a different pair, but found these and figured it was worth trying them.  Glad i did.

Basically, the bottom line best $20 or double/triple that headphones you'll ever buy.  ! Really.  (Amazon don't block this review for being too good, i paid for these)

Im still wearing these, guess I have to take them off to sleep. :)

Update:  I just got back from a trip to sauna-land in Florida.  I used my new pals, my Otium Headphones, and i still love them, but one very disturbing problem was discovered.  Since the vendors read this stuff and are very concerned with these reviews, maybe they can fix it.  This isn't a deal breaker, but i feel it's enough of a problem it could change your mind.

According to my BT power app, when these headphones hit 30% power, a low battery alert started endlessly repeating ever 4-5 min.  It basically makes listening to music til they die untenable.  Out of curiosity, i ran them down with music playing and power on, i just didn't listen, and they continued to work for over 3 more hours.  They were still playing when i went to sleep, so i never really determined how much longer they lasted before the battery died. I don't think we need to know the battery is low at 30% and certainly don't need to know this every few minutes until they die . So basically, you can only use these for 70% of the decent battery life.

They need to fix this, maybe change it to battery life about 2 hours left and another at 1 hour.  after that, it just dies.. We don't really need to know they have 3+ hours left as low power every few min. ! Fix this and these will be way better than they already are, which is really good.

author: AJKahn
title: Great headphones for the price, but...
content:
UPDATE #2: I cannot say enough about the awesome customer support they have but they are supporting a flawed product in the end. I cannot recommend these headphones at all. On my second pair, that the customer support sent me for free, I haven't noticed any ringing sound, but there seems to be something more sinister in the back. I have felt that wearing these for longer periods puts some kind of strain in my eyes/nose area. I went back to the first pair and I could feel the same there too. I tried other wireless headsets that I have and I don't have this issue with those. Now I'm not sure this is due to bad shielding or what but this is indeed something I felt every time I wore these. I'm sure a lot of people wouldn't feel this way as I didn't see much about this in the reviews. I feel sorry for the support team as they're awesome people, but the product is too flawed to support. I'd say back to the drawing board Otium.

UPDATE #1: Without ever contacting the support, they spotted this review and were able to get back to me. Their support was quick, apologetic and understanding. They were kind enough to send a new pair of headphones and even extended the warranty to 2 years. I will update this review again once I've tested out the new headphones, but I must say that for a $20 pair of headphones, their customer support is better than most retail giants. 5* for customer support. I'll add the last star in once I've verified the new pair. Thank you OTIUM!

Beware of the issues affecting these. Was wearing mine to listen to an audiobook at night and now they have started making a ringing noise. It's subtle, in the background, but very annoying and somehow makes it uncomfortable to keep wearing for longer periods due to the persistent noise. It has only been 4+mo since I got them, so I cannot do Amazon return and cannot find otium contact for warranty. Will keep searching...

Otherwise the battery life is excellent and the build quality is what you can expect for a $20 piece. Good overall only if it wasn't for the ringing noise issue.

author: Andy
title: For $20, these are hard to beat
content:
I own 2 sets of these, and they work well enough for my needs. For the price, you really can't expect much more.

PROS:
-Decent battery life (~7 hours max, which will decay over time)
-Decent sound quality. Not spectacular, but probably more than good enough for most people
-Fits my ears well and stay in place. And I have weird ears and am picky about this.

CONS:
-Sometimes has issues connecting, especially if you consistently switch controlling devices.
-The "max volume" alert sound  is LOUD, high-pitched and painful. There is no reason for this and is a bad design
-Outgoing voice quality is mediocre, as you might expect, but clear enough to be understood.

author: Timothee Ward
title: I forget that I'm wearing them sometimes.
content: Looks larger than your average Bluetooth headphones, but seemingly lighter. Slightly disappointed by the size, after putting them on, became instantly pleased how light, very fitting and comfortable these are. The first sound test after easily connecting, was near perfect to my ears. My hearing is still pretty good for my age so I like a headphone set that isn't high pitched at virtually any level. When I need that big sound during exercise, these have the power without leaving your eardrums tired also. They've never fallen off during walking , running or during any other intense, prolonged movement. I purposely tried to shake them off and ended up in a serious dizzy spell.(Not recommended.)  Sweat won't make them slip either. Labeled as left and right buds, for those of us that suddenly get confused.  Reception range is good too, no matter what side of your body the connected device is on. That was always an issue with previous headsets, constant connectivity during movement. One touch to answer an incoming call or just to ignore it without having to grab your phone. Built in mic also has crisp sound to it. The Otium Bluetooth headphones very much feel like they were specifically designed for my ears. I forget that I'm wearing them sometimes. Until you accidently jump in the shower with them on. Did I mention that they're waterproof.

author: detroitartis
title: Instantly broke.
content: The left ear phone popped in half while pressing it into my ears. Oh well I guess I get what I pay for.

author: Caroline C.
title: These worked great until they broke within the first two weeks of ...
content: These worked great until they broke within the first two weeks of use. They seem to be cheaply made. Very disappointing.

author: AmazonFreak
title: Works well until it no longer hold charges
content:
I love this headphone. Convenient for all-purpose uses especially the use in the gym or in the car.  Good sound quality at a fair price. I have run through 5 pairs of this headphone in the last 4 years.  I kept a backup pair at any time because I lose it from time to time during traveling.  You may ask why I rate it 2 stars.  It would have been a 5 stars, if it were not that at my 4th pair, after several months use, it stops holding charges and became not usable.  Then I bought another same pair, I got the same problem.  After about three months of usage, suddenly it stops to hold charges just like the last one.  It seems their last year batch of the products are not as high quality as the old ones.
 Since this costs less than $20, spending time to call customer service about warranty amid a busy work schedule and constant deadlines is a pain.  I decide to move on to another brand of similar form of bluetooth headphone.  It seems after stick with Otum for 4 years, I am glad to see there are now more alternatives at similar or even lower price point with similar form factor, and similar or even better user reviews.  I will give it a try and see how it goes.

author: Barberella
title: Free earwax!
content: Ew! I got these headphones today and they looked already used wth crusty earwax in the ear piece. YUCKIE. Horrible waste of money. Shame on you for selling used garbage! Please look at the image below and see the chunk of someone’s earwax on my windowsill between the ear pieces.

author: Nicole Bourdon
title: Great Headphones for the Price
content:
This headphones are big and bulky, so I use them as my backup headphones rather than as my main pair. I have more than one pair of Bluetooth headphones, and in comparison, these are actually pretty good. This pair has a better battery life than my other pair (6 hours continuously), the sound is better, and they're even cheaper. I paid twice as much for my other pair. I like them and hope they last a while.
These headphones have this feature where if I turn up the volume all the way it will beep at me. It's really annoying, but that seems to be a feature on all new headphones. The sound is pretty smooth when I'm at work, but they really don't like my kitchen. When I'm using them while cooking they'll skip and sometimes even disconnect themselves altogether. Other than that, they're a decent pair of headphones that I will probably buy again.

author: Annie
title: Great sound quality
content:
These arrived on time. The quality is really good. They came with a rounded container that has extra ear buds that you can safely secure the headset in and it has a clip so you can attach it to your pant loop or backpack/purse.
They easily paired to my phones bluetooth. The sound quality is great no issues. And it has a great connection range. I could leave my phone on the charger in a separate room and was still able to use the headset. They're comfortable and had no issues keeping them in my ears.
I would recommend these as the price is fair, great sound, great connectivity, and they're comfortable.

author: Michael B.
title: Great battery life and sound quality for the price!
content: I was looking for wireless bluetooth headphones that I could connect to any of my devices and easily listen to music or take a phone call while working on computers etc.. I tried a few headphones out that were more expensive then tried these and all I can say is wow. I've never had an issue with them disconnecting once unless I go really far away from the device. Sound quality is extremely good considering the price tag. Battery life is shocking, i have other wireless headphones that might last 6 hours, these last minimum 8 hours easy and don't take that long to recharge. These are the best wireless headphones I have and I'm about to buy another set, not because of a failed set but because I lost a pair (my own fault).

author: Magpie
title: Just one terrible flaw
content:
I've had these for two years now, and they're still working great. They're comfortable enough to wear for a couple of hours at a time, the sound quality is good, and they've never fallen off. The battery life is also amazing, but that's part of their worst flaw: the "battery low" alert and the power on/power off/connected/disconnected messages. When any of these thing's happen, a recorded woman's voice announces it to you, and no matter what the volume of your ear buds or device is set to, she says it at the HIGHEST POSSIBLE VOLUME. I've learned to always turn them on and connect them BEFORE actually putting them in my ears, but every once in a while they scream BATTERY LOW and shatter my eardrums out of nowhere. It's horrid and I wish Bluetooth device manufacturers didn't do this.

These are a great product for a great price, and I guess the tradeoff is that sometimes they just deafen you. Maybe put these on the charger right after you use them.

author: APrime Tower
title: Not the best. But cheap.
content:
I got these to try out the Bluetooth headphones for gym and to see if I would like that loop around the ear before purchasing a more expensive brand.
The loop is really big. I don't have small ears so I find it odd that it fits big. I don't feel like it would stop it from falling, but if its as good as a regular in-ear, I dont think it will fall off in the first place, I just find the loop pointless.
The sounds is slightly muffled. So no it doesn't have good audio quality. When I played music at a high volume, the bass seems to over power the sound and makes a crackling sound.
I got it on sale and still think my other cheap in-ear headphones (not bluetooth) work better than these.
First time pairing it to my phone took forever. After several attempts, finally it appeared on my phone's list of devices. It kept blinking and all like it said in the manual. It just wouldnt appear.
The good thing is that once you power them on again, they connect quickly and automatically to your device.
Now this is just hours of using them. I will give them a test at the gym, but I'm not sure if I can get passed the muffled audio.

author: Cat
title: Ill-fitted and quick to fall out
content: I have problems with regular headphones/earbuds falling out of my ears when I work out, so I was really hoping that by buying a pair marketed for "sports," "gym," "running," and "workout," I'd be getting a pair that could actually stay on my ears through some activity (especially since these also had the clips that go around the ear). Unfortunately, the clips are loose enough that they're basically just decorative, and the earbud piece is angled such that it won't actually go in when the clips are on but just sort of sits on the outside of the ear. (And yes, I tried all the different sizes of earbuds they came with, none of them making matters any better.) One quick shake of the head and they fly right off. I can't comment on the sound quality, because as soon as I found they weren't going to stay on I boxed them back up to return.

author: JK
title: A Nice Alternative
content:
These are an alternative to expensive wireless sports earbuds. As such, I have included price point in my four star rating. Let’s be clear that had I paid 150 or 200 for these then the rating would be lower. But I didn’t pay 150 or 200, and as such let’s begin the review.

Sound
+ they have plenty of kick
+ sound quality is better than expected
- I wouldn’t say a lot of bass as much as I would say llacking mids and highs.
- Their lowest volume is a bit high (strange complaint I know but true nonetheless).

Fit
+ you can squeeze the hooks to make them a bit smaller so sort of adjustable which helps
+ Good assortment of bud sizes
+ cord is just long enough to be able to turn head etc
+ they don’t fall off, stay on during running exercising
- tend to pull away a bit as you move around but so do other more expensive pairs

Connectivity
- originally had issues with sound stuttering and unstable connection
+ followed suggestions left by company in other reviews on how to reset device and connection issues indeed went away.

Overall conclusion
More expensive pairs may sound better but the more expensive pairs all have durability issues that make me stay away from them.  These have decent sound at a fantastic price point, and for me they are a no brainer. You even get a case!

author: Clayton
title: Too cheap
content:
Good price! Overall pretty cheap though. The volume up button wore out after about a year. If you get a good seal with the earbuds it makes the bass way to much for my liking. Connectivity is great.

Update: The company sent me replacement headphones after I posted the original review. I noticed something with the new ones. The original earbuds seem to make the bass sound much better. I had lost the original on my old pair and replaced them with generic earbuds but that made them sound way to bassy. Overall I’m very happy with the new pair and the customer support.

05/14/2019 Update
An earbud in the second pair went out in the first few months. Customer support hasn’t been helpful the second time around. Not sure I can suggest these. Too cheap.

author: Diana
title: My go to earphones now
content:
This is my favorite. Girlfriend got them for me so we can call each other especially since we drive and move quite a bit and our hands are always busy. Loved the pair she got me that I bought myself another pair.

Pros:
Easy to use if you're not familiar with wireless earphones
Sound is great and loud
Lasts for hours and is really quick to charge

Cons:
My dog thought it was a chew toy

Tip: uses any micro USB charger and charge these earphones before going out!

author: molly astin
title: Absolutely the worst
content: I've bought about 15 different types of headset Bluetooth devices, for friends and family, as well as personal use. These were the worst. They wouldn't charge up properly, (after using the proper charging cord for the recommended time, I tried other, compatible cords and charged them even longer than 8 hours).  They would not establish contact with my phone, or any other device I tried, including the car.  A lot of people write bad reviews because they don't read the instructions, or don't buy the correct item for what they need. I know about Bluetooth technology, and while these aren't expensive, there's much better ones that actually function for much less. Unfortunately, I was hospitalized and missed the return window; there's always a chance it was a defective item. Nonetheless, it was a waste of money.

author: Johnazon
title: Great overall , Minor shortcomings...
content:
These are very easy to pair to your Bluetooth.  Your phone will find the otium headset right away and you just click to pair them up. Done.

They turn themselves off after a period of no use to save battery. I always forget they're off and start playing pandora on my phone and it starts playing out my phone speaker lol.

Easy to charge, red light when charging, blue when charged.  Doesn't seem to take very long to charge and they last all day at work, 9 hours off and on.

They have volume up/down, skip, pause, and power on/off on the same headpiece all works great. You can even take calls with it. I even butt dialed someone lol. Only negative here is the volume buttons are somewhat unresponsive so I find myself clicking it twice or holding it longer which then either repeats or skips the song which isn't what I wanted to do.

It comes with three sets of earpieces and a nice zippered carry case.

Reviews on Amazon were overall positive however I wondered how they compare to other Bluetooth headphones. My coworker has the same phone I do, and she has the $140.00 beats audio headphones made by Apple. Her sound clarity 'may' be a little better, she felt like she could tell a difference.  I would hope so since she spent 7x what I did.  I wasn't sure if there was a noticeable difference but I can say the Otium headphones sound the same as the apple earbuds that came with my phone which is fine by me.  The only negative would be the Bluetooth. It's fine at my desk at work but you can't walk more than 20-30 feet away from your phone.  My friend could walk twice as far away and through a door and she said hers was still clear while the Otium clearly breaks up at 20-30 feet. These also occasionally break up at my desk and I think the pairing looses connection momentarily but then fixes itself.  For listening to pandora without a wire I'm not going to complain but it may be important to you.

For under $20 I am very pleased and don't worry about losing or breaking these lol.

author: Hannah
title: Great little bt headset
content:
Update!
Since I have purchased these, I am just now charging them. Out of the box, these things come with a lot of juice, and that is really really nice.  I also turned them off as soon as I wasn't using them, even if I still kept them on my neck, since it is super super simple to turn them on an off and pairing takes literally two seconds. The sound is still amazing, and I actually had to re-adjust to my corded headphones sound again since these have been my new primary headphones. Still pleased that I bought these!!!!!

For the price these little things are pretty powerful. I just wish they came with another pair of over ear hooks (these ones are a smidge big for my ears!). The build quality out of the box feels sturdy and it has a smooth finish on it. The sound wont win any awards, but for the price and what i need it for, it isnt bad for me personally. Overall, really good

author: Richard
title: Great value for BT sport earphones
content: I have (what I presume to be) the previous version of these headphones (Bluetooth Headphones, Otium IPX7 Wireless Running Headphones w/Mic HD Stereo Sound Waterproof Sweatproof Sports Gym Workout Earphones 8 Hour Battery Noise Cancelling Earbuds.  Those are good, and these are definitely a step up.  The speed of the earphones (power on/off, BT connection) are faster on this model (not that this matters too much, but it is a marked improvement).  The sound is more crisp and clean, and as with the previous model, the noise cancelling is pretty solid for $20.  I had an issue with the previous model slipping off my ear and trouble with it staying in my right ear, but this model stays put.  I can't say for sure why, but this newer model feels lighter and less bulky than the previous model.  If you're looking for a cheap set of BT earphones for working out, you can't go wrong with these.

author: Reinmakr
title: Has great sound for the price
content:
Last update.  Sound quality on this headset is amazing. For the price, no complaints. The only real complaint, is that they do not stay in your ear when you are exercising. If you're looking for something to just casually listening to music, these would be great.

*update - love these.  They were slipping out.  I thought I needed to go down in size on the earbuds, when in fact I needed to go up a size. They did not pop out at all in my workout this morning in the sound was even better. These are a hit for the price.

I'm torn between a 2 or 3 star.  Has great sound for the price.  The problem is that they don't stay in your ears when you workout.  First time I wore them was at the gym.  Start to get that workout on and they fall out.  Several times I had to stop, towel them off and try again.  I would not recommend these for the gym.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Good for the price
content:
Pros:
-lasted a while for the price
-good sound quality and keeps our external noise pretty well
-comes with different sized earbuds (my ears are small)
-had some trouble with the connecting wire going to one side and tugging, but as long as I make sure it isn’t twisted before I put the headphones in I don’t have that problem
-pairs and connects very quickly (and also tends to beat out other things I might already have connected to my phone)
-stays in well when exercising; I’ve worn it during lifts, ergs, and runs
-I’ve seen some reviews that express dissatisfaction with the range, but I’ve been happy with mine. It gets a little iffy around the end of the advertised range especially if there are solid objects in the way, but otherwise I’m very satisfied with the range

Cons:
-I bought this in October 2018, it’s now August 2019 and they suddenly aren’t charging properly anymore. I know it’s not the cable or the charging port as they both work with other things, the charging light just doesn’t turn on/takes a long time to turn on so I feel like they’re not charging. Don’t know if this might be because of sweat in the headphone charging port?
-has decent battery life but only warns you of low battery when it’s literally almost dead, and it does so extremely loudly
-I sweat a lot, and sometimes sweat goes into my ear and makes the earbud extremely uncomfortable. Overall moisture wicking works pretty well though

author: Emilee
title: Good for media, not so much for calls?
content:
First, let me say that I LOVE these headphones and that my issue may be with Skype rather than the headphones. I'm still trying to figure that out.

Anyway, they're great headphones. Comfortable, amazing sound quality for media, and the adjustable volume separate from my phone and computer's sound is great for me. I love them! They're great for media, but the call quality leaves a lot to be desired. My girlfriend, who I talk to on Skype, says the mic quality isn't great but it's not terrible. I'm still trying to figure out if my problem is with Skype or with the headphones, though. As soon as I know, I'll definitely update!

UPDATE: It's definitely the headphones that have the issue. That said, I still LOVE these and use them often at work... Or I did, until my dog chewed on the earpieces. 😒 But, I like these so much, I'll be buying another set!

author: Fidel Vasquez
title: Hip earbuds
content: Bought them as a replacement for another headset that stopped working. Function as intended, found no issues. Holding the button to turn it on or off or just changing the song works without any concerns. It doesn't completely cancel noise so it's good for those who want some environmental awareness. When the volume goes to high, it will inform the user of the risks of hearing noises loudly. This can get annoying as you need to press okay on the notification to increase the volume. Once if reaches the highest volume, it will beep loudly which really hurts and its annoying. The charge takes 2:30 hours but it really last a long time so l can't complain about it.

author: Kami Mijares
title: Awful
content: Sound cut in and out constantly , no matter how close the headphones were to the computer or phone they were being used with. Sound quality wasn't great either.

author: Albi
title: Amazing earphone for a great price
content:
This is definitely one of the best and most value (under $20) earphone I have ever bought.  At first, I was a little worry about the sound quality, but after tested it for several days, I have to say the sound quality is definitely better than I have expected (music is loud and crispy clear)

In addition, I really like it has physical button to control everything.  Compared with Air pod, which you have to control everything mainly through Siri (it can be painful sometimes when Siri does not respond correctly), I can basically control everything with few clicks of buttons.

Other advantages I like about this earphone are the fast Bluetooth connectivity to iPhone, and its water proof capability.  I can connect earphone to my IPhone in just a few seconds (faster than air pod), and it has water proof capability to fight against sweat and suitable for any sport exercise.

For the battery, it can last around 5-6 hours.  I usually charge the headphone 1-2 times a week.
For the price it worth ($20), I highly recommend this headphone to anyone who is looking for  a decent sport earphone.

author: labdesigner
title: Good, a little awkward
content: These are a little awkward to put on. You have to figure out L/R, then loop it over your ear, and around the back of your head. And then flip your hair over it if you have long hair. Then get the other side on. Once on they are comfortable. They don't block sound like our Bose noise cancelling earbuds, but they work well enough for most uses. Still deciding if we'll keep them as I purchased these for my 9 year old, and awkward and 9 don't mesh very well. Or I may keep them for myself to get away from all the wires of my ear buds for a fraction of the price of the air pods price.

author: Arthur
title: Great Value!
content:
The headphones sound great! The bass is very clear, and it helps block out environmental noise. The waterproofing is great, I don't have to worry about sweat or rain at all. These are my first wireless headphones, so I can only compare them to wired headphones. Not having to worry about wires when working out is very convenient. When you need to take off one or both headphones, the cord clip lets you dangle the headphone off your neck and shoulders.

I have been using these headphones for a couple of months by now. About a week ago, one of the outer covers for one of the head buds got disconnected. I contacted the seller and they were able to fix the problem right away. While the headphones are solidly built, they are not indestructible. If you need to keep them in a backpack or pant pockets, use the protective case that they send you!

Pros:
Great clear sound
Waterproofing
The cord clip
Carrying case
Customer service

Cons:
Battery warning (other reviews may comment about it)
Needing to be charged (vs wired headphones)

Overall it is a great deal for what you pay for it. It was my first experience with wireless headphones, and they surpassed my expectations.

author: HimmelBlau
title: Durable, long battery life, stay in position but sound quality can be better
content: I am using a wireless headphone with earbuds for my workout all the time. Recently, the one that I have been using suddenly dead. So I purchased one from Amazon based on the product reviews. It worked but the control button and battery section dangling on the right side ear bud was too heavy and when I run or move the right earbud pulled out to the point that I cannot really enjoy my workout. So I purchased this one with the extra supporting hook. Also there is nothing on the cable between earbuds. I had this for about a week and tried 3 times during my workout and I am very happy with it. It stays where it should be. Battery last long and the batter hold time is superb. One thing I do not like about it is that it sound kind of muffled with the high frequency side deteriorated. I can still use this for workout, but to only enjoy good sound, I would use my bigger and better fullsize head phone.

author: Retsel
title: They sound great!
content: Wow, I didn't expect much from these, just based on the price however, I decided to give them a try.  I am blown away.  I am by no means an audiophile but I have tried many versions of ear buds.  I have owned several Sure, ME, Jabar, and Bose. Some wired as some wireless.  I have to say these Otium are impressive.  Plenty of bass.  Mid range and vocals are clear.  I don't hear the highs as clearly as I use too but do not detect any defects in these earbuds.  Additionally, the microphone is great.  I took several calls, while working, and asked all callers if they had any problem hearing me and none had any issues.  My wife said she actually thought they sounded better than the mic on my Motorola Android phone.  The advertised "noise canceling" is a bit confusing.  I don't  think they can be called "noise canceling".  With the proper ear tips they do "block noise" effectively.  "Canceling" to me implies "electronic cancelation".  These do not do that.  Regardless, for the money, and maybe 3 times the money, these are great earbuds.  One more point, they are not small.  I ride motorcycles and there is no way you could fit these in a full face helmet.  Just so you know.  That aside, for work or while excersizing these are great Bluetooth earbuds.  You will not go wrong buying them.

author: Gretzky99
title: Great price for good BT head phones
content: These things are awesome for the price.  Yes the headphones die within a short time after the lady says "battery low" but for the money I can live with that.  Average battery life seems to be at least 4-6 hours so far.  The controls are not intuitive at all though.  Hold the button for power on/off - OK that makes sense.  Tap the button to pause - also makes sense.  Tap twice (easily done by accident as the unit takes a one Mississippi to pause) - it redials your phone?!?  As with the weird battery life, though, at this price, I will live with the issue.

author: The Anderson Family
title: Great sound but should come with a strong warning
content: They have great sound. They are a little bulky as sometimes I put sound mufflers on over and then the earbuds hurt to wear then. Nor can I sleep comfortably in these. I can have my music on low playing on my device and go to turn it up on the earbuds and when I accidentally hit the highest setting a horrible beep sounds and it feels like my eardrum is going to be shattered. Or if I am wearing them and connect it to my device. That beep just ruins the experience of wearing them. The wrap around the ear part can annoy me some times. Also not very good at noise cancellation. It isolates some noise from being pushed into the ear but that is all.

author: Shianna
title: Well Rounded Design
content: I have had two pairs of these headphones now (the first pair got lost...) and at first, I was sceptical due to the low price but they have proved to be a great buy. The sound quality is amazing and very clear. The battery life lasts me all day at work ~8 hrs and sometimes even longer. They charge easily with a small cord, but I have tried using some of my galaxy phone charges and these also work, which makes it more convenient. I love how they loop around your ear it keeps them from falling out at the gym, but at the same time, they are incredibly comfortable. I also find it helpful to be able to answer or deny phone calls right with the push of the button on the side. Altogether these are my new go-to wireless headphones and I love them!

author: grayghostnc
title: Huge huge huge WOW FACTOR !!!
content: Never fear. These earbuds are for real. I was somewhat skeptical but quickly put at ease. These wireless headphones are very responsive with more than ample volume and range. Could the bass be a little heavier? Yes...but for just over $20, absolutely impeccable highs and lows. I tested the phone call feature. Works perfectly. Clear voice with one touch answer and hang up. Easily a $100 or more value in this power punch package. If you are on the fence...jump on in. The pool of warm bright vibrant sounds are fine and ready !!! Possible disappointments erased by huge WOW FACTOR !!!

author: Eben-ezer Orellana
title: Five Stars to One Star
content:
Awesome sound and awesome battery length.

Update: Feb 2018, the left side speaker no longer has any sound. Purchased in October 2017. I have emailed the company to see if they will honor their warranty

Update April 2018, replacement received no longer stays on. Will power off about 20 minutes into use. Still covered by warranty but now they are asking me to pay for shipping. I would not recommend you spend you money on this unless your ready to bear the hassle.

Update May 2018, Otium reached out to me via email due to my issues with their product (see above) and they were nice enough to send me a replacement without charge. The replacement is a new model X6 that has a neck rest. I will use and review according. I will increase my score due to great customer service.

Update end of May 2018: Replacement optium x6 only worked once. The second time, the volume kept going up on its own and then kept stopping and starting what I was listening to. Also no won't charge.
Unfortunately I think the best thing about all this is the company customer service over their faulty item.

author: JonSam
title: These are a solid pair of headphones with great bass. The life of my Plantronics Backbeat Go ...
content:
These are a solid pair of headphones with great bass. The life of my Plantronics Backbeat Go headphones came to an end, and I was super spoiled with the great bass they provided. So, when they stopped working, I was mega bummed because I didn't want to spend a lot on another pair.

I recently ordered an un-related generic pair from here on Amazon, but those had horrible bass and the Bluetooth reception was weak. Had to return those quick.

I will venture to say these Otium as just as good as the Plantronics I replaced, but the Plantronics cost me $100 at the time. Obviously, great value for these Otiums. It's very convenient that these Otiums have hooks to go around the ears, because when I am lifting a lot of weight in the gym I don't have to worry about them slipping out of my ears if there is too much blood pressure going to my head, as was the case with my Plantronics which had no ear hooks.

I am super pleased with this purchase so far.

author: Will
title: Product came in with great amount of alternative accessories and carrying case was really ...
content:
Product came in with great amount of alternative accessories and carrying case was really nice. Reason for 3 stars is that for some reason the bluetooth kept cutting in and out when I left the phone in my left pocket. The moment I placed it on my right pocket the signal got better but still a little glitchy. I'm sure I got a defective item since its rated at 30ft wireless streaming. Nonetheless, it's a great product when it worked.

Update: Otium has been in communication with me regarding my issues with the above. They were very nice and sent me a replacement pair with all the accessories included. I tested the new pair as I did the previous one and didn't encounter the same issue under the same conditions. But, I do experience some interference when I am at the gym. I try to replicate the interference in the same spot at the gym, different day, but the issue seems to come and go in random locations within the same gym.  Otium let me know that this may be interference with wifi.

Other than the random glitches above, the battery lasts a very long time, I charge it maybe once or twice a week. Audio and style are very good, and Otium customer service is exceptional. For this reason, I'm giving 5-stars.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Still going strong
content: I bought these in September 2017 to replace my beats.  I had two different pair of beats that broke or quit working.  I was able to exchange them, but it was a hassle and I was upset that such expensive earbuds kept giving out on me.  I decided to give these a try thinking if they broke I could just order another pair.  Wow!  I have been using them to run, work out or just listen to music for a year and a half and they are still going strong.  Because they were so inexpensive, I have not babied them.  I throw them in my gym bag, crunch them into my pocket, sit on them and otherwise abuse them and they take it all and keep going strong.  The beats I had seemed so fragile and they were so expensive I was always super careful with them and they still quit on me.  These have taken a "beating" (pun intended) and they still sound great.  I am not an audiophile and can't tell you about the bass or treble or "rich high notes" but I can tell you they play my music and they sound great to me.  If they ever quit on me, I will order another pair.

author: AS
title: Ok for price, but wouldn't repurchase
content:
These headphones work fine, especially for the price, but they have a few annoying issues. First, the spoken "battery low" notification startles me every time. The volume of the notification is noticably louder than whatever I'm listening to, even at the lowest volume setting.

Second, the battery level readings don't seem accurate at all. It seems to be at 70% most of the time, then suddenly drains to 30%, giving me the loud "battery low" notification, then a few minutes later the headphones are completely out of battery. I have no problem with the battery life itself, I just never have any idea of when I need to charge, until I get the notification which gives me maybe 15 minutes until the battery is completely dead.

Another thing I've had an issue with is that the headphones seem to get turned on really easily when I'm not using them, and as far as I can tell, they don't automatically shut off. To be fair, if I stored them in the case instead of just throwing them in my bag, they probably wouldn't get accidentally turned on so often.

As for the positives, the sound quality is decent enough for me, the headphones are comfortable, and the battery life isn't bad. These headphones are ok for the price, but when it's time to replace them I'll be looking for something new.

author: markysmoove
title: Good Quality knockoffs of the "beats" brand wireless sport buds.
content: Have low self-esteem and wanna look as cool as everyone else in the gym and don't want to spend over $100 for the "beats" brand?.....This is your product.  The best part is the quality of sound..... is best I have ever owned as far as earphones of any kind go.  I didn't even realize these were china knockoffs of the "beats" brand until a friend pointed it out to me in the gym.....Its just missing the little "b" and the black mic/ controller on the wire.  Worth the cost even if they break like people are reporting...I just treat them a little more delicately and haven't had an issue I recommend getting a proper case / holder for them to respect the fact that they may be delicate ......only down side I came across is that sometimes it has difficulty connecting to my iPhone Bluetooth after its already been paired at an earlier time...This happened only 2 times after 3 weeks of use.

author: NotSoDitzyDame
title: Surprisingly good for the low price point!
content:
I wasn't expecting such nice quality for the low price, so am pleasantly surprised on several key features:
1. Noise cancelling is EXCELLENT. Even without cranking the volume way up. They block noise as well as my headset with ear cups.
2. I have small ears, and the smallest of the three included silicone bud sizes actually fit in my ear reasonably well (during workouts they sometimes fall out, but between the over-the-ear piece and the plastic (vinyl?) connecting neck string -- it's unlikely to lose them).
3. The sound quality is quite good. And the microphone works perfectly! I was able to take a phone call without interrupting a workout, and my caller was surprised at how normal my voice and call quality sounded (until I started breathing hard, he had no clue I was on a headset and working out. Lol.). For music, they lack the bass and richness of high-end alternatives, but really the quality has no major flaws to my ear.

These were an impulse purchase while ordering a few other things, and really glad I got them!

UPDATE after 1+ month of heavy use: My one annoyance is inability to use these while they're charging. But since I'm getting around 6-hours usage from a full charge, can't complain too much.

And a really minor IMHO design flaw is that the vinyl/plastic cord attaching these to each other comes out the front of the buds, e.g. towards your face, to fall naturally in front of your throat, rather than from behind to fall more naturally at back of neck.

author: Michael J. McKenzie
title: Great headphones for the price
content:
I’m a pretty active fellow, some would say. I also enjoy listening to music while I do things and stuff. And this is why I needed Bluetooth headphones.

In the kitchen: I love cooking and listening to music with earbuds. And I have a good sized kitchen so I’m always going back and forth, opening and shutting drawers and cabinets. Then whammy!! The dang cords get wrapped around a handle and my buds pop out of my ears and dangle on the floor. Bummer.

Running: not so much fun having little cords whip my face with every step.

Shopping: yes, I’m one of those people who listen to music while shopping. I keep my phone in the cart with the list facing me but when I reach out further than the earbud cord goes, buds pop out or phone drops into the cart.

There it is. My life with corded ear buds. So why don’t I just get AirPods? Because I don’t want to fork over $160 for something I’m gonna lose. Instead I opted for the Otium wireless buds.

The cost is great. Not too expensive. They come in a round case with a variety of ear pads for different sized ears and a charging micro usb cord which is a bit ridiculously short.

The ear pads were a bit large for my large ears. I mean, really? I have, I guess, normal sized man ears, but a quick change to a slightly smaller size and the buds fit perfectly in my head holes.

After a quick charge I put them to good use. First off, pairing with my phone was quick and easy. After a read of the instructions, navigating the buttons on the right bud was pretty intuitive. The fit snugly in my head without feeling like something is tugging at me at all times. And the connection cord around my neck is negligible. All in all a good fit and very comfortable.

So what about sound? Not bad. With the larger ear pads everything sounded like it was solely treble, but when I got the right size and the buds fit normally I could finally hear some bass. Not much. But enough to make a difference.

The overall quality of sound is equivalent to the iPhone ear buds, sans the bass. I kept my phone either in my pocket or in my arm band and the sound never scratched or skipped a beat. Not sure how far I can go before the Bluetooth connection disrupts, but if you’re like me, your phone will be nearby at all times anyway.

I have an eclectic taste in music. I listen to everything from classical, to 80s rock or pop, rap, film scores, alternative, and more. I’m not expecting to hear the quality of a live orchestra, but for all intents and purposes these are a great pair of headphones.

I give this product four stars for overall quality of sound, function, design, etc. Four stars means if I need to replace them in the future, I may look for another product, but I’ll more than likely stick with these again.

author: Charles
title: Love these babies right here
content:
Love these babies right here!  I've been using a set of old Sony over the ear headphones for years.  My kid is 12...had them since before he was born.  So to say I have attachment issues is an understatement!  So I broke down and finally joined the new age.  I felt dirty at first to be honest.  Like I was cheating on my old Sonys.  But boy do I love these!  The battery life is pretty great.  I've connected these to my iPhone and my LG with no issues.  I sometimes layer up when working out.  So I put my phone in the pockets of my hoodies or sweat pants and these done miss a beat.  The range is really good as well for bluetooth.  For my rather large head they are really comfortable and stay in place.  When I do squats, clean and jerks and dead lifts the headphones dont move.  I had to change out the little ear buds to a larger size but that's okay it comes with the headphones!  I'm so use to having to move a cable out of the way for pushups or dips but with these its a breeze.  I cant speak about wearing these while jogging.  Quit frankly...I...don't...run!  So if your on the fence about these...just go ahead and jump off and buy!

Oh another thing Otium didn't give me a sweet pair of headphones for a "fair" review.  Nope I paid for these babies with my hard earned money!

author: RN
title: Good including their customer service!
content:
I initially gave these a low rating (one star rating) because they stopped working  4months after purchasing them. At the time, they would not power on, charge, connect, etc. I was pretty disappointed at first because I took care of them, kept them in the case and only charged when the battery was low. After posting my experience/rating Otium reached out to me. They offered to replace or refund the headphones with no hassles. I loved them so I requested a replacement and they shipped them to me that same day. The headphones may have had an issue, but things happen, but there customer service did a great job correcting the situation. So I’m confident that they stand behind their products & take care of their customers.

As far as the headphones, I like is the comfort around the ears and ease of use. The sound quality and the noise cancellation were good, They also worked good for running, but when I start sweating they sometimes slid out of position/ears & I have to reposition. Overall, these are a good buy.

author: Patrick
title: BATTERY LOW
content: So when i got the earbuds I was glad. I wasnt expecting much for the price but they can with extra ear tips and a nices csrbon fiber like case. The material of the earbuds is this softplastic type which makes them fine to have in you ears for a couple of hours. Sound is fine, i didnt expect much for the price and they do the job, not much to complain about there. The biggest con i found was, at least for my pair, the battery life was horrible, for the same price is bought wirless earbuds and some headphones that least way longer. At most im getting two hours of usage and the worse part is that the earbuds scream " BATTERY LOW" for ten minutes before they die no matter what you set the volume to. Other than that the earbuds are fine but the poor battery makes them feel extremely cheap

author: Tony Price
title: Want a great pair...
content:
Then buy these.  I literally have a drawer full of earbud Bluetooth headphones.  Some mediocre and others not so bad.  They all have one thing in common...they don't stay in my ears.  These simply do.  They are incredibly comfortable and stay put, but not only do they stay put but they stay snug in my ear keeping the bass pumping.  They are very easy to pair, easy to operate and feel solid and well made.  Many compare them to Beats in appearance and performance.  I have not tried Beats so I can't comment on performance comparisons.  I can, however, comment on the performance of these.

1.  Battery life is incredible.  The battery easily lasts all day.  Time to charge is about average.

2.  Bluetooth pairs easily and connects to both my Samsung S8+ and my iPhone 6S+ quickly.  The female voice that comfirms connection is fluid and natural not robotic or stuttering.  Bluetooth range is the best of any bluetooth headphone I've tried.  Outside it is easily exceeds the advertised 30'.  Inside the range will follow me from room to room.  it's not until I am almost across the house from the phone that I experience drops.  Otherwise, I have not experienced any drops, lag, or static.

3.  Sound is more than acceptable.  On the Samsung I have the capability of tailoring the sound with EQ settings that I don't have on the iPhone.  Despite this both phones provide solid bass and good highs.  For some midrange might be a little muddy.  But, that's also going to largely depend on how the source music your're listening to is mastered. These are not going to dethrone the Sennhiesers I have but they are quite capable headphones.  I hear nuances of a recording I miss with other earbuds.  I was not dissappointed with the sound of these earbuds.  Quite the contrary, I was pleasantly surprised.

Now let's be honest.  These are $20 earbuds.  While they perform as good or better than advertised if you really wanted audiophile quality you probably wouldn't be here.  But, the days of audiophile quality music has sadly suffered greatly in this day of mp3 compressed recordings with further compression from Bluetooth reducing music quality even further.  These earbuds will not disappoint with fit or sound making them a..err...sound investment.  Not to mention, $200 Beats are just as easy to break or lose as these $20 Otiums.  So tell me, which one will cause you to cry aligator tears if that happens?

author: PWA2600
title: Otium BT Headphones
content: I have only had these for a couple of days, and am satisfied with the product and inexpensive price point. I have Beats Wireless 3 headphones as well, but wanted to venture out and see how a cheaper priced pair would compare to Beats. Well overall I am satisfied, these headphones seem durable; granted I have not taken them to the gym yet. A couple things that I wish were improved upon are the over the ear stabilizers (if that is what they are called); in my opinion they seem flimsy/too flexible, so I am not sure until this afternoon how they will perform at the gym. It would also be nice if Optium would include a excess wire keeper like Beats or Jaybird. Sound quality is decent, the pair I received I needed me to tweak the Treble settings a bit, and also certain Bass frequencies tend to make the sound fizzle (not sure how to actually term it) The things I do like so far are: inexpensive price, larger power button (compared to Beats) and that these include a silicone plug to the USB charging port. My biggest complaint with Beats Wireless 3's is that after extensive exercise they will turn off on me, and I will need them to dry out for almost a week.  I tend to believe that may be the culprit to the battery issue. Lastly the carrying case is nice, the USB charging cable and different size ear pieces are included.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Of all the options I went back to this
content:
My first pair broke down on me do to not paying a attention on the heavy rain that was going to hit my area. And eventually loosing one side on the earbuds. But it lasted me almost a year.

Took it to the gym, ran, sweat, jump roped. And all was fine. I will admit that the wire connecting the earbuds  did swing on one side while working out ,which could of been fix by using the black tie that it came with. But I didn't bother to.

 You do get different earbuds size and even one that seem to do more of noise canceling. It's one of those spong like piece.

The battery life on these is beautiful:'). I would be on 1 hr bus ride to school,work out for like 2:30hr and still have some for the day and the way back home. When you run it may feel like it's slipping out but the ear hook those a good job in holding it in place and my ears are kind of small.

After losing my first pair I just had to by it again. The ear hook those a good kid, semi-noise canceling is appreciated ,battery life is a blessing. But overall it feel good!

author: Amazon Customer
title: Affordable headphones that look awkward but have solid sound quality and fit
content:
Solid bluetooth headphones. The buds fit in nicely and cancel out some noise (there are also extra earbuds of different sizes that come with the packaging; very convenient). The sound quality is good/clear for the price. The small circular container (4" diameter) that comes with the headphones looks good. Bluetooth pairing and charging are very simple to perform (takes 1.5-2 hrs to charge fully).
The cons are the big size of the headphones and the lack of wire length adjusting. I didn't realize how awkward the size of the headphones are, especially when you notice that many people nowadays have tiny bluetooth earbuds that are sleek and less prominent to the eye. These headphones look like unnecessary blocks outside your ears. No adjustments to the wire length is not that bad but it would have been preferable to have something to change up the length.
(*Note that both of these cons are pretty subjective and have slightly dampened my experience but may not matter to you.*)
Overall: very good bluetooth headphones at a significant fraction of the cost of more sleek-looking bluetooth ear buds

author: Gusr
title: They were good for a few days and then not
content: I received the headphones, charged them, and used them on 3 days for about 30 minutes per day (about 90 minutes.of playing) They sounded decent, not great but very acceptable for gym use IMO. The next day they worked fine for a 30 minute run and the next day they stopped working mid 30 minute run. The power button which always announced "power on connected" or "power off disconnected" wouldn't do anything; I put them back on the charger to check and the blue light came on indicating full charge. They never powered up again....dead! Total time to failure about 2 1/2 hours of playing time. Up until they failed I thought they were ok. Returned to Amazon for a refund.

author: Joel B.
title: Highly recommend
content:
These things are great for the price.
- Sound: The sound is clear, I can feel the bass, and I can hear them clearly over gym music or while on my motorcycle (they barely fit under a standard full-face helmet).
- Connection: Never had any serious issues. Every now and then the sound will skip when the battery is low. Worst cases were on a rainy 5 mile run and on my motorcycle, both cases are understandable. The range goes out to about 15 meters before cutting out a little.
- Battery: I use them for about 2 hours a day and they last me all week before I need to charge them. There isnt much warning when they're about to die though. Also, they do not turn off on their own, if you forget to shut them down, they'll drain the battery.
- Calls: the mic doesnt seem to pick up audio well during phone calls, but works in a pinch.

Overall, I'd highly recommend these for gym, casual listening, riding bikes, whatever. The sound quality is awesome, water resistant, durable, great connection, and you cant beat the price.

author: Erik Dean
title: Can't control volume BUT.....
content:
I LOVE these PeohZarr (Kaneye F9) headphones!

Here's some of the positives

Cheap ($39.99) but pretty good sound (for me at least).
They fit very well and are very easy to operate.
They live up to their IPX8 rating (I shower with them every day).
The battery life is good (3-4 hours) being able to charge them in their case in a couple hours is great when I'm on the go.
The "Multifunction Button" (MFB) took some getting used to but is pretty straightforward and intuitive.
I use an Android phone (Note 8) and usually use one headphone at a time and I haven't had any pairing problems at all even when swapping between the left and right earpieces.

The ONLY negative I have with these is that the volume can NOT be adjusted from the headphones although in thinking about it I'm not sure how that would be accomplished while using only one at a time. So I suffer with the first world problem of having to adjust the volume with my phone instead.

In short, for $39.99 these were a steal of a deal!

author: Gen2
title: Need a quality headset at a GREAT PRICE!
content:
