Ok these headsets are the bomb!!! I am always at the gym and I sweat a lot and have had to replace countless headsets due to them shorting out or not being able to keep up with the rigor of working out. I these  in my gym bag with all my stuff so they get throw around a lot and each day they are read to go. Sweat does not bother these headsets!!! The sound quality is awesome too. Nice way to tune out the noise of the gym and focus on some good music to make the workout more enjoyable. Never had these sets die on me and I am in the gym for an hour and a half four to five days a week. Great workmanship!!!
 Need a GREAT headset at an AWESOME price!!! This is the BEST HEADSETS on the market. Get one or two😊!

author: AET
title: Not durable
content: Worked for a while, then broke. When they broke they REALLY broke -- the front and back plastic case of the left ear piece kept coming apart, the volume button fell out and the right speaker stopped working. Around the same time,  they started powering themselves on and connecting themselves to my phone (I suspect when the volume button fell out the power button started malfunctioning). This was irritating for two reasons: the headphones did not have power when I needed them, and if I was trying to answer a call I could not hear anything because the sound was being routed to the headphones in my bag. I was not particularly hard on them (carried them around in my bag and mostly used them when running). Also the power on voice ("power on," "your headphones are connected," "your headphones are disconnected," "power off") is irritating (though I suppose it is at least clear what is going on... my new headphones have some pleasant, though perhaps less clear, on and off chirps).

author: Pete C
title: Can't be beat for the money, great entry level bluetooth headphones for almost all purposes.
content:
Best bluetooth headphones I've found for the money. Despite the quite-cheap price and light weight, they feel substantial, nothing cheap and easy to break... the rubber and plastic is all good quality, the design is nice and feels more, erm, "expensive", than the price would indicate.

 The sound is loud and clean, arguably better (or at least louder/crisper) than some pricier bluetooth headphones I've tried..I've never had problems connecting / disconnecting. The battery lasts a reasonable amount of time for the price (not expecting 15 hour battery life from $20 bluetooth headphones).

Minor issues:
The ear pieces do stick out a fair bit, so maybe not the best if you wear snug caps or hats. Not a problem, just part of the design, but something to keep in mind in case it's winter time and trying to get these under tight snowcaps or something.

The bluetooth battery indicator on-screen will go from 70-80% down to battery warning, to dead within a few mins. Not a huge deal because the battery lasts an OK amount of time and is quick to charge.

The track /phone controls take some getting used to. They're definitely not the same as on other devices, for instance track advance/rewindis done using volume buttons not play button.  Overall though, I'm happy with the button placement/setup, and it's nice not having a cheap plastic volume control stuck on the wire itself.

Given those extremely minor issues and the cheap price, I've stuck with these and have now bought 3 pairs in a row (Due to losing 1 pair and carelessly damaging another).  I just tried to upgrade to slightly pricier paid ($70-80) by another company, and am already tempted to return to these since they just feel and sound better to me.

I even had a server at a bar see me wearing them, and start talking about how much he liked them / how he's used a few pairs now.

author: Eileen Ahn
title: Cheap, comfy and connects quickly!
content: Paired quickly and it connects and disconnects very quickly from my iPhone.  I have two similar pairs of the brand that made the black and red popular and I feel like these pair that I leave at work on my desk connect a lot faster.  Sound quality is fine for the cost. Let's just see how long it lasts! Major difference between these and the very costly version is that the hook/ear piece is soft.  This hook is bendable and flexible with very little  effort. I can see how this will enable someone to wear this much longer as the brand named pairs tend to hurt after an hour or so.  Comes with various earbud sizes, case (tacky and quick large for the earbuds) and charging cable about 9" long.

author: Andylucia
title: Works Great, but there are some times it doesn't connect right
content: I use these solely for calling on Skype.  The sound quality is good and from what I hear the speaker quality is good.  The battery lasts a long time.  If they do not fit correctly, change out the rubber headphone covers.  Even with this, the rubber bar on top may not fit properly.  I find if you turn them they sit properly.  The only real problem I have with these (as I have with other headphones) is that sometimes my laptop will connect them correctly and my microphone will not work.  I have to disconnect them a few times to get them working.  Given that this is not the first pair of headphones I have had this problem with, I am guessing its my laptop.

author: Richard Takahashi
title: Great quality at crazy reasonable price
content: This is my second pair of Otium headphones. I purchased almost the same model a year ago. They stopped working all of a sudden and I emailed the company (<support@otiumobile.com>). Though I was out of the one year warranty, they gave me money back for the nonworking headphones (using PayPal credit). I purchased this new pair because I loved the first pair so much. The sound quality is great; they don't move when you're running/jumping and the battery life is pretty good. I use the headphones for 1-2 hours 4-5x/week and I think I charge them maybe once/week. You should buy these for sure-great product and great company!

author: Shawn
title: Light, easy to set up, work great with iPhone XS
content:
This review is relative to the price paid, and not am I surprised! I have a new set of AirPods. These cost ten times less than the Apple product, guess what .. you would think you paid 75-100 for these! Connection is brilliant, the ease of putting them in ear and the comfort level blows the competition out of the water. Great simplicity in the buttons, they take phone calls easily, redial, and auto connect back to music after the call.
The sound quality is great ( relative to price) sure the bass could be tighter, it’s a tad muddy at times ( listening to hi-res) recordings. Vocals are great! Volume is definitely sufficient. Did I say they are super comfy?  These are a no brainer at this price as a primary listener or a fantastic second set that you don’t mind losing or destroying ($15 bucks) I’m keeping them as my workout set and beach wear. Buy them!!

author: Redhorse_USA
title: Nice wireless headset for gym and outdoor running!
content: Ordered this Bluetooth headset because of the looks.  It’s more replicating the design of beats wireless headphones for cheaper price.  Build quality is good.  Comes with a carrying hard shell case with zipper which is added bonus that I didn’t expect for the price paid.  Paired quick to both iOS and android devices and the connection was quick.  Sound quality is good.  Works good and was able to listen for good 6 hours.  I didn’t get a chance to test at a stretch but it’s turns off to sleep mode after a period of no usage which is good for battery.  There is fewer buttons and attractive sports design. Good if you are in the market for wireless headset for your gym.

author: HY
title: They're OK.
content: Bought these to try out because I liked the design and it was on sale. I use the Apple earpods, SoundPEATS QY7, and the Otium primarily for running. For sound quality the Apple earpods, and the Soundpeats both sound very good. I was disappointed in the Otium as they sounded underwhelming, there's no fullness, and just sounds lacking in general. The fit isn't that great either, but that may depend on the person's ear. They don't feel secure even with the hooks. The Soundpeats wingtips feel much more secure, and I never worry about them falling out during exercise. I do like that the Otium are waterproof. One thing that really bothers me is the bottom volume button is for volume + and the top volume button is for -. I frequently turn down the volume, or go to the previous track when I meant to do the opposite. I don't understand why they designed it like that, it makes more sense the top button should be + and the bottom should be -. Luckily, I got them on sale, or I would've returned them if they were $25+.

author: mcp
title: I want my money back!!!!
content: Bought this four months ago and it's already defective. The volume button came off. Be aware to not buy this product. Most of the reviews are fake. I requested for a refund but the company denies it.

author: Dewalt Kotze
title: The headset comes with a nice carry case and includes 3 different size adapters to ...
content:
The headset comes with a nice carry case and includes 3 different size adapters to allow them fit comfortably your ears. The headset is very light weight and I hardly noticed I was wearing them after a few minutes. The sound quality is surprisingly good playing back clear high frequency and speech as well as decent quality low frequency at about the halfway volume. They do go rather loud, but this does start to affect the sound quality and adds some distortion.

The headset paired with ease to my Pixel XL and Samsung S7 and I am able to switch between the two devices without having to disable or reconnect the headset or Bluetooth on the phones. If you receive an incoming while listening to music on your phone the music is paused and you get a notification played back for the incoming call as well as the calling number being read back to you. I also connected the headset to my laptop and was able to use it for music as well as the audio device and microphone when making calls from the Skype for Business client.

The Bluetooth range on these are not the best, the booklet says 10 meters, which I guess if fine if you are using it with your mobile phone which would usually be in your pocket or close by. They claim to be waterproof and good for use in the rain or shower, I tend to not take my phone into the shower… so I'll see if I get to test this at some stage.

Overall I am very impressed with this headset, they have a very nice feel to them and the build quality seems very good. I'll need to see if the battery holds up to the 8 hours claimed in the included booklet.

author: Adrian Bowles
title: Wireless headphone for the gym
content: I wanted a new pair of headphones for the gym.  Tired of running with a wire dangling around that is always getting caught up and tangled.  This pair would not break the bank and thought I'd give them a try.  I hated buds in the ears they never seem to stay put and hurt after a while.  These with the hook over the ears means they stay put.  They sounded fine - i am a little older and my ears might not be as great for perceiving sound quality as when I was younger but they did the trick.  I'd have no hesitation wearing them on long flights as well as they are comfortable for longer durations.  Packaging was good with a nice hard case and they were easy to pair with my Iphone.  Happy with the purchase.

author: Mindy P
title: Reasonable price, fast pairing, last long and clear sound
content:
✅ perfect buddy while working out
✅ Design is fashion and looks nice
✅ come with a case so no tangle while carrying it around
✅ fast charging 1 to 1.5hours  and last for 4 to 5 hours of non stop using (they stated last up to 7hours but in fact no, only up to 5 then the connection is no stable)
✅ comes with different sizes of ears tips
✅ they have ear hook, no dropping. 👍
✅ easy pairing, within 30secs
✅ clear sound

author: medina4me
title: The best for $20
content:
Hello,

I have had this for only two days so my review is not about how it holds up to abuse over time.  Just a PRO/CON List.
Overall great little Blue Tooth headset for only $20 at Amazon.

PRO
1. It's $20 at Amazon Great Price
2. Blue Tooth has a good range (unless you area wearing tight pants then somehow connection is bad - See Comments below for explanation)
3. Sound is very decent compared to products that cost five times more
4. Sports?  Yes.  I've used them for running, Aerobics, Weight Lifting and just walking around.  The Headsets never fell or felt like they were going to fall
5. Battery Life is great (8 Hours)
6. Very comfortable to wear (no issues for me).
7 . NO WIRES!!! (sorta).

CON
1. The headsets stick out a bit.  This can be a problem if you wear a hoodie or a hood while raining (See Comments for more).
2. Trying to connect to a device is not the most intuitive process (read comments below) and can be a bit frustrating
3. The tail can get in your way and that can cause you to feel it pulls as you move your head left/right.
4. It can only be paired with one device at a time (not sure if this is a real problem since it's not for me).

Comments
PRO 2  - Bluetooth range is pretty amazing.  I can have a device 30 feet away and still get great audio (thru at least one wall).  Unless somehow you have tight pants.  I use Tight running pants when I run in the Winter.  Putting the Source in my pants pocket caused the signal to break up somehow.  I don't know if this is because of my device or the headset.

While wearing loose fitting pants (sweats) I had no issues.  As mentioned I left my MP3 player in another room and walked to the front door of my house and continued to get great sound.

CON 1 - Headsets stick out a bit.  I wear a hood when running (especially when it rains) and because the headsets stick out a bit they rub against the hood.  The rubbing of the headsets against the hoodie of my jacket causes the noise to be transferred to the headset and you can hear it.  It's not loud enough to not let you hear the music but if this is something that bothers you then get a more expensive product.

CON 2 - Blue Tooth Connection - Trying to connect to a device the first time can be a bit frustrating. All I can say is don't do like me and read the instructions.  The Device turns on by pressing the button for 3 seconds and it only connects when the device is off and press the button for 8 Seconds.  Except the device doesn't tell you it is in pairing mode with audio or when it connects.  The only way to know is to look at the little LED red/blue blinking light (which indicates it's in pairing mode) and when it goes blue it is paired.

author: Edward V
title: Great sound quality, Amazing price, Button layout needs some work
content:
Right off the bat, the first thing that I noticed I liked with these IEM’s are the ear hooks: THEY'RE FLEXIBLE! This is such a huge improvement over the hard/stationary ear hooks that’s typical for these cars of ear phones. The soft and flexible nature of the hooks make putting them on much easier, and removing the earphones is quick and doesn’t hurt my ear like the hard ear hooks of other models.

Sound quality is great and on-par with other IEMs. Much of the sound quality and sound isolation comes from making sure you have a snug fit with the silicone tips in your ears. These come with multiple sizes of tips so you shouldn’t have an issue finding the right size.

I love that the wire is the ‘non-tangle’ kind. The smooth and wide shape of the wire really helps against tangling and can be extended to full length very easily. An absolute boon to ear phones that still use a wire.

The one real complaint I have is with the UX layout of the buttons. When you put these ear phones on, the (-) volume button is facing forward and the (+) is facing backwards. In other words, when being worn, the (-) button is essentially ABOVE the (+) button. This may not be an issue for some people, but for me, it’s extremely unintuitive; Because the volume buttons are essentially ‘flipped’ when being worn, I end up raising the volume instead of lowering the volume and vice versa. Considering that in order to Skip and Backtrack songs are controlled via the volume buttons, this also becomes an issue.

One other issue I have is with the main button. Sometimes, it just doesn’t register my input when I want to stop/start my music. After a few tries, it will start registering again.

Overall, for the price, these are really good Bluetooth IEMs. Sounds quality is great along with the noise reduction, and the non-tangle wire is very convenient. The flexible ear hooks are a real nice touch. The only things that really annoyed me were the unintuitive layout of the volume buttons and the occasional fickleness of the pause/play button.

author: Krish
title: Very good design and music quality is pretty good.
content: Since it does look like a beats design, I thought it was too good to be true. Silicon ears hooks are very flexible and already installed earbuds are the most common ears size and I just wear them as they are.They fit comfortably in my ear and it comes with the wire adjuster bead to control how you want the wire to fit against the back of your head. Bluetooth connectivity was decent. Music quality is pretty good. Noice cancelling works ok. As far as the call quality is concerned, it was excellent. It's gud for working out. Very good battery life. I highly recommend.

author: dofzion1998
title: **Updated***Great headphones!!!
content:
I loved these right out the box. The sound is great and i used them at least 5 days a week. I like drowning out wverything around me when i have them in and they work great for that. The battery life is average for wireless bluetooth. They seem to last about 6 hours if you are listening to music but if youre using them to stream a tv show or something,  for some reason they last a little longer. Maybe 8 hours? I loved the fact that they announced the phone number of the incoming caller, not just ring or say incoming call.  I loved them until about 2 weeks ago when one of the ears started experiencing a short. So now only 1 side works.  Ive only had them about 6 months. I had to go out and buy some garbage ones from Walmart for the same price i paid for these but dont work nearly as well. Im on a hunt for some that will have the same, if not better sound quality but will also last longer than 6 months.

*Update* After writing the review Otium contacted me and offered me a replacement pair. I was very happy to know that they back their products. The process to get a new pair did not take long at all. The offer came with a replacement of the exact headphones that i had before or i could choose from two others. I did opt for the same ones since i loved them so much. Thank you Otium!!

author: Nick the Reviewer
title: Fairly Good Headphones, But Not Amazing
content: I was given an Apple Watch series 3 for Christmas, and I ordered this headset (because of reviews) to take advantage of the Watch to its fullest while at the gym/running. Connecting the headphones to the Apple Watch (or any Bluetooth device) is relatively easy after reading the short instructions in the manual. Power control (on/off) and volume control are relatively simple as well. However, the location of the power on/off button is not in the greatest spot; I accidentally push on it when putting the headphones on my ear. (Now that I know, it doesn’t happen anymore as I handle them differently). The headphones did not feel 100% secure when I put them on my ears for the first time, but this was not the case practically. They were very secure at the gym, and did not slip off or move on my ear at any time. I would have given a 4 or 5 star if it wasn’t for the sound quality. It sounds just ok; maybe a 6 out of 10. The base is relatively low, and the overall music is not the best quality. This MIGHT be an Apple Watch issue, I don’t know. I spend about 1.5 hours at a time at the gym. They never came close to running out of power since I charged it fully. And connection was never lost. They come with a small secure case, extra ear buds, a charger, and instruction manual. Overall I do like the headphones especially for the price. I might search around to test other Bluetooth headphones in the future.

author: lauren
title: I am very disappointed with this product that I purchased
content: I am very disappointed with this product that I purchased. Upon opening the black case for the headphones, they were haphazardly thrown in the case and were not properly wound. As I examined the headphones further, I found earwax in both of the earbuds. Absolutely DISGUSTING. The left earbud was completely full of earwax, and it obviously impacted the sound that was produced. After connecting the headphones with my device, I turned up the sound all the way so that I was able to hear the music without actually putting the headphones in my ears. It was obvious that there was less sound coming from left earbud, probably due to the earwax embedded into the speaker. I am extremely disappointed with the purchase of these headphones, and it's obvious that these were used before. I refuse to purchase from this company again.

author: Matthew Roelle
title: Good fit, poor sound quality
content:
I enjoy running with Bluetooth headphones. I've gone through a couple different models that have had trouble staying attached to my ears. The Otiums stay on well. They may not stay perfectly in my ear, but the loop that goes over keeps them from falling out and disturbing my workout. I might purchase again. This is the best of the three I've had for running, but I'm also hopeful I could find the perfect headphone that stays on and sounds good.

The good:
Stays on the ear during rigorous trail running
Easy to use the controls
Cheap
Waterproof

The not so good:
Sound quality is mediocre - a little fuzzy with weak frequency sections across the range (generally lows, but some mids and highs seem to be missing too)
Doesn't stay fully embedded in my ear while running all the time, reducing the bass quality
Cord can drift to one side or the other on the neck and tug at the headphone
A double press of one of the buttons re-dials your last phone call (which wasn't what I wanted!)

author: J. Horst
title: Great Headset for People on the Move!
content:
I usually prefer over-the-ear headsets but after getting myself the M9’s a while back, I’ve really come to like the Otium brand!  This time around, my wife wanted a pair to use when watching movies on her phone and going for walks around the neighborhood.  Therefore, we thought we would try these since, lets face it, the price is awesome, they had an over-the-ear clip to help keep them secure, and my experience with the M9’s has been so good!

Pros:

First off, out of the box, these are very nice looking!  It feels well made (especially considering the price!) and comes with a wide assortment of ear pieces and accessories.  To top it off, it has a case to keep everything in.  While I didn’t care for the shiny case (I like the matte look of my M9’s), my wife really likes it!

Paring the headset was extremely easy and the connection is very reliable.  The in-ear prompts strike a  perfect balance between being intuitive and helpful without being annoying (a big deal in my opinion!).

While, I prefer the sound of my M9’s (better base IMO), my wife absolutely loves these!  Crisp high’s make the dialog easy-to understand in her movies and the balanced mix makes them great for music as well.  She couldn’t believe how much better sounding these were than any other headset she’s used in the past!

While there isn’t active noise-cancelation, it still does a good job blocking out the ambient noise thanks to it’s in-ear design.  Also, thanks to the over-the-ear clip, it has been very secure for her walks.

Cons:

The only complaint she had is that, like me, she has small ears so the smallest ear piece is still a little too large for her.  (I think the M9’s are a little smaller so I didn’t have that problem.)

Either way, I would highly recommend this set if you’re looking for an over-the-ear Bluetooth headset.  If you don’t need the over-the-ear piece though and have smaller ears, I would highly recommend you check out the Otium M9’s as well!  Either way, it’s definitely another winner from Otium!

author: CBooth Reviews
title: Good Heaphones, Very week on high frequencies.
content:
Overall, very great headphones, but the upper ranges are a bit lacking. These are basically cheaper knock-offs of Beats, and I would gladly pick these over Beats any day. The only issue is that, like Beats, they are focused mainly on helping your ears feel the beats by heavily strengthening the bass. The mid range is decent, and the high range is tolerable, but I would not really want to listen to these for too long. I will say, though, that by changing your EQ to Treble Booster these headphones sound much much better.

In terms of the Bluetooth connectivity these are simply, very easy to use, and are super easy to fit on your ear. Overall, they really are great quality headphones, I just cannot give them 5 stars due to the sound quality they produce.

author: WigglyPuff
title: Good bass, high sound quality, decent battery life
content: I must say, I was a little skeptical buying these. I have a bad experience with bluetooth headphones in the past (they pretty much kicked the bucket 27 hours in) and I thought these would be the same. I'm happy to admit how wrong I was. It's been almost three months since I first got them and they still work just as well. For $20, these sure are good. The battery life in my experience has been about 7 - 8 hours, so pretty good considering my schedule. If you really need them all day, I can confidentally say you could always buy two and have one charging while you use the other. I only have one, but that's enough to get me through the day. Definitely recommend these. If my current pair break, I'd absolutely repurchase.

author: Kevin Lacy
title: I don't think you can beat the quality/price comparison
content: Before I purchased these headphones I purchased another competing set that was about $10 more expensive, thinking the sound and overall quality would at least be slightly superior to a pair of headphones like this. I was wrong. They were as bad or worse in sound quality and volume as the generic Apple headphones that my iPhone came with when I first got it. I promptly sent them back and purchased this pair and the difference was night and day. Way louder if I wanted them to be with better clarity and definitely better bass. They also pair with my phone extremely quickly after turning on which I like. They still are, however, a $20 pair of headphones so don't expect an incredible amount of sound quality but I definitely don't think you can beat the quality/price comparison. Would recommend

author: Dimitry B
title: Best Cheap Headphones on the Market
content:
Absolutely love this product. Just bought a second pair when I lost the first pair. But guess what - they cost 20$, so losing one isn't an issue! Which is why I love these headphones.
- Sound quality is fine, all ranges are great (only a true audiophile would find issue).
- Super comfortable - the key is that the wires extend out of the headphone, not the thing that goes over your ears.
- Have compared to the real Beats these are based on. Of course, the $250 headphones are made of higher quality rubber materials, etc. (as they should be for such a ripoff)... but sound and comfort difference is minimal - while these come at <10% of the cost!!!
- Battery life in my first pair was fantastic. Lasted 9 am to 6 pm continuous listening for 3 months before I lost them, no problem!

TL:DR: Dr. Dre has enough money, and if you're reading this you probably don't have as much as him. Don't give all your money to him. Get a pair of otiums today and start living wirelessly today.

author: Mal
title: Sound is fine, build quality is not
content:
Worked fine for a month or two. Then started losing sound in one ear before conking out completely at about 3 months. Very disappointed with the low quality build.

1/24/19 update: Otium reached out to me offering a replacement. Good customer service at least! Will update after I've had the replacement for a few weeks, just to see how it works.

2/22/19 update: Added a star (up to 3) as the replacement headphones have worked well so far. We'll see how good the long-term reliability is, but so far so good.

5/15/19 update: New pair conked out after a couple months of pretty light use. Will no longer connect to phone consistently (it cuts out every few minutes). Very disappointing.

author: Brandon Rich
title: abosulely best wireless blutooth head phones I've evr had! for real.
content: Ok so I've bought these headphones 5 times because I've lost them 5 times lol. Anyway these headphones have the most amazing battery life I've ever seen lasts for 5 days on a single charge maybe more or more depends on how much you listen. Loud, very you will not complain about that. Durable very tough, very hard to break. Last time I bought they were $25 and worth every penny, that's why I continue to buy them if I lose them lol. I personally think these are the best Bluetooth headphones you can get for the price. I never leave the house without them. They charge insanely quick, listen all dsay with only a 20-30 min charge to fill em back up again. Best headphones I've bought. Will never go to another product. Plus they have wrap around ear holders so you can run or jog, do physical activities without them falling off on you. BUY THEM YOU WILL NOT BE DISSAPOINTED! great JOB GUYS :)

author: Amazon Customer
title: Great bang for the buck
content:
Bought these too use for mostly work but on some occasions, I used them while working out or, just doing other things around the house. I bought my first pair in January and had them for about 8 months before I lost them, (Whoops).

But, during the time I had/used them. They were amazing especially for the price.

The sound quality was nice, it wasn't the best nor the worst. But for the price you can't complain. It was definitely decent enough that I won't complain.

Noise cancellation: Very good. While at work I only use one of them so I can make sure I can hear people if they need me :P

Battery life is good, A solid 8 hours run time, with an hour or two to charge back up.

Some points:
*I've warn these in the rain without a problem.

*Even running or moving around while working. These haven't fallen completely off because of the band that loops around your ear.

* Easy to use controls, even while wearing gloves.

author: Bruce Guu
title: How did I not discover this?!
content:
Jesus freaking christ. I do not know how I did not discover these wireless earphones sooner. Background: I have used BeatsX by Dr. Dre. These were good wireless earphones, bass was good, sound okay. Guess what, broke within 1 year and warranty ran out. I have used Jaybird x3. These were definitely one of my favorites. Broke in 1.5 years due to not holding a charge. Warranty was only for one year. So I have spent around $130 each on these wireless earphones just to have them break and not be covered by warranty.

I figured, why not just try a cheap wireless earphone from Amazon since all wireless earphones break within a year or two anyways. I saw Otium bluetooth earphones and purchased these due to the good reviews and mainly because it was $20. This is my first day using it, so I can not review it for the longevity, however I can tell you that the sound is on par with the BeatsX and Jaybird x3. However, the Beats and Jaybirds did have better bass, but it didn't really matter to me. I workout 5 days a week, so I needed something I can just listen music to without any wires. Surprisingly these can go double the distance of my Jaybird x3s without losing connection. That is what prompted me to write this review.

In conclusion, you get double the distance of connection, on par music sound, all for 1/6 of the price of more well known wireless earphones. Even if it breaks, you get 1.5 year of warranty, or just even spend $20 each time it breaks. It will be well worth it even if these last 1-2 years. Good job to a great product so far!

author: Manlee1
title: Totally Satisfied
content: Purchased over 4 months ago.  I'm no snooty audiophile but I think these things rock, literally.  I generally only review things that either exceed expectations or are in need of a warning to others.  These definitely fall into the former category.  So many times I've neglected to charge these after several uses & am sure that they won't get me through my workout but, so far, battery has not given out even once.  Do they need to be pushed back in your ear every now & then?  Yeah, but they never go far & it is such an easy thing to do that I cannot understand anybody complaining about fit.  Does the sound compare to over the ear (Beats), I wouldn't know but I wouldn't expect them to at less than 1/10 the cost!  As far as I'm concerned these are a great value & more than get the job done for a regular guy like me.

author: TechGReviews
title: Comfortable to wear I'll use them a lot but coming ...
content:
They're definitely room for improvement.

too much bass and it's a little raspy/tinny on the high notes.
bluetooth works well even when I throw my phone across the room it stays connected and playing.
Comfortable to wear I'll use them a lot but coming from much higher quality headphones this is quite the downgrade.

I recommend these if you're not concerned about sound quality, they're comfortable and stay on well during lots of movement.
I don't recommend these if you like high quality sound.
(I haven't tried the battery I'll update later)

author: Nicole
title: They come with a carrying case and a clip!
content: I love these headphones so much! I bought them after getting the iphone seven and I was looking for something with a chord because I tend to misplace my things. Originally, I bought these thinking I would keep them in my backpack and use the headphones that came with my phone primarily. However, although I do use these frequently for school I find myself frequently reaching for these out of my backpack instead of my other pair in my purse. They have great sound quality! They also keep their charge well, I haven't had to use them logn distance much so I haven't tested their abilities in that department. Regaurdless, based on what I've seen I'm sure they'll do great, I would definitely buy these!

author: Bookcritics
title: Not a good buy when using for Sports activity.
content:
There is no issue with sound. The issue i have is that when i go for running, and when i start to sweat. the wire stick to the body and thus pulls the ear piece from the ear when i turn my head. So practically its useless. I think the insulation of the wire is the issue, stick to the body. Because of that the headphone is not a good buy for me. I think even other will face the same issue.  So giving it a 1 star rating because its suppose to be sports head phone.

Seller please do not reach me to bump the rating, my rating and my reason for the rating is clearly mentioned out in my review.

author: K. E. Kenerson
title: Not for small ears!
content:
These don’t work for smallish ears. The over the ear hooks were bigger than my ear, and the smallest plastic bud suctioned itself into my ears in that scary way that makes it feel like it’s doing permanent damage to the eardrums  on the way out.  They’re too heavy, and they aren’t magnetized, so the slide around your neck when your not using them.
The one star I give these is for the sound. It is AMAZING.

TL;dr
Too big for small ears, need a magnet, incredible sound.

So if you have big ears, these might be for you.

author: CurlyC
title: Best budget headphones you'll find
content: After 14 months, my 1st pair just died after multiple taking a dip, getting stepped on, and more. RIP, Otium headphone, it's been real. I'll miss you.There's no one else who's stayed by my side like you have these last 13 months, rain or shine, whether I'm staying low-key at home or running wild. You sounded good, even if you caught wind a little too hard. You stayed on my ears as I smashed through weight sets and did downward dog. Maybe you crackled when I turned you on from time to time, but you gave me so much more than I ever gave you. You kept me connected to multiple devices at once, and let me control my volume and playback without having to touch or even be near my phone. I hope you are reincarnated as someone else's favorite set of budget headphones, because you've done me good. I even recommended your type to all my coworkers and their families, and now you live on with them. I'll miss you.

author: dancing.rain
title: almost perfect
content:
I have a powerbeats 3 which is very similar to this one except two things: price and better fit.

However, Otium is such a great product for the price. The only complaint I have is that I wish the over the ear hooks were bendable to adjust. They stay in place ok - meaning I do intensive dancing with them and I do have to adjust once in awhile. Of course powerbeats 3 for the price, the over-the-ear hooks are adjustable and they do stay on the whole time I am dancing.

I would buy Otium headphones for such a cheap price. I am not sure how long this will lasts but if it lasts a whole year with everyday use, I'd be over the moon.

author: M. Forrest
title: Great value!
content:
For the price you can't go wrong.  I had a pair of Powerbeats wireless earbuds for about a year and half.  I used them 5 or 6 days a week.  They stopped working.  After some research on Amazon, reading reviews I decided to purchase these.  I've had them about 2 months.  They work great, the sound quality is decent.  The fit and finish aren't quite as nice as the Beats but for $20, it's great!  I'm only using them for 45-50 minutes at a time and then re-charging them.  Sometimes I forget to re-charge them and use them again the next day.  Haven't run out of battery yet.  For the price I can buy at least 3 or 4 pairs of these compared to Powerbeats wireless earbuds (refurbs).  If you want to spend $20 on wireless ear buds, these are them!

Update 3/27/2019
Had them about 5 months now.  I have been wearing them on longer runs, close to 2 hours.  No issues.  Saw a coworker in  the gym with the same earbuds.  We compared notes and you just can't go wrong for ~$20.  As I write this they are selling for $16.89.  Are you kidding me?  Buy them.

author: K. Tran
title: Pretty reliable
content:
I waited awhile to write this review because I go through bluetooth headphones like they're disposable. I've literally bought 5-6 pairs since my (3rd, mind you) Beats broke. I sweat like a mofo during the gym (45 minutes on the stairmaster will do that) therefore every single pair of bluetooth headset I've ever bought has broken down in no time flat. I can't replace the Beats that easily, so I've been buying cheaper ones, since I can afford to break those. It's not them, it's me.

To my surprise, this pair has lasted me three! THREE! months so far. Knock on wood and all, but yeah, these are pretty good. They act up sometimes though. It takes like 10 seconds to connect (sometimes) after I turn them on. They sound choppy (sometimes) initially. The volume is (sometimes) really, really low and then I have to reboot them. Sometimes the range is like 15 feet, then today I had to run across the gym a couple hundred feet and I could hear my music. Also, the ear pieces really suck. They make the sound get muffled when there's water in my ear. Easily rectified when I switch them out with another random earpiece.

But still, 3 months! Not bad, not bad. Ordering another pair now as backup

author: Renee
title: GRest sound!
content: These headphones are the truth lol... I picked the pink ones... like most other headphones these do connect to my phone as soon as I turn it on and same for phone. It does block out all other signs. I tested it by running on a trail and as bikers passed by it scared the crap outta me because I couldn’t hear them 😂 so I just normally put it halfway now. Anyways , the headphones are really good

author: T. Milewski
title: Good if sitting still, not good while exercising
content: I gave up on these after trying them for about a month. They would fit right for about 15, but then they would slowly start to slip out, especially if I was working out for a while. during the time that they were in, the sounds quality was fine. I got tired of constantly fiddling with them to get them to stay in right.  $20 is fairly cheap though so I figured I got what I paid for.  If you're just sitting and listening to music on a plane, then these are fine, but they're not great for running or working out. I went and found over the ear, bone conduction headphones... paid a lot more money, but e worth every penny.

author: wlorton
title: Better than Beats!!!!!
content:
Ok, Ok, maybe they're not better than Beats, but I had a pair of the wireless beats that had to be replaced 3 times within a year.  Getting tired of doing this and having them tell me they would not replace them again (YAY!! Not!!!), I saw these and purchased as they were less then $20.  Purchased them well over a year ago and they're still kicking ass.  I charge them maybe twice a week and get 3-4 workouts in before the battery gets low.  I would guess that it has a usage time of 8-10 hours easily.  They do hang onto the sweat a little bit but even the sweatiest workouts won't phase them.

Best Part? I simply used the Beats ear piece on these for perfect comfort.  Would and have recommended.

author: Karthik
title: Update - Received a replacement; The microphone became very weak after two months of use
content:
The speaker themselves are pretty good for the price. However, the mic nearly stopped working after 2 months of use. One of the main reason for my purchase is to make and receive calls. The people on the other side could barely hear me. I had to shout loud enough to be audible. At the beginning though the mike was working fine.
If you do not care about the mic then its a good buy - i used them regularly while running or working out in gym. Am disappointed that the mic stopped working.

Update 1(07/25/2019) - i was promptly contacted by the otium customer support offering a replacement to try. I definitely appreciate their commitment to provide quality earphones and best customer experience. Bumping up the star by one more. I will update once again after i receive the replacement earphone.

Update 2(07/31/2019) - I received the replacement earphone. So far its been very good, no issues with the mic. I very much appreciate the customer support and their 1.5 years(6 months additional warranty if you register your device online) warranty. Otium definitely cares for customer satisfaction. I shall update once again after using for few more months.

author: Afotey Annum
title: I Hate Wireless Headphones. I LOVE These Wireless Headphones!
content:
Absolutely stellar sound reproduction from these.

I was throughly impressed.

I've tried a few brands of wireless Bluetooth headphones in the past, and wasn't too impressed. They either sound somewhere between horrible and meh or sound great but don't hold a charge well. As a result, I've pretty much sworn off Bluetooth headphones and stuck with wired ones from Bose, Audio Technica and Beats.

Granted, I've only owned Android devices, so I haven't had the pleasure of testing out Apple's own wireless headphones. So there's that.

By FAAAAAARRRRR, these are probably the best earbuds I've ever worn, including wired ones.

I listen to mostly Hip Hop music, and generally only the Boom Bap kind. For those who are unaware of what that means, it basically means rap music that usually places more emphasis on deep sounds, layers upon layers of melody, intricate sampling and lots of 808 goodness. It's basically  NOT what gets played on the radio nowadays.

Yeah, I'm that "get off my lawn!" type of Hip Hop purist. An unapologetic Boom Baptist, if you will lol

Having typed all that, something from old, soulful Kanye or The Alchemist or No I.D. or Nottz Raw or J Dilla or The RZA or DJ Static or DJ K-Def or The Neptunes or illmind or Brock Berrington or Flamingosis or DJ Premier sounds IMPOSSIBLY GOOD on these.

I know because I listened to music from all of them on these earbuds! Lol

Operation is simple, there's almost no distortion at high volumes, pairing is damn near instantaneous after the first time you set it up (no, seriously...as soon as I turned them on, they connected), and they hold a charge for a very, very long time. Far longer than any other set of Bluetooth headphones I've ever used.

Again, I've not tested the ones from Apple, which are allegedly nigh perfect. And also way more expensive than these.

But for the price I paid ($20), these are a virtual steal.

HIGHLY recommended

author: D C.
title: Just as described
content:
You get a lot for $20. I am currently going through a search for the perfect bluetooth headset for working out and this may be it.
----What I love----
-It securely stays in my ear without having to shove it into my ear canal. Running, jumping. It stayed while working out and I can barely feel it while wearing it.
-3 different size of ear suctions thingies
-The hard case is actually helpful. It has a pocket, so you can actually use it for more than storing your headset. Also a hook that makes it easy to place on your purse or backpack.
-Setting up the bluetooth was super easy. Isn't it usually? Not always with this off brand things. I did not have to look for a weird number/letter name that had nothing to do with the product. It simply showed up as "Otium" and I knew that was it.
-It came already charged, so I was able to try it out right away.
-Extended warranty: This is a new one for me. It came with a little card when you can register for free for an extended 9 month warranty. I did not buy the square trade so I did register it. First time I see this option from an off brand bluetooth headset.
-Sound: It's great for me, it has volume buttons on the actual headset. I am not interested in bass and super strong sound, so I cannot speak further than this. Sound is very clear for music and movies.
---Suggestions---
None really. I am a little worried about the over the ear hook and hoping it does not break if bended. It does not come off and on, so if it comes off, it's OFF. Will update if it breaks.

Overall, it is a great option. No need to buy $90 beats headphones. This are just as great for me and my wallet.

author: Tiki19
title: Sounds great. Range is amazing
content: It’s been about a week and so far so good! I was nervous at first because you never know what you may get based on the reviews but I’m pleased! Sound quality so far is amazing I don’t have any issues or any weird feedback. I only use this to listen to music not for phone calls so I can’t comment on the microphone or the sound quality during calls but they work perfect for what I use them for. THE RANGE IS AMAZING! I can go up and down the stairs in my home without any interruption without needing to bring my phone with me so far I have been able to go outside and leave my phone in the house, the headphones did go out after about 12feet which was surprising to me and very impressive. I will give it some more time but if they continue to work this well I will buy again!

author: griffin Valentine
title: Great, but a few complaints
content:
I bought these headphones about a month ago or so, and they’re fantastic! I’ve used them nearly every day, in a whole slew of different scenarios, and they’re holding up very well! I have worn them in the rain, while doing yard work, while riding in a car, while exorcising, and while pressure washing. The sound quality doesn’t seem to have diminished at all, so they seem pretty waterproof!

That being said I do have a few complaints. When they were delivered, I don’t think they had a manual, so I haven’t figured out how to change songs using just the headphones or anything yet. Also, if you want to just have them in one ear, the other one tends to be so heavy that it drags the one in use out of your ear, so I’d recommend “clipping” the unused one to your collar. Sometimes while using them, they kind of move and come out of your ear a little, which is extremely annoying. There are a few options for changing the tips, but not enough that they’d fit everyone’s ears. And last but not least, the battery life leads a little to be desired. It feels like in ~4 hours of use, it tells you your headphones are on low battery. And the voice that tells you is pretty loud and annoying.

Other than that though I have no complaints. They’re certainly fantastic for the price and even knowing my complaints I’d still buy them again, and recommend them to anyone looking for affordable Bluetooth headphones!

author: H2doughboy
title: Great for the money
content: I have been using these to listen to music and calls on the phone. I really like the clarity of the sound and the mic works very well. I can only set the volume on the phone to about 1/3 of the max volume before it gets too loud. The battery life so far is about 8hrs of continuous use.  I do have a couple of suggestions for the mfr. When you reach max volume on the earphones you get a loud screech, a voice would be better. The cord gets stuck on the back of my neck and I have to lift it off to turn my head sometimes. A little longer cord would be nice. The last thing is it would be nice if it told you how many hours of play time you have when you turn it on. I liked them so much I bought my wife a set too. If you are looking for good quality at an inexpensive price I would go with these. Make some small changes and I would give them 5 stars.. Will definitely purchase again.

author: Kristin O
title: Amazing quality for little cost
content:
Great price, great fit and great sound quality.
I am an avid runner, hiker and regularly go to the gym and these comfortably fit in my ears and stay put.  They come with 3 different size rubber pieces for your ears to ensure a perfect fit.
They connected to my phone easily and flawlessly.
The package not only included the different size ear pieces but also instructions, acharging cord, and a semi-hard round protective case to keep them in.  I put them in my purse and don't have to worry about damage.
Inexpensive, durable ear buds.

author: Alex Rodolfo
title: Pathetic customer service for a faulty product!
content: I bought these headphones in June of 2018. I loved them the sound is excellent & the battery lasts all day. i could literally listen to my music all day at work. This would have been a 5star rating.  But two months later they would not charge anymore and that's was strictly using the supply charger and suitable block. I tried resetting them to no avail. I emailed otium customer service and give a detailed message of the issue and what I needed to do have them replaced or repaired. A few days later they replied telling me to reset it to which I immediately replied that I've had specified I had already tried everything and explain that in the previous email. Then after that a week later they asked me for my mailing address to ship replacement which was already include it in my original email along with my order from Amazon. Finally after two weeks I received my headphones in October. By late November my replacement headphones first stop working in one earbud and then would not charge. I immediately emailed a fully detailed message to Otium again and did not receive a reply for almost a week. It told me to try to reset my device again. I sent another email saying that it does not work I would like it to be replaced as I signed up for the 2-year warranty on their website. For five days later I receive an email telling me that I would have to pay $8 to their PayPal account to have them shipped. I immediately write and included  their entire warranty /return conditions and nowhere does it does it inform that a shipping cost may have to be paid for their faulty product under warranty. Otium completely ignored this email. After a week I emailed them again and said okay send me the PayPal I'll pay you $8 so I can get my new headphones. They did not reply to this and we're now at Christmas. I did however receive emails asking if I would participate testing the new products. I am more disgusted by their horrible customer service than by their discardable product manufacturing. I WANT MY HEADPHONES REPLACED OTIUM AND PREFERABLY ONES THAT LAST LONGER THEN A MONTH OR TWO.

author: Corey & Vanessa
title: Where Have These Been My Whole Life
content:
Dangit I love these. I needed a solution to wearing headphones while cleaning house.... viola! I've solved that and so much more. They also work for phone calls!
Fieat of all these are noise canceling - for real. I can keep them in without music and have some peace.
They're comfortable. I must have a deformed ear because headphones and earbuds are NEVER comfortable. These got so snuggly it's like they were made for my ear. AND they stay on! The little hook doohickey works real nice.
The sound..... it's legit. I embarrassed myself this weekend planting while wearing them and singing 70's hits. I havent even turned them up all the way yet but I'm quite satisfied.
They're bluetooth. No wires! I constantly forget I'm so free! No getting caught on door knobs or counters.
The big button pauses my music or mutes my calls. Theres volume controls on the right ear too. Only thing I'm missing is the ability to skip a song without being  near my device. Love these!!

author: SPK SR.
title: I'm impressed... people can hear me and the music sounds pretty good.
content:
So far so good... LG and i are at odds so i took a chance on a $20 pair of headphones.  1st of all I am pretty impressed.  Everyone can hear me and I no longer have to yell or use my telephone.  I realize what these headphones are so i am not expecting beats by dre quality music sound.  that being said... the music quality is more than adequate.  These head phones have decent range... just as far as any other BT headset.  the volume is very loud but can be turned down if needed.

They call out the telephone # if the phone rings... they are comfortable on my head and will stay put during workouts.  battery life is pretty good.  i think I'm getting 4-6 hours out of them.  Pairing was simple... hold the button down until the light flashes red and blue then scan for them.

The headphones come with case, extra ear buds and even an extra warranty.  I will keep you updated.. if anything changes i will update the rating!

author: JAMES R. HAINER
title: It is what it is for the price
content: These are fake "beats" style headphones with way too much bass built in (medium rubber buds are your best bet). You need to use an external E.Q to constantly level these bad boys out. I bought these because my G.F bought them and I borrowed them once and after leveling them out they do a good job getting rid of ambient noise outside of your ear.. are they noise canceling 100%? no.. but they do a really good job compared to other ear buds that bleed sound.. if you enjoy calming music like Radiohead..these work really well.. If you are into EDM or heavy south style trap bass look elsewhere.. they are too harsh.. (If you get these and have an Iphone.. go to Music E.Q settings and use Treble Boost.. that is your best bet)

author: john
title: Getting what you pay for
content:
This pair of headphones lasted me exactly one year. Im not really disappointed in that fact since i paid under $20. During the year i gad these i traveled with them frequently and used through work outs.

The over ear bar works great to keep these stable during runs and no discomfort. I will say that the connecting wire between ears can get caught on one side of your head and start to pull the device from you ears. this is not hard to adjust but can be an annoyance.

At right around the one year mark the ear that contains charging port stopped producing sound. About two weeks after that the device started turning off randomly without warning until it eventually stopped connecting longer than a few seconds.

author: Cassie
title: Headphones I Actually Like!
content: Holy smokes. I don't know much about electronics or in this case, headphones, but I really liked these! My BF has similar headphones, Beats by Dre, and he tried mine out. He was extremely impressed with these considering the price I had paid for them. I was skeptical at first when I put them on because the rubber ear band part cannot be custom molded to fit my ear. However, after actually wearing them running, high-knees, burpees, and jumping jacks, they never once fell off. Also, it came with a case and now I don't have to worry about these getting squished in my gym bag. Totally worth it the money.

author: Douglas Burns
title: Lasted me 10 months, great product.
content:
I ordered these back in March. They have served me INCREDIBLY well for the last 10 months. They're comfortable, charge easily, lightweight, and whenever I turn them on, they connect right away to my phone.

The sound quality of these is exceptional, and the Bluetooth works from even across my house.

The only reason I drop a star, is because around November-ish, they stopped pairing as easily with my phone all of a sudden. They would say that they were connected, but they wouldn't play. Once I went to my settings on my phone and clicked connect, then they worked fine, so it was an easy fix.

A week ago, though, they began to cut in and out. I had to hold my phone almost up to my ear in order to keep a strong connection. The sound would drag out for a second, then disconnect. It would disconnect and reconnect maybe up to 50 times during a minute. I tried charging it, and that seemed to fix it, but then yesterday, I accidentally dropped them onto my tile floor, and the cover on the right earbud popped off and got lost, exposing the chip and all the controls. I was INCREDIBLY disappointed, as I've been addicted to these earbuds.

I'm glad they have at least lasted me as long as they have, and I've been mostly very pleased with their performance.

author: Wayne N.
title: Love this set of headphones....if there were more stars...they would get 'em
content:
Charge lasts a long time and the over the ear clip works with the ear buds for a secure fit.  Makes sure you check out the three sizes of ear plugs and make sure the buds seal your ear canal. Price is good and I swear this looks identical to the name brands at fraction of the cost.  Also comes with a great hard storage case and caribiner. A bargain!

By the way, if you want a good headphone set to use at the computer of while watching TV (so you don't disturb wife) look at these...they would get the rating as the aforementioned and it's only $60.00 check the price of similar name brands...this is a bargain! https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0721MFBGG/ref=oh_aui_detailpage_o09_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1

No, I don't work for any of these folks.

author: Jordan Nicole
title: Seamless Operation for the Everyday Gym-goer
content:
I purchased these headphones about 4-5 months ago, and I have not had a single issue with them at all. I think they feel durable enough, the setup instructions were easy to follow and worked perfectly, and the sound quality of these is really great--sometimes I do wish they got a TINY bit louder, but that thought only ever crosses my mind in SUPER BEAST MODE moments at the gym. I have had the right earpiece fall off twice, both in the last couple of weeks, but that didn't cause the left to fall, so I just stuck the earpiece back on, and problem solved! It's definitely not been an ongoing issue, and I do cardio probably once a week; running or biking or stepping hasn't caused this to happen.

I will also mention that I do wish there were several different sized ear hooks for these, as the one it comes with is a little big for me, but I'm a small girl (5'3", 106 lbs.), so this probably isn't an issue for most buyers.

I went back and forth for a couple of days, falling into a black hole of online reviews and blog articles, and after weighing the pros and cons, I am so happy I ended up with these. Eventually I will progress to a pair of Bluetooth earbuds that don't have the cord around the back of the neck, but until then, I stand by these!

author: Jennifer
title: Perfect!
content: So over a year ago my phone stopped detecting my headphones when I plugged them in and I've been really annoyed about it ever since. I didn't even know about bluetooth headphones. I mean, I knew about a bluetooth earpiece for taking calls, but it just never crossed my mind that there would be wireless headphones. Anyway, I came across these online and was really excited to get them! I can't compare them to another brand obviously since it's the first pair I've ever tried, but I'm completely satisfied with them. The sound quality is great, even during phone calls (on both ends of the call), very comfortable, and comes with a nice case to keep them in. I don't necessarily like the red cord that connects the two, but it's not bothersome either.  Overall, I'm very happy about them and would definitely recommend!

author: John Whiteker
title: Good deal at this price point
content: A pretty great buy for $20 honestly, I'm just picky. Switched to these after running over my old LG neckband type headset. These don't sound as good for sure, and they amplify the wind if you're running or working in windy conditions. Also, the receiver/earbud size seemed a little larger than what I'd like, but sort of expected. I found I was much happier with the music experience once I did some EQ work (see image). But like I said, for this price, I'd purchase them with no regrets.

author: David R.
title: ... headphones for about a week and although they are good, they have their short comings
content:
I have now owned these headphones for about a week and although they are good, they have their short comings. I have used them to listen to binaural frequencies while sleeping, listen to music on two 10-mile runs, talked on the phone, and used them to listen to music and podcasts at work.

Pros:
Great sound. It is crisp and clear, good bass, and good at noise canceling (Check out the cons for a little more detail on noise canceling)
Awesome battery life. 8+ hours of continuous listening. I have bought a pair of $90 Panasonic BackBeat Pro ear buds that barely last 4 hours.
Awesome price. You can't beat a $20 price tag for bluetooth earbuds.
They charge quite fast. about 1.5 hours from fully dead to fully charged. (It doesn't sound fast, but trust me, it is.)

Cons:
I found them to be quite uncomfortable to wear after an hour or two. This might be subjective to me, as not everyone's ears are shaped the same. They have a snug fit and don't fall out thanks to the over-the-ear design, but they put a lot of pressure on the backside of my ear.
Although they are really good at noise canceling, they give off a lot of noise if you are in a windy environment. I mean LOTS of wind noise. I live near the beach and go for long runs and any crosswind, or head-on wind generates a massive amount of noise to the point where you barely can hear the music. This problem negates any positive of it's noise canceling ability. Go ahead and stand in front of a fan, and you'll see what I'm talking about.

I debated on giving these a 4 star rating, as some of my complaints are more of a personal issue and others might not have the same issues that I have. BUT the wind noise is SO overpowering, that I just can't give them a good rating. Hope my review has been helpful to someone.

author: Kevin Lee
title: Wish I read more of the one-star reviews before buying ...
content:
Wish I read more of the one-star reviews before buying and heeded the warnings, but it looks many people had the same experience as me. I've used them sporadically for occasional workouts, but within 3 months, they stopped working altogether. Probably worth dishing out a little more money for a reliable pair.

---

Bumping my 1 star up to a 3 or 3.5. I received a 2nd pair, and so far, this new pair has been working reliably for a few months, through many sweaty workouts ha.

author: Kelly Gorman
title: Excellent product, but not very durable
content: **Update: out of nowhere, after 6 months of regular use, they started malfunctioning to the point of being unusable. They will no longer stay connected to my phone. They randomly turn off after a few minutes of use, even when fully charged. When I try to reconnect, it takes a while, so they are not convenient to use. The sound quality was good while it lasted, but I'll be looking for a more durable product to replace these. *Really good sound quality and battery life. The over-ear piece is flexible which was a little weird at first but it’s very comfortable. Easy to control and to connect to devices - connects immediately to any device I’ve used it with (this has been an issue with other Bluetooth earphones I’ve had). Love that it has a battery level indicator on my phone. It’s also easy to use with multiple devices (not simultaneously). With other pairs I’ve had, I’ve had to force the device to “forget” the earphones in order to connect with a different device, even if they weren’t connected to the first device at the time I wanted to use with the second - that is not a problem with these. Comes with multiple earbuds and a carrying case, which is nice.

author: John A.
title: (Updated) Could have been better...
content:
When I first purchased these I was content with what I received. The sound quality was exactly what I was expecting, cheap and lacking a rich clear sound but I was planning on using these for the gym/other exercising purposes so clarity wasn't really a luxury I was able to pay attention to. Unfortunately, after only 6 months of use the left earphone stopped working. I tried to get in touch but I didn't get a response from them for some reason. I didn't bother to try again and decided to deal with the issue. Just recently the other earphone broke too and now I'm out of a set of wireless headphones. Bummer...
Overall, my experience with them was OK. They allowed me to listen to my music wirelessly and provided good battery (as long as you didn't listen to loud music). Initially using these they would rest well in my ear but after prolonged use (1+ hours) they would start hurt my ear canals. The pause play button didn't work as expected either. Single tap paused and resumed music however, double tap wouldn't skip tracks but rather pause then resume immediately. Triple tap was the same thing as double tap except it would pause then resume one more time. If you're expecting to purchase something that'll get he job done, this will do the trick! However, if you want this thing to last a decent while try investing a little bit more money on another product and testing your luck there.

Update: After I had submitted my review the company had almost immediately reached out to me to help me resolve my issue. It was quite shocking how quickly they reached out to me expressing their regret that the headphones didn't work up to their expectations. They were quick to send me another pair and within a 2 days I received a replacement pair on my front porch! Needless to say I felt obligated to update my review. I had initially given this product 2 stars but have decided to bring it up to 4 instead. It's still a great product for the price tag!

author: Staci
title: Work well.
content:
(EDIT) I'm changing my review from a 3 to a 5 mostly based on the customer service I received. I left my review saying the headphones died pretty quickly to me and the seller reached out shortly after that. They sent me a new pair for free and they seem to be working well. Good to know if anything happens in the future they are kind to help with it.

These headphones work pretty well. I like the ear loop for keeping it on. The biggest issue is longevity because they start to die after about 6 months or so. Not super expensive so not a huge deal, but a little sad.

author: #1 Amazon Reviewer
title: Stopped working after a month!
content: The headphones worked fine for a few weeks. About 1 month in they stopped working all together. I realize they’re inexpensive, but I expected a little better quality. Also, the quality of the mic on calls is low. I had multiple people tell me they could barely hear me, so I stopped using it for phone calls.

author: Puccachu
title: Great customer service!
content:
UPDATE: So the costumer service contacted me and sent me a brand new set of headphones for free! I am very happy with my new headphones! I got to use it at the gym today and it can't be beat! thank you!

So I do love this headphones but the sounds started going on and off when I move the wires now.  I didn't use it for a long time and it was always in his case but somehow this happened.  Honestly I will buy again because I think I just bought a faulty one with a bad wire.  The sound quality is very nice when I wear it for the gym and the battery life is good to.  Honestly, for people who love expensive headphones, if you let them wear this one and tell them its 100 bucks, they will not know the difference.  Don't buy expensive headphones! this will do the job!

author: Eliyahu
title: Fantastic headphones for this process range but not noise cancelling.
content:
I bought these headphones primarily for using to listen to podcasts and classes as well as talk on the phone. I am not an audiophile and I can't comment on how sound quality. They sound great to me but if you need high quality music check other reviews.

Look/Design
These look great. Not the nicest I've seen but certainly comparable to ones that cost 4-5 times the price.

Accessories:
They come with an attractive and very convenient carrying case with a caribiner clip. They also come with small, medium, and large ear tips as well as a USB cable, both of which are standard in all wireless headphones.

Use:
These stay in my ears great and feel very comfortable. I hear the sounds great and unlike most other Bluetooth headphones in this process range the people I spoke to over the phone had no problem hearing me whatsoever.

Distance- The connection was great until about 30 feet even with a wall in the way.

Cons-
This first con is a con with virtually all Bluetooth headphones. The lackbof enough buttons. There is only 3 buttons - volume up, volume down, and power and with those three buttons I need to be able to do about fifteen functions such as change tracks, pair Bluetooth, redial, answer calls, etc. Extra buttons would be useful. I'm not holding this against them because all Bluetooth headphones have this issue.

The second gripe I have is that in the title these are listed as noise cancelling. They are not. In the description noise cancelling is not listed at all which makes me suspect that it was put in the product title by mistake. I deducted 1 star because although these are great headphones I was expecting noise cancelling.

I cannot comment in the waterproof feature as the most water they have gotten on them was when I walked through a drizzle. They did fine but virtually every headphone would have.

Bottom line- I've tried at least 10 different pairs of Bluetooth headphones in this price range and so far it seems this is among the best for talking on the phone or listening to podcasts. If they remove the words noise cancelling from the product title I'd gladly give it 5 stars.

author: John Rivers
title: Just Wow.
content: I was super excited for this order and it did deliver. Wow. Love the look and feel of it. I like the way it feels when wearing. It looks like I am wearing a beats but minus the cost. Pairing the device was a breeze. Sound quality is amazing. Wire is perfect size and stays away from obstructing. This is going to be my go to set for the gym. I wore it to the gym and it stays in place and didn't even feel I am wearing it. I highly recommend this to anyone.

author: Elizabeth Metz
title: Fast pairing, good sound, very comfortable.
content:
Audiophiles will probably be able to tell that these aren't exactly the best headphones on the planet.

That said, for my purposes (largely just listening to audiobooks while walking), the sound quality is perfect.  They're comfortable in my ears, the battery life is fantastic, and I couldn't believe how easy it was to pair them with my iPad.  Seriously took me something like five seconds.  Easiest pairing ever.

Considering the price, I think these may be the best headphones I've owned, when all factors are considered.  Wouldn't hesitate to recommend them to other audiobook listeners.

(Like I said, YMMV when it comes to music.  I suspect there may be a bit of tinniness to them, which might make them unsuitable for folks who are really into their music.  If a factory car radio offends you, I'd skip these and go a bit more premium.)

author: Charles
title: All bass, no treble.
content:
These are about what you'd expect for $20. The setup is easy as any other Bluetooth device and the battery is on par with other earbuds. I like how the controls are on the earpiece and not the cord so it keeps the earbuds from tugging during runs and workouts.

The ear loop doesn't do much to keep the buds in place so like most earbuds, you're depending on the buds being firmly crammed in your ear canal to stay in place during an intense workout. They'll stay on your ear, but not IN your ear. My biggest problem with these is the sound. Like the title, it's all bass and no treble giving everything a muffled sound. To make sure it was the Otiums I tried another set of headphones and they sounded fine. Even going back to the Otiums I tried adjusting the EQ settings on my phone. When I turned up the treble, everything got so muffled that I could barely hear anything.

I ultimately ended up going back to my old headphones until I get find something better than these.

author: Albert miranda
title: Absolutely amazing sound, great battery, durable.
content: I absolutely love these buds, the battery usually lasts me the whole day (I'm a heavy listener), bass is very punchy and sounds clear, actually very similar to Beats Powebeats, but for a fraction of the price, you really can't go wrong with these, the wire that connects both sides is tangle proof and durable, you will absolutely love these, and for the price you can't beat it...this is what value-performance means! I would also recommend replacing rhe rubber piece by memory foam, but thats just me preference, they give you different rubber tips for you to use whatever feels better. I ABSOLUTELY RECOMMEND THESE!!

author: Alison K. Garabedian
title: Compatible with iPhone 11
content:
Edited 9/27/19: After an update from Apple on their new iOS these work great with the phone for pause and play! I discovered before returning these fortunately that our Apple HomePod also did not work to pause and play my music from the lock screen, and that was a big red flag for me obviously since if anything is compatible, those should be. These are a great inexpensive option for the iPhone 11!

I'm not sure if it's the phone or the new iOS but these headphones do not work with the iphone 11. They will pair, and they will play music, but you can't push the button on the headset to pause/play the music, and you can't even pause by pressing the button on the iphone. You have to completely turn off the headset to get the music to pause. And then if you turn it back on again you have to start the music from the iphone, you can't press the button on the headset. Nice and comfy but they just won't work for me.

author: Toua
title: Great sound and great mic!
content:
I bought these because they were on the amazon deal of the day. I tried different brands, but noticed these have better mics for talking. My wife noticed a huge difference in these headphones compared to the other brands I have bought in the past. The mic is clear and she said it sounds like someone speaking to you on their phone's mic. Awesome job on the mic guys!

Noise cancellation is great, but isn't as great as other third party brands. But I feel the better mic quality makes up for this. If anything, I can always turn up the volume on the sound for better noise cancellation.

author: John Bannon
title: Five Stars
content: I bought these at the end of May 2016 and they failed at the end of September 2016 (4 months).  I had them in while working out and they all of a sudden died and wouldn't come back on.  Usually before turning off they will tell you they have low battery and are powering down, but that didn't happen this time.  I plugged them in to charge them and when I went to unplug them they had melted to the charging cable and I had hot liquid plastic all over my hands. Do not buy.

author: Steven Burris
title: Junk
content: Was great then one day right side stopped working can’t answer phone so I trashed them don’t waste your money

author: S. Thygesen
title: Curse my unreasonable expectations of function!
content:
Personally, I like my electronics to last at least two years, and this only made it about a quarter of that time, so I'm dissatisfied. But, hey, you might feel differently. It's all about that personal preference.

If you don't want to replace your headphones every six months, these won't be right for you. If it bothers you that the headphones will stop accepting a charge after that time, and, instead, you'll have some nice plastic and rubber ear accessories that can't even power on, you might like to look elsewhere.

If you want to pay $40 a year for headphones, these are for you. $20 every six months, and you can have fully functional headphones!

You do you!

author: Joshua
title: Sound quality of music and phone calls is great!!
content:
These are great wireless headphones. I've wanted something that I didn't have to be tethered to give me more mobility. Running on a treadmill, I've been holding my device (becuase...wired headphones) which I have dropped on more than one occasion. And the other wireless earbuds I have don't have any kind of cord, so when one falls out, I run the risk of stepping on it or losing it completely. These don't fall out!! And if they do, I have the peace of mind that they are soft tethered to my ears, and then to each other while still being wireless. They are also comfortable. I have worn these for several hours at a time around the house. If I do have to take them off for a minute, I hang them around my neck.
  Noise cancellation is good, and charging is easy.  Sound quality is good, with a good ratio of base to treble. Battery life  is also decent. They outlast the battery on my mp3 player. Overall, a decent little set of bluetooth headphones with a nifty carrying case. I would order these again.

author: T H
title: I'd opt for another pair despite decent sound quality and price
content:
Decent for the price. Good range. My issue is that the ear pieces (on the exterior) are too big for my ears and hang over them, which looks real stupid. Also, the band which connects the two pieces doesn't lay symmetrically and often feels like it's pulling. Any movement of the band causes sound in the ear which is distracting. Finally, when the battery starts to get low, there's an alert that happens every 5 minutes, and it's so annoying that I always just stop using them.

UPDATE:
