Otium sent me an alternative product, Otium Magnetic Wireless Earbuds IPX7 Waterproof in-Ear Sports Earphones, which is a FAR superior product. I've used it for the past two weeks and have loved them. There are substantial improvements compared to these earphones, for only $5 more. Thanks Otium for sending me those! HIGHLY recommend the alternative product.

author: Olivia
title: Good value for the price
content: The first pair I received was defective but after contacting the company they made sure to give me a full refund and sent me a new pair that I have not had any issues with. They work great and I've had them for almost a year now. The battery life is the same as when I received them and the sounds quality has remained great as well.

author: JJtwinmom
title: Awesome value!! Very sturdy!
content: I’ve had these headphones for six months, and for the price they are awesome! They charge quickly, and last 6-8 hours of constant listening time. (I wear them at night to block out darling husband’s breathing apparatus.) Phone calls - even conference calls- are clear, controls (once you are used to them) work well. I walk and jog with them and they stay put. And the manufacturer isn’t kidding about the water-resistance - mine went through the washing machine (AND the drier!) and is still good as new! Now, I’ve used much more expensive in-ear Bluetooth headphones, and while I cannot claim that these are better as far as sound quality or comfort, they come very close. They are easier to stick into a pocket then the ones with a neck part - so I have actually not lost them. And for the price, well, you really can’t beat it!

author: StarLine
title: Try These First!
content:
I saw my son with a pair of these and I asked him how he liked them, and he said he was really pleased.  He let me try them on and listen to music with them and I was sold

My outer ear passages are small, so I can’t wear strapless earbuds, or even the bigger white ones  because they fall out.  These have a line that runs between them and ear hooks to support the bud itself in place.

They charge fully within about an hour and will last approx 5 hours.  There’s a recorded voice notification telling me when the battery is getting low, that’s pretty cool.  They are easy to roll up and put away in a convenient place.

The sound quality is great, especially for only $18. Other companies buds can cost easily over $100 and may have a little better quality but not much.  I would encourage you to try these first.

author: Christina Koch
title: Can’t charge anymore****
content:
I absolutely LOVED my headset until it stopped charging for me 😩 I purchased mine Oct 2018 so it hasn’t been that long. I’m hoping to get a replacement or I will have to search elsewhere; other than my charging bust, the headset is amazing.

*********UPDATE: WOW, JUST WOOW... After my 3 star review and comment regarding my disappointment, Otium emailed me to apologize and further sent me a free replacement with 3 otium brand options to choose from. Otium was diligent in making sure I received the replacement and asked that I reply should I still not be satisfied. Well, just with the excellence in customer service I have to increase my star rating to 5 HUGE STARS... I had given the replacement to my husband as I had purchased a new pair; but he loves them so much that I too will be purchasing another pair. Amazing overall service!!!!.. Thank you Otium for bringing my satisfaction on this product to another level. I am truly impressed. Highly recommend!

author: Jo W.
title: Wish they were adjustable
content:
I like BUT not luv .. the over the ear piece is a too large .. if the " in " ear piece could be adjusted up on the " over " ear piece then they would fit better and I would like them more .. I'm constantly having to adjust them since they don't fit right for my ear size ..  you can see in pics how big they are and second pic is as far as i can adjust before they no longer go behind ear and fall off .
Another small issue is when I wear glasses because of how I have to adjust them it causes the blue charged light to be seen in my glasses at times .. of course only in right eye and only sometimes .
The battery does last for a good while and charging is fairly quick .

author: Vivian
title: Great quailty product, clean and smooth feeling, decent price, no microphone but listening quality makes up for it :)
content: Bluetooth headphones work perfectly. Doesn't take long to charge, maybe an hour or two and it's fully charged. Lasts quite a while, especially if you're not using it, like, 6 hours consecutively. Had these headphones for 3 months now and they still feel really nice and clean. The quality is pretty decent too for its price. I don't think I've even scratched the headphones or have any marks on them. They work pretty well for working out too. Even if you sweat the ear clips help keep the headphones in your ears. The headphones will warn you a few minutes before they will die "Battery low." They also will tell you when headphones turn on/off and when they connect/disconnect to Bluetooth. Overall, pretty impressed with these headphones. Can listen to music, watch YouTube, Netflix, and even listen to phone calls. The only downside is there isn't a microphone so you'd have to keep your phone close to you, but I already knew that before buying this product. Distance works pretty great too; I'd say 20-30 meters is pretty accurate. I bring these to work and walk into another room with thick walls and it still works pretty well. You'll be able to tell how far it can go from the source when it starts to get scratchy and starts beeping.

author: SY
title: Mediocre sound, poor fit.
content:
Bought those after my MEE x7 battery gave way after a year. Those seem to be bigger there is a year warranty on those, so why not. Mistake.

First thing I noticed - sound is mediocre, best thing I can say : they're better than free buds airline give you on the flight. I am using Bose QC35 as my working headphones, and using buds for sports etc. Mee didn't disappoint, these... I hoped I can get used to, but no absolutely not.

Fit is nor secure, nor comfortable. With a bike helmet any turn of head pops the giant thing out. Cable seems to be made to push those out too.

On a plus side, the battery seems to love forever.

Bottom line - I'll better change Mee every year than live with those.

author: beatlesrubbersoul
title: good sound quality
content: Works well, good sound quality, comes with 3 size pairs of ear buds.  I would give this 5 stars but I had a heck of time getting these initially charged and connected to phone via Bluetooth, plus the instructions could have been a little more detailed.  Once connected they work great.  When you press and hold a button on the side of the right earphone, a voice tells you that the headphones are on.  Press and hold again and the voice tells you the headphones are off.  Once connected to your main Bluetooth device, they automatically reconnect each time you use them.  Volume and moving to next track can be done on the earphones too.  These also have a built mic which works good for phone conversations. Overall an excellent wireless headphone set.

author: Bmcgnh
title: Great for sports
content:
Love them. I have used bluetooth headphones before and I found they would not work well while bike riding--they would cut in and out frequently. I figured it may have been because my iPhone app for cycling was possibly hogging bandwidth. I'm probably wrong but it was so noticeable I used some wired plugs instead. Then they were getting  finicky due to corrosion on the plugs so I tried bluetooth again.
These work great. I've been using them for several weeks and I haven't had any issues with them on bike rides. I've tried them once or twice while running and they stay in--great for running and cycling.

author: LynnyTG
title: BIG BANG for YOUR BUCK‼️
content:
I wonder how your company makes any profit selling these headphones‼️  They are super AND so inexpensive‼️
• Secure, comfy ear bud fit – the over-the-ear pieces are probably not even necessary.
• Hard to believe – ALL functions work as promised.
• So easy to use.
• Phone communication is clear for both parties.
• This is my 3rd try with a BT “necklace” headset – 3rd one’s the charm AND the least expensive.
• Carrying case – a terrific bonus – attractive – roomy enough to include lip balm, money, charge cord, small mirror, hair clips, etc... AND it has a sturdy carabiner hook.
• Neck cord shortener – another bonus – shortened cord can be clipped under hair so it doesn’t contact neck.
• An excellent  gift to give.
• Arrived in 2 days!
• Only 1 problem –  I mistakenly ordered the red cord instead of the black. Truly – NOT a problem at all.

THANKS, Otium folks‼️

author: JW
title: Otium Bluetooth Headphones - Work nicely, pair easily, decent battery life
content:
I keep two pairs of these on hand. They work quite well, and sound just as good as any other Bluetooth headset. Bluetooth isn't a great transmission system for high quality audio, no matter what brand you buy. The limitation is Bluetooth, not the headset.

With that in mind, I can't agree with people who claim other Bluetooth earbuds sound much better. From AirPods to Bose Bluetooth, they all suffer the same quality issues.

Ignoring the deficiencies in Bluetooth transmission, the sound that you get has decent bass, and highs. The volume level is fine, and the battery life is about 8 hours.

I'd recommend these, especially at the price point.

author: Lynn
title: Great quality!
content: I bought these in January of 2018. I use them at least 30 hours a week for work (I clean and listen to music, podcasts, audiobooks, etc. While I'm working) and going to the gym. I use a battery pack to charge them in my car when I'm done for the day. They last about 7-8 hours on a full charge. The audio quality is great. I do wish they went a little louder so I could hear over the vacuum better, but that's an isolated issue. I don't get the multiple low-battery warnings. Just once about 5 minutes before they actually die. I haven't had a single issue with these headphones and I've had them the longest I've had any other ones. They stay in place while running and bouncing around, though they're a little loose on my tiny ears. There are a great value and very much worth the fair price.

author: pwing
title: Worth the price. Not much more.
content:
Sound quality matches the price; perhaps even a little better. They are fairly comfortable, and stay in my ears. They come with extra nibs which are silicone. I've worn them for up to 30 minutes at a time and not had sore ears that I've had with most cheaper earphones.

Cannot comment on battery life as I never use more than 30 minutes on a single charge.

Deducted one star because of the misuse of the term "noise cancelling" in the description. These do not actively cancel noise. They muffle noise, just like earplugs would. It is an important distinction not made clear in the description. That being said, they do seem to muffle exterior noise fairly well, but it is important to remember that they are not earplugs. (I would not use them occupationally for ear protection). They will not perform nearly as well as actual noise cancelling headphones.

Edit: After a year, I came back and deducted another star due to the ridiculously excessive "battery low" warning that starts at about 25%. It repeats "battery low" every few minutes until you charge it. One warning, or flashing the led would be enough.

author: Justin
title: Best cheap Bluetooth wireless ear buds for music (not phone calls!)
content:
Love these things!

I burn through headphones having used many sets under a helmet for turn by turn navigation and tunes while riding motorcycle.

Wireless is imperative to save your phone output jack, and keep the nav instructions coming.

Every time you remove a helmet you risk breaking headsets, no matter how nice they are. (unless helmet mounted).

Finding a great set around $20 is tough, but these for the application perfectly!

Plenty loud, I often keep music turned down on the phone and navigation voice hurts my ears at Max volume!

Last 4-5 hours riding listening to podcasts easily. Claims 8 hour life, and that it possible if you turn the volume down in a quiet room. I find it charges in 30 minutes or so, so bring a small charger with if you want to keep them alive on an international flight with layovers.

Edit*
Microphone never really worked properly to capture sound for phone calls. None of these style earbuds work well but these are especially bad. Reducing a star for bad phone call quality. Still great for tunes/podcasts and turn by turn navigation under a helmet.

And this week they finally stopped working after about 6 months of hard use, they still connect and play fine through right side but the left became intermittent abd now stopped working. This is almost certainly due to abuse and not a defective product. They spent time under helmets and take a beating removing it after a ride, also spent days and days in my pockets getting abused by keys and the like. Overall a good product that holds up as well as anything else I've tried, at a lower price point that I can afford to keep replacing without breaking the bank like other higher end options. I'm trying other options in this price range as of now, but revert to the Otiums as a safe baseline Performance per dollar.

author: Hayle
title: Do they work fine? Yes. Would i buy again? No
content:
Ok so these headphones are pretty good on price, they sound ok. I purchased these to use with my Apple Watch for when i go to the gym. I’ve owned them for a while now, they serve their purpose fine, however i have noticed that they will occasionally cut in and out. I’m not sure if they do this only when the battery is starting to get low?? It’s defini not a range problem because as i said it’s always connected to my watch which i am always wearing. However, for around $20 they are just ok.
So moral of the story is you get what you pay for. If they were to ever completely break i would probably try another pair and not purchase these ones again.

author: Adam Williams
title: Awesome sound!
content: These are outstanding!  I read so many reviews for so many days before I finally tried these. Sound is amazing compared to several buds I've had. Synced up to S8 easily!  I'll agree with others,  can't beat the sound for the price. I listen to pop,  hip hop, rock,  some country,  etc. and they sound awesome. Wear them at the gym and they stay in, even with 20 min's on treadmill. I have big ears and all other buds would fall out. So far I've only recharged once, and it notified me twice every 10 min's before dying. Only concern I have is that the piece that goes over ear is bendable. I thought they would be solid. I wear glasses and they do stay the way I wanted them to,  maybe that's the way they're supposed to be.  Highly recommend to everyone.

author: Patrick McBride
title: Wow!! Can't believe these are so cheap!
content: I was expecting a lot after reading the glowing reviews here and man, I was NOT disappointed! The quality of the sound here is unbelievable for the size and price. I used to have a pair of nose headphones (wired) that sounded amazing... the sound here reminds me of those very much. Very clear mids and highs, and a surprising amount of bass for something this small. They're not perfect, however... with low frequency bass you can clearly hear it distorting, but honestly, just the fact that it can produce some of these sounds is impressive to me. As far as the form factor, these are great as well. They fit right in my ear and don't move at all, even while running. I don't think I even really need the ear loop but it's nice to have and makes me feel like they're more secure. I also really love that the volume controls on the headphones adjust the volume on my phone... all my other Bluetooth headphones have separate volume for the device itself and my phone. Here it's integrated into a single volume. Plus, you get a nice carrying case and a clip to hold the excess wire behind your head so it doesn't trail as much. All this for only $20... it's rather unbelievable. I'm actually looking for people I can buy these as gifts for... that's how good they are :)

author: Jeanette
title: Bargain. They sound bargain as well. feel cheap
content:
The price point is what you are paying for here. I came from LG 910s until the new ones come out i needed something cheap and i saw these. The drop in quality is like comparing talking to someones soul directly vs talking to someone through 2 cans tied together with string. The sound quality is so wonkee its like super bass but it wants to sound clear its sounds like shit.  They feel really cheap too. (nitpicks incoming)  Having one in and one hanging out is a pain in the ass because the one side out jerks the other side outta your ear(Adjusting the cable clip seems to make no difference). The noise cancellation you get from these is too good if you work in construction or don't wanna be one of those idiots walking down the street with BOTH earphones in while there's heavy traffic all over then avoid these. If your at the gym though and wanna be lost in your thoughts of what headphones to buy next then look no further.

The good points is that they are cheap. Charge decently quick, the color scheme is simple and slick. The UX though is kinda rough one button for more than 4 functions is a no no. They work only after trying it a couple of times. The minimalist design is good though. nice and clicky buttons, water resistant. they stay on your neck pretty well. I ride around in an offroad dumptruck sometimes and they stay on very well but this is an extreme situation. For most people they will stay on through regular use.

author: Riley Odean
title: The review you want to read. Tested for a year
content:
EDITED**

After I initially left this review they reached out to me and offered to send me a new set, along with allowing me to help their R&D department improve their product. However I respectfully declined.

Alright so let me write this out, I’ve had these puppies for almost a year now so if there’s a review to listen to it’s this one.
When I first got them I was like “these things are sweet they’re a bargain deal” and now I see why people spend money on nice things. I used these to work out. Initially they were great but as the time has grown on, I’ve noticed some things, some minor some large.
The ear piece doesn’t really fit that well, and they don’t offer adjustment at all. You have to rely on the squishy buds being able to hold them in your ear. The band that goes around your head sticks to your neck especially once you start to sweat and if you turn your head enough it’ll rip one out of your ear - I constantly have to find myself recentering the band so this doesn’t happen.
The Bluetooth is terrible, it has a range of maybe 12 feet but if there is ANYTHING including your arm or leg of your shorts (???) in the way you get a disrupted signal. This to me is annoying as all hell half the time I don’t even work out with music anymore.

With all that being said, they do sound great especially for the price. A little too much bass which isn’t a problem if you listen to edm or rap but for rock music it’s slightly annoying.

So if you use these to work out it’s a terrible idea which is how they’re marketed. HOWEVER if you’re the kind of cancerous person that uses headphones while you drive,  or on public transport these are perfect for you.

I’m also an industrial designer so this is my wheelhouse and in the most humble way possible like I said this is your most valued opinion.

author: Cheri
title: Great headphones! Buying another pair!
content:
These are great cheap headphones! No lie, I'm incredibly impressed with these. The quality is phenomenal for such a low price! Sure, they're not, like Bose or Samsung wireless buds but these things went through my washing machine in my leggings pocket and they still worked afterwards. (I put them in a bag of rice for a day and it worked like a charm.) Bluetooth connectivity used to be really good, I could walk away for 20 feet or more and only have a few blips in sound, not sure if that took a dive because of the washer situation or if the gym I go to now has a lot more people using bluetooth headphones causing interference. Although before they went through the wash they would randomly disconnect sometimes and it was rather odd. But turning them on and off usually fixed it.  Either way, Love these! Gonna buy another pair! In part because the ones that went through the wash are a little less good in the sound department but also cause I'd like to be able to alternate when one set is charging.

Pros: great quality sound for a cheap price, bluetooth, fairly long battery life, holy cow waterproof, bluetooth connectivity decent.

Cons: fall off your ears sometimes, battery life varies with how well you take care of them (over-charging, blaring volume, leaving them connected without turning them off), sometimes the bluetooth connectivity can be interfered by other bluetooth stuff or just walls, power button placement is somewhat awkward -if the headphone is falling out of your ear you will sometimes accidentally push the pause button while trying to shove it back in.

author: Leo K
title: Great Bluetooth headset for a great price
content:
Feb 20, 2019 - There's isn't a whole lot I cant say about this headset that hasn't already been mentioned by countless others, they're just that good. Battery life is great for how small they are, hours of listening time and days of standby. The fit comfortably on my ear and do not slip out despite any exercise activity I've thrown at them. They're also comfortable to use for prolong periods of time, unlike previous in-ear headset I've used in the past.
I would have no issues recommending or re-purchasing these IPX7 Bluetooth headphones.

UPDATE: 08/14/2019 - Battery life is still. I use them nearly ever day during the week, twice a day during my morning and afternoon commute to work, 15-20 minutes per use. I charge it on Sunday and pretty much leave it unplugged throughout the week. So far, it lasted all the way through Friday afternoon without any needing to be recharged.
As for the performance, that a different story. Not sure what happen when, but depending on who the cable rest in the back of my head, the audio might cut off one of the ear pieces for a second or two, or come across with a bit of static. It doesn't always do it and it doesn't last a long time, usually shifting the cable is enough to reset the issue, but it has become noticeable over the past couple weeks. Again, I do not think this is a fault of the manufacturing process, more than likely a result of one of the kid messing with it, but felt it should be noted.  It is advertised as a sports headphone, so I expect it to survive a bit of rough housing, but I also don't expect miracle when it comes to it being kid proof.
Overall, still very happy with this purchase.

author: MagicMike
title: Good quality, sound, and comfort for the money - I highly recommend them
content:
Sound:They do not have the range like Bose or Beats, but the sound quality is better than your average $20 earbuds and on point at a moderate volume (high and low volumes, not the best). I believe the mixed reviews on sound are more related to the users device equalizer than the headphones themselves because mine sound better connected to certain devices and pretty bad when connected to others.

Comfort: They are very light weight, have good noise cancelling, the cord doesn't have an annoying remote flopping around and pulling the cord to the side and best of all..they don't fall out of my ears and they don't need to be uncomfortable to do so.

Connectivity: It was very easy to connect just like any other Bluetooth device with a 20-30 foot range.

Value: I feel these are in line with about a $50 set of earbuds (so a good deal at $20)

author: Patrick
title: Buy the Square Trade Warranty
content:
Just had my fourth pair of these go "Bricked".

If you go on to AliBaba's website you will find dozens of companies selling these from $1-$15.00.

The Pros.
sound quality was acceptable
easy pairing.
Phone quality was good, had no complaints from anyone I was speaking with about background noise.
Cons
F'ing uncomfortable and took a few weeks to get used too.
each unit lasted no more than 4-6 months, had to pay a $6 shipping fee every time I warranted the units.
Battery life, went to half life on all four units within 8 weeks.
Bluetooth distance was no more than 15 feet

I should have spent the extra few dollars and got the Square Trade warranty, because the last replacement I got from them died after the warranty period was over.

author: Michael Mayo
title: Poor bass tone makes it distracting but it's ans ok system.
content:
It's ok for the price. But sound quality is low. The fit is fine for large people but I can see where a persons with a normal or small ears may have comfort issues. I am 6'2" with a large dome so it was fine for me. They are more bulky than many BT earphones. But for the price one can't expect a compact low profile system.
 The sound quality is my only complaint. The base sounds like one of my high schools buddies poorly screwed in under powered subwoofer. It has a poor sound to the base that is distracting. If you are a music lover and need clear tones then maybe this is an issue for you. It need an EQ in a bad way. But otherwise it seems fine. But again, it's a low end of the market product. So you get what you pay for.

author: The Nutmeg Observer
title: These are GREAT earbuds.
content:
These wireless earbuds are SUPERB.  They wirelessly paired up easily with my laptop and several Windows- and Android-based cellphones I own.  The audio clarity is remarkable across a wide range of volume (Careful!  Loud is really LOUD with these earbuds!).  I listened to different channels on JazzRadio.com just to get a variety of high and low-pitched instruments playing together.  WOW, these buds reproduce everything from a thumping bass to a squealing blues harmonica or Hawaiian steel guitar just perfectly.  And the "presence" is remarkable; sounds like being in a room full of musicians; or should I say, like having a jazz joint strapped to your head.  The noise cancelling on these buds appears to be "passive" (noise isolating), not "active" (electronic noise-signal inversion and cancellation):  Just plug 'em in your ears more tightly to reduce outside noise.  This works fine for me while listening to music from my cellphone as I walk or jog along a noisy street.

These earbuds are comfortable on my ears, light-weight and unobtrusive feeling.  Volume up/down buttons work just fine, even with my large fingers.  In my experience, however, the forward/back skip function (longer depressions of the volume up/down buttons) does not seem to work with Amazon Music either online or offline.  Same for Pandora Radio.  Maybe it would work with iPhone / iTunes, which I have not tried.  This shortcoming is OK with me.

Telephone-related functionality of the buttons on these earbuds works fine.  Telephone audio quality as heard in the earbuds is excellent; the called party says the audio quality on that end is "satisfactory".

These Otium earbuds are a great buy!  I spent much more on other earbuds from Amazon that claimed to have active noise cancelling; I returned those earbuds when I found the noise cancelling to be non-working or ineffective.  These Otium earbuds work just as well as the returned models, for a lot less money.  I would strongly recommend them.

author: Bookfresser
title: Fantastic sound, great design, yay!
content: This is the best pair of wireless earbuds I have owned! The sound quality is amazing, especially for the price! The highs are very crisp and clean, and finally, finally there is enough base so that I don’t feel like I am listening to music coming from inside a tin can 10 feet away!! The ear buds fit comfortably and don’t fall out, and I love that the controls are on the earpiece and not the cord! No more fumbling! The on/off button is a big button right on the other side of my right ear! The battery seems to run about 8 hours, as advertised; I’ve only been woken up a few times in the morning by a soft voice telling me the battery was low!😉 After I received this one, I was so impressed that I immediately bought a second one for downstairs! Other pluses: One: It works with the language flashcard programs on my phone! (Believe it or not, a lot of earbuds don’t, for some reason). Two: The pitch is perfect for drowning out my husband’s snoring!😴

author: April
title: better than I was expecting
content:
I have had this headphone for a few days. It works better than I was expecting.  Here are some pros and cons:
Pros:
1. Nice sound and bass. It is not as good as my Sony headphone but I will say about 80% as good. I could hear the treble with the clear sound.
2. It is easy to pair. What you need to do is just turned it on and found it in the Bluetooth setting.
3. Lots of different ear tips included in the case. The small ones fit me the best.
4. Battery can last a few hours.
5. Easy controls.  The buttons are located in the right headphone.
6. Easy carry.  It can be carried in pocket with the shell case.
Cons:
1. Not comfortable when you wear it for an extended period of time. It hurt the ears. I use it only when I am doing workout.
If you want a decent set of earbuds, this one might be your choice.

author: Tasha
title: Pretty good for a couple of months
content: This is my 4th purchase of these headphones in the last two years. I know that is excessive in a limited amount of time. The first headphones was placed in my car cup holder and some coffee dropped on them. From then they stopped working. The second pair worked fine for a while but one ear bud would lose sound. The third ear bud had the same issue as the second one and now onto the newest headphone which are functioning fine for the time being. Hopefully these last more than 6 months unlike the two previous earphones. When these earphone are up and running they are my best friend when it comes to listening to music, watching youtube or talking on the phone. Utium please work on the earbuds sound issue. I like your headphones but if I have to buy another headphone it more than likely will not be yours if the sounds continues to go out.

author: Maiah
title: I like the headset it being wireless
content: I like the headset it being wireless; the reason I purchased one in the first place. I like being mobile and able to talk on the phone while my phone is ducked on the wireless charging port. The sound quality [clarity] is its optimum. Nice noise cancelling ability. The only drawback for me is the ear hook, it DOES NOT fit. The hook is intended for regular to bigger people, i wish they'd have option for petites LOL. I could not bend or mold it to fit, so it just hung loosely looking funny on my ears. Other reviews mentioned the repetitive reminder when battery is low, my solution is to charge them right away as soon as I hear the reminder for the first time.

author: i-zik
title: Comfortable and lightweight with good sound
content:
This headphones was design for sport and gym, with the right fit to my ears. I can wear them for hours without even notice it, since they are comfortable and lightweight. silicon ears hooks are very flexible, and already installed earbuds are the most common ears size and i just wear them as they are. I find these earbuds  to give some passive background noises cancellation, just by wearing them, even no music is being played.

When I at the gym or just outside walking/running, the last thing i wanna do is balancing my headphones back on my ears. Many types of headphones have controllers on the wire. despite the fact it doesn’t look that good, it also take off the balance from the headset, and many times you find yourself repositioning them. Not in this case. Controllers here was placed on the headphones. With one multifunction button on the front, and the rest on the top. They are responsive and easy to reach without taking a look.

Paring these headphones was fast and smooth with the voice guided system that alerts you when entered pairing mode, when successfully paired, for incoming calls, low battery level and more.The BT range is enormous. I live in second floor. I left my phone on my desk and went down to the street. Well, i was still able to receive calls, listen to music, and all without interruption.Sound quality is nothing but amazing. Crystal clear sound, no background noises, very rich music quality with strong and deep base, and super high volume.

author: Ty
title: Great sound quality and pretty comfortable especially for long runs.
content:
I really liked these headphones. I have a few different sets of headphones as I work out a lot as a firefighter and I am also an audio engineer, but by no means are these pro mixing headphones and nor should be treated as such.

These are fun, easy to use headphones that I wanted for running. I run a lot as physical training is important. Since these are both attached, I normally don't use these at the station, but when I'm training on my days off. I like that these are over the head, so when I start to sweat, they stay put.

The sound is pretty good, it is no $200 set of high audio, but I'd say beat any pair of beats any day. Perfect for running outdoors or on a hike. They can get pretty loud, but I don't really like to listen to my music too loud.

Cons, They are a little big, so if you have smaller ears like me, the smallest size is still a bit too big. I swapped in some tips from another set I had long ago.

author: Ikram
title: Received a defective one but awesome customer support fixed the issue!
content:
Update July 17, 2019

Upgraded my rating to a 5 star from a 2! Really awesome customer support and resolved my issues very satisfactorily. They are very open to customer concerns and takes pride in their service and products!

Past review:
I don't usually write bad reviews. Specially for something that doesn't cost much to buy. But I have been really disappointed with this pair of headphones. Will continue to use for a few more months until I can find a better pair.

I guess things like these comes in good or bad batches. I got the worst batch unfortunately. Hope you guys are luckier.

Oh! Do follow the advice of not using a fast USB charger to charge these. I failed to listen for another pair from a different manufacturer and sure enough, I fried those pair after a few months. Those were really good too! And this new pair was to replace the ones I fried.

Pros:
1. Good fit
2. Good battery life

Cons:
1. Terribly muddy sound! I tried everything! With, without EQ. Low low low bass settings, high mid and hi freq setting. But can't get rid of the muddiness. Really dissapointing.
2. Asked seller about what can be done. No response. Probably because too may people are complaining.

Update July 16, 2019
Finally received response. But I have already returned the item and now waiting for a refund. I bought another pair from a different manufacturer that didn't have any problems before.

Have asked this mfg to contact me if they have a better product that has also been tested thoroughly before shipping them to customers. I will certainly give them another shot as I truly believe in second chances.

author: wi75550n
title: They were great until they weren't great.
content:
If you get a pair that was made by someone that can solder, then they are probably great...  I reached out to customer service when one of my headphones stopped working.  They told me I was out of the warranty period, and to try to "hold down the power button".

I work on electronics, so I opened them up.  The soldering on my set of headphones was terrible.  I fixed a bad connection on one of my headphones, then two weeks later they stopped working completely, so I opened up the other bud to find a bad connection to the battery!

I use these maybe once a week at my desk when the office is loud.  I agree that I was out of the warranty period, but these things were very lightly used, so I have no idea how the connections are coming apart.  The only thing I can think of is that they were barely making electrical connections to begin with.

Judging by my experience with these headphones,  you could luck out and get a great sounding set of headphones, or you could get a pair that fall apart from sitting on a desk and being used a few times a month.  I'm not trying to sound disgruntled... They were only $20...

It's a great deal if they don't break.  I think I will probably just spend extra money on a brand that has a better chance of lasting longer.

author: Shellbear22
title: Good for listening to audio
content: I bought these to use at the gym to listen to music while lifting weights and running.  They work well and I enjoy them.  When I was doing circuit training g the left side kept falling out and that drove me crazy, but that was mostly when I was jumping or doing larger movements.  They do not come out when I run.  I have had some trouble with people hearing me on a phone call so I don't like to use them for anything but listening to music and podcasts.

author: Happy Customer
title: Great earbuds, especially for the price
content:
Got these in order to replace some long-lost corded earbuds for travelling. Decided to dive into wireless, although I'm not exactly excited about having another device to charge.
The fit is very comfortable, and they don't feel like they will fall out at all.
Travelling on a plane isn't an issue. The earbuds seal well enough to keep out a majority of the sound, blocking me from needing to jack the volume up to max on my phone or computer.
The sound is crisp and clear, probably some of the best earbuds I've had in that regard, even for pairs costing 2x+ the amount I paid for these.
The mic appears lack luster. I took a few phone calls, and although people could hear me, they said it sounded like I was far away. I didn't buy them with any expectation of using them for that, but I probably would have gone 5 stars had that worked seamlessly.
The battery life seems solid, I can't quote an hour amount, but I've only had them die once, and that was after I had used them while going to sleep and they had stayed on (sometimes transmitting audio) all night.

author: vmaniqui
title: i have a nice feeling about it - GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE.
content:
just received my otium earphone and was so excited to test it due to the thousands of positive feedback, as soon as i tried it, i have a nice feeling about it. it has a good fit. turned it on and that's when i felt disappointed. sound is not good. it's so bassy and so flat. it sounds like the vocal is muted. i couldn't understand or hear clearly the vocals of the songs i am playing. it's all bass. i don't know if i got a bad unit or this is how the sound should be. don't know if i will return this or keep it. i guess it goes to say that you get what you pay for. totally disappointed. the only good things about this earphone is it has better fit and it pairs easily. not as good as what the reviews are.

UPDATE: the unit i received might be an isolated case but nonetheless i commend OTIUM for their outstanding customer service. as soon as they saw my post they immediately  contacted me and they tried to resolve my issue. since then i changed my review to I LIKE IT for reason that they stand to their product. i have not received the replacement unit but i am satisfied with the way they handled my situation. Great Service - THANKS OTIUM for your outstanding serivice.

UPDATE: 9/3/2017: received the replacement unit and this one is way better than the first one i got. bass and treble is balanced. sound is not flat and has great sound. AWESOME product. built quality is top notch. you wouldn't think that this a $20 earphone. KUDOS to the seller for their outstanding service and fast shipping. seller and product is highly recommended. THANK YOU OTIUM.

author: Jack Reilly
title: FROM PLANET COOL
content:
These blew the top of my head clean off.  As described,  you get them pretty much in your ears,  then  twist them while slightly pushing in so the ear bands are nice and tight around your ear.  I got them on perfectly.  I then had an experience,  I can only describe as being an assault on the hearing senses by a quality built audio masterwork.  They are so clear,  they actually create soundstaging,  imaging,  and things all without distortion.  I can't turn them all the way up.  So,  I don't know how loud they go.  You have plenty of room to work with.  Finally.  A set of ear buds that are so loud they can actually cause ear damage!!!!!!!!  Yay!  This doesn't mean you turn it all the way up and relax.  It just gives you the room you need to accommodate your maximum volume.  They rock.  Buy them.
Update:  every pair of ear buds I ever had,  seemed to move if I yawned or raised my eyebrows.  These don't move.  Get them in properly,  and you'll know there in properly.  These are the best ear buds I ever heard.  Oh,  and by the way,  no there are no bass booster,  or other equalizer settings.  You don't need them.  The sound is already as good as it gets.  And they set a nice high bar.  Very nice.
Update:  it's scary how nice these are.  The price doesn't seem to match the item.  This is totally confounding me.  Under $20?  Ok,  what game is this?  I almost wish I could find some huge flaw somewhere. I feel like some great company left some money on the table to benefit all of earbud mankind.  These could easily fetch double the charge.  Otium,  thank you!!!!!!

author: Nicolette H.
title: Great while they worked
content:
I'm on my second set of these and so far it seems like they last just about 6 months of use. I use them while at work to listen to audiobooks and they are pretty great for that along with blocking out the sound of the trains that go by.

I'm pretty gentle with them, never get them too sweaty or drop them, but they just stop working. The first set I had stopped working in one ear, then stopped charging. The second set has decided to shut off about every 2 minutes (which is just as annoying as you think it would be). I thought maybe it was an issue with low battery, but this headset is very determined to let you know when it is getting low. I charged it to full battery and the problem persists, so we know it's not a battery issue.

author: AlyciainTX
title: These do wonders to drown out obnoxious co-workers
content:
I work in a cubicle farm and one of my co-workers idolizes a certain pop star who likes to make the bbbrrrdddddddd high pitched sound. Rather than end up with workforce violence charges, I went ahead and bought these bad boys. The sound quality is great. The little battery lasts for several days without needing to be recharged, and the fit is really comfortable.

While they do nothing to suppress the rage that bubbles up every time I hear said co-worker clacking up the stairs in her 4 inch heels yelling "HAY GIRL, HAAAAAAAY", they do a pretty good job drowning out the rest of her nonsense if I can get them in and turned on fast enough.

author: FixItFrank
title: These are my favorite headphones ever
content:
This is my second pair of Otiums.  I bought these for the first time 2 years ago and used them daily(nightly) until 3 weeks ago when they finally failed.  I use these at night in bed as to not disturb my wife while I watch videos on my phone. The battery life is unreal on these.  They claim 8 hours but I have gotten 12-14 hours between charges.  I had a spare pair of knock-off Airpods that I tried to use after my first set of Otiums broke and they were awful.  I went right back and ordered another pair.

My only complaint is the insanely bright blue LED that indicates it's on. Whoever thought using a super bright blue LED for anything indicator wise needs to try and use on at night.  When I had my first pair, I opened them up and removed the resistor feeding the blue LED. It helped battery life slightly but more so, it made them not obnoxiously bright at night in bed.  This was when I also noticed the first pair had wax as a conformal coating to protect from moisture.  When they finally failed a few weeks ago, I opened them again to see if I could fix it and saw the wax had slid down from heat and water/sweat had corroded the PCB near the main chip.

When I opened the new pair to unhook the same resistor, I see that they have now gone to a silicone or mastic coating to water protect the board.  That will be infinitely more effective in my opinion. It's nice to see the design improve.

If you want good quality earphones with a long as heck battery life, buy these.  They are great.  I will buy another pair soon to put away as a backup. They are that great where its worth it entirely.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Terrific battery life, don't fall off
content: These headphones are terrific.  I use them all the time (Calls while driving, calls at work, working out and listening to videos).  The battery life is very good at ~3 days in my normal usage.  The sound output quality is very good and no one has ever complained about the outgoing audio, so I assume that too is good.  I like having the phone controls through the headphones, as I can pickup and hangup calls without taking my phone out of my pocket.  My old Otium headphones allowed me to activate Siri from the headset, but I haven't figured out how to do that here.  The comfort is good, but they are a little bulkier than the around the neck style.  The over the ear clips do make them more secure.  I have never had an earbud fall out of my ear while working out, unlike my around the neck-style. For the price and convenience, these are a good choice for what I consider essential gear now.

author: Charlee
title: Works great!
content: I bought these to replace the old earbuds my husband uses. He owns his own construction company and when working on a roof, he likes to stream music. The other buds he had were not noise cancelling so if he received a phone call while working, it could be hard for him to hear. He states these work great! He can listen to music and if a client calls, he picks up and he can hear them really well even with the noise of construction going on around him. He says they are comfortable, the sound quality is good and they don't bother him to wear all day. They connected quickly to his phone with no problems. I don't know about the waterproof part as it doesn't rain here a lot so they haven't gotten wet but if they are anything like mine, I'm not concerned. They were definitely worth the price I paid.

author: Zack Irwin
title: They sound good enough for what they are and for the price
content: These were cheap, so I decided to get them. They sound good enough for what they are and for the price. They definitely have a crunchy sound though, but for my intended use of phone calls during rush hour traffic and the occasional casual listening experience they will work just fine. For times when I want to get into the music and escape, I have my Sennheiser 280 HAD Pro's, or my Yamaha HS8s. Neither are as compact and portable as these. And they're plenty comfortable, coming with small, medium and large ear pieces to fit different size ears. There's a little bit of bass in the range, which is surprising but welcome. The highs are present but subdued. They definitely don't compare to the big names in the business, but the price is very fair for the product and I can't complain about these because of that.

author: Dal
title: If they're what you want, then you won't be disappointed
content:
I'm on here buying a second pair since I lost the first one (they fell out of my pocket while I was out and about), so I figured I should probably give them credit. They last plenty long. I have only used them for a couple to a few hours every couple days, but then I charge them overnight when I think about it about once a week or so. They sound as good as inexpensive headphones with a cord (that is to say, fine) and I never wore them in the shower, but I like that they're water resistant. Also, I mainly used them outside with my phone on me, but I never had any issues with range or connection.

The only problem I have had with them is that when I bike fast, the air really catches in the ear pieces and it makes the wind really loud. Even with high volume you really can't hear your music. Just wind in the ear pieces. At slower speeds they're fine.

 Like I said, I'm here to order a second pair, so clearly the pros outweigh the cons. Also, the black and red is a nice look.

author: MeAz
title: Long battery life, water proof, easy to use, great price!
content: I can keep them on in the shower!  I love these. I purchased them at the end of July, and use them several times a week for 90 minutes to 2 hours while I do a work out program that has me very active.  They stay on and sound great.  There is a little bit of a learning curve on how to use the controls, but then it's easy peasy.  I saw complaints of non-pairing with devices, and this happened to me with my ipod and a blue tooth speaker.  Just delete the earbuds from the device, and it re-pairs no problem.  I HIGHLY recommend these.  Can't beat the price, and the battery life is long.  I've never run out of battery, and I charge them only once or twice a week at most.  If they broke today I'd buy them again.

author: ABIGAILA
title: Great headphones for the gym!
content:
I am a big fan of these headphones!

I love the fact that they are wireless headphones and have a long battery life. It is very convenient to be able to control the volume on the earpiece, and after reading the instructions carefully, I found it very convenient to switch and change songs efficiently all by pressing the button on the right earpiece. Nice added bonus is that this purchase comes with different sizes of your covers so that the cushiony silicone earbuds fit bests to the individual’s ears.

They are not as moisture wicking as I was hoping, especially because I get very sweaty when I workout at the gym. However, these are very good at canceling out noise. It’s difficult to hear somebody talking next to you, especially if the volume is at a medium level. I really like the fact that the earpiece goes over your ear and helps keep it secure well you are running or being very active.

As mentioned earlier, the battery life is amazing. I can go about a week or more without having to charge them. To give you a better idea of the battery life, are usually work out about 3 to 4 times a week for about an hour. I can go without having to charge these headphones for a couple weeks. The headphones will also give you a warning when the battery is low, and you can also visualize the amount of charge left by looking at your phone and seeing how far or how low the battery icon is.

author: Roger L. Cauvin
title: Works for Listening to Music but not for Phone Calls
content:
I have another set of Otium headphones that work really well: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07D9LZ8KB.

What I like about the other headphones is that they work really well with phone calls, and they conveniently wrap around my neck and clasp together with magnets. I have recommended those headphones to friends.

I figured that another set of headphones would be nice to have at the office so I would have them in case I forgot to bring the other headphones from home, and I decided to try this model. I also thought this model might stay on better when I exercise.

After using this model for a couple of weeks, I have come to the following conclusions:

1. For listening to music and podcasts, the sound is loud and clear.
2. The sound is a bit “tinny”, maybe too much treble.
3. For voice calls, the microphone appears not to work well, as the person on the other end can barely hear me.
4. The ear fasteners do secure these headphones and keep them from falling out of my ears when I am exercising.
5. Carrying these headphones on a daily basis is a little inconvenient. My other Otium headset has magnets, so it is easy to wear it around my neck all day without fear of it falling to the ground.

author: Karlk
title: Packs a punch!
content:
On first use... wow, I should have picked up a set of these a long time ago. After my LG set died on me I saw these on a great sale and reviews implied they were a good bet.
Set up was effortless, controls are easy to get used to, but main perk, the sound on these are amazing, at least compared to my now dead LGs.
Very rich, full sound. Volume is much more powerful than the LG. Now I know why they put the warnings on the volume control. These actually could cause damage if turned up too loud.
So far I've only tried the buds that they came with, and they seem fine. Fit securely and pretty sure I won't have to take them off when doing my floor exercises as I had to do with my last pair.
Only ding I have on these is the inability to initiate a hands free phone call. You can trigger a call back to last call, but apparently no interface to the phone's voice control system. Oh well, what do you want for $19?

author: Ronnell C.
title: Love them
content:
The first day I got my earbuds I had lost them, but after days of searching for them I finally found them!!! Now I'd charged the earbugs & they are not pairing to my phone or t.v & both are smart devices. They just keeps blinking & I had charged them for a whole day now.

Update: 01/30/19
 the company contacted me and let me know that they was sorry for the inconvenience that the  headphones was giving me, & sent me a new set and they work perfectly the sound is awesome easy to connect I love them actually. I have not tested them underwater but hopefully they will still work when I do. This is an awesome buy, I might get me another set.

author: Kris
title: Comfortable, Reliable
content: Five months after purchase, these headphones are still holding up.  I use them daily for at least a couple of hours, and I haven't had any issues yet.  My only complaint is that the longest life the battery has had at full charge when listening to music has been 2-2.5 hours.  That's nowhere close to the up to 8 hours the description claims.  But when the battery does die, the headphones do charge relatively quickly.  They're back at 100% in less than 30 minutes.  Since I use these during my workouts, the 2 hour battery life is sufficient.  Just don't plan on listening to music on these all day on without having to charge multiple times during the day.  They are very comfortable to wear, and they do a fair job of cancelling out most noise.  When my neighbor decides to be loud, I pop these headphones in while watching tv or listening to music to help drown her out.  As long as the noise isn't obnoxiously loud, these headphones do the job.  For the price, I definitely recommend these headphones.

author: Terry
title: Wireless up to 33 feet?
content:
When I got the product. I found that I liked how the headphones fit right into my ears and the sound quality was fine. I would give the product an overall rating a 5 stars however, when I play the music and walk just for 3-7 feet away from my phone or PC the audio quality because statistic and I can't multitask while I called my friends and cook. Although the headphones say it can reach up to 30 ft, this product did not reach up to that limit. More like up to 4-5 ft I was only able to listen to music and talk to my friend with this headphones without disturbance and static audio.

This headphones are fit for people who carry their phones or laptops around with them when they are listening to music or talking. However you might have some trouble when you walk away from your phone/pc by a certain distance and angle.

author: Amazon Customer
title: *Edited review
content:
Update: the volume button stopped working after 8 days. I'll be returning these. Maybe others will have better luck with their purchase.

There isn't one thing about these headphones that didn't impress impress me. They are sturdy and comfortable. I wore them 8 hours straight the first day, and the battery lasted without recharging. They sound amazing and get extremely loud. With less than 50% volume from my iPhone, the noise cancelling effect becomes undeniably evident. The signal range is unbelieveable. I got roughly 70 feet with a fully charged battery. I tested these in the shower, and can verify that they are waterproof. I used them to call my brother, and he said he could hear me just fine. The included case is really sharp and great for taking these anywhere. If you're thinking about getting these, do it! I don't see how you could be disappointed. I'm really enjoying them.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Too loud and too much bass
content:
Let me start off by saying that I'm not an audio nerd. I just wanted a pair of headphones that I could use to work out with, so I didn't have high expectations. However, after one use I am returning these headphones (and paying the $6 shipping to do so).

Let's start with the good. They fit comfortably, probably even more so than my last pair. That's about it.

The bass on these are so incredibly high that I couldn't even recognize the song I was trying to listen to. And I was listening to AC/DC. I could barely even hear Angus' guitar solos and Bon Scott screaming his lungs out over the incredibly amplified bass guitar and drums, which is saying something because the lowest volume setting on these is approximately equivalent to Metallica playing a concert on an airstrip while 747s fly 10 feet over your head and construction crews use jackhammers to tear up the runway. I'm pretty sure the music coming from these headphones on the lowest setting was louder than the music playing over the speakers in the gym.

I will be paying the $6 shipping to return these because I value my hearing and don't want to pop an eardrum mid workout. All I wanted was a regular pair of headphones to workout with, not one that made Cliff Williams' bass guitar the focal point of AC/DC.

author: ValB
title: Worked great for two years
content: Worked great for two years, then wire on one side got loose and essentially headphones stopped working. For the price two years of flawless work, great sound with daily heavy use at the gym is well worth four stars. Bought next gen. from the same seller, no regrets. Pros - batteries hold a charge for about 8 hours of play, super fast charging time, sound quality and volume, easy pairing, lightweight. Cons - sometimes replacements rubber thingy comes off, other than that I was totally satisfied.

author: D. Gilder
title: They're ok
content:
Feb 12 2018: They're ok. The sound is good ... If you can get them to stay in your ears. I have to constantly adjust them so they'll stay in. I even tried changing the rubber bud since it came with different sizes. I still can't keep them in. Tried working out with them and that was a nightmare. The sweat made them come out even more so I quit using them all together for anything other than while I'd be sitting very still.

Edit May 31 2018: The company reached out and offered to replace the ones I had. It came quickly and I actually had a marginally better experience with the new pair than the original. The new pair doesn't slip out at the sign of sweat but they still don't fit in my ears properly. I've tried all the earbud sets they came with but they still won't stay in securely. Or ... if they do ... They clog your ear, not just fit, clog. It feels as if you're in an airplane. But when you adjust them, you hear all the noise around you so you can either clog your ear or just rest them inside. Or ... If you happen to get them in just right ... And then do something like talk or smile (which I do a lot), that adjusts the fit. They're alright if you're desperate to get through your workout but it can be annoying. The sound quality is actually good ... If you can get them to stay in.

But just remember ... Everyone's ears are different. They didn't stay in well in mine. But they're super easy to pair and pair quickly and are more reliable than the other brand I purchased. Better battery life too.

author: mirknight
title: A good pair of headphones. Truly waterproof
content:
Edit: Seller proactively reached out to me and sent me a second pair. At this point, the low battery life of the first pair after 8 hours of daily usage for nearly 6 months is irrelevant. Great customer support!

Since i now had two pairs, I decided to submerge the first pair and after a half hour it still works the same.

Old review: Battery level was 8 hours a few months ago but now is down to 6 at best.

What is with the power-off recording? "Powering off. Your headset is disconnected" I realize it's picky but it really bugs me... Just say "Powering off" and leave out telling me it's disconnected. Of course it's disconnected; it's powered off.

author: Just Call Ben
title: Big, bulky and don't stay in.
content:
I purchased 4 very different sets of wireless earbuds for testing and comparison. Here's my review of this device:

They were the largest of the group.  The sets are large and stick far out of the ear which, by the way, makes reaching the controls easy but does not suit my needs. They were also not very secure.  Being large I would think a much larger retention mechanism would help but then that would make it larger still and down the rabbit hole we go.  The sound quality was good with decent bass response but nothing to write home about.

They were marginally difficult to pair taking two touches of the scan button on my phone. They powered on quickly and the button are easy to reach and learn (only three buttons).  All the buttons responded well for what they are.  I would prefer a separate track control button(s) and volume controls but it seems that the standard is to group functions on single buttons.  You have to hold the volume + button for three seconds to advance to the next track.  Play/pause is grouped on the power button which requires a three second press to toggle power.

At $20 they were reasonably priced if not for the fact that I didn't care for them.

Bottom line: worst of the bunch but not the worst on the planet.

author: James Simon
title: With some minor tweaking, well worth the price
content: I've been using these as a replacement for the Q7 headphones and so far, so good. I've had to play with various silicon ear buds to find the right balance of bass, treble, and noise isolation. I could find the right ones that come with it but fortunately I always keep the earbuds from other earphones when they die out. The key is the better the fit, the more bass you'll get, but with the openings not too small that it kills the treble. Once the right fit is made, the overall sound quality is quite good. Some other reviews complain that the + / - controllers should be reversed but I haven't found that to be a problem when you get used to it. It paired without any problems to my iPhone 7 and connectivity every time I've turned it on has been fast and I've rarely found any break up in signal living in NYC. They fit over my ear fine and I've been able to wear them for long periods of time without any discomfort. Haven't really had a chance to see how the battery life is, though the one minor quip I have is that it can be a bit slow on recharging. For the price, you probably won't find a better bluetooth earbud based headset than this.

author: aruba1018
title: nice but...
content: They're nice headphones at what I think is a very reasonable price, the main issue I have is the range was problematic.  As long as my phone was on me of within 10 feet they were great and sounded good but if I was at the gym and stepped away from my phone to swap out weights the audio would start going out pretty quickly.  The other issue is the cord that connects them is pretty stiff so managing it took getting used to.  I've found the best way is to leave the cord in front of my neck vs behind and it seems to be more comfortable and doesn't get in the way as much.  None of these are deal breakers and I still use them but there's room for product improvement.  One positive is the battery seems to be good with longer life than I expected.

author: vcooke
title: Pleasantly surprised!! Get them!
content: I have a Peloton bike, they recommend the urban beats (wired) hated them, I went through 4 wireless headphone sets and spent a lot of money, and they either fell out, were crappy sound, or just died after the warranty, someone  in the Peloton community on FB suggested these Otium headphones, and I thought for $20 bucks, this is a waste of time and money, they have to be junk, but I did try them and I LOVE them! they are sweat resistant, sound awesome, the battery is longer lasting then they claim, they stay in your ears. I could not be happier with these these head phones! I'm telling you, stop wasting your money on the high dollar junk, these are the real deal.

author: Heather Williams Harrell
title: Best Wireless Bluetooth Earbuds yet!!!
content: Otium Bluetooth Wireless headphones are going to be my lifesaver. I was so tired of dealing with cord on my earphones and all the tangled messes I found myself in while in motion. The fact that they are waterproof, noise cancelling, and can hold a charge for continuous playing or use for 8 hours is amazing. This company didn’t miss a thing either, they sent multiple sizes of ear tips to compliment which size you need and it it has a great neckband design. I didn’t even realize when I ordered them they had a warranty and came with a case so to say I am more than pleased does not seem to even do them justice. Fantastic!!!

author: Moorek
title: Great headphones, beware of the carabiner...
content: So while I had these headphones they were my absolute favorite. Sound quality is excellent and they are perfect for workouts and everyday wear. There’s one fault with the overall system and not really the headphones: the caribiner. They come with the product and are meant to be attached to things. I used it to attach the headphones to my backpack. A few times, I had noticed that the clip to lock the caribiner in place seemed to be a bit flimsy and I would have to flick it back into place. I made a mental note to either replace it or move it to a different place in my backpack. Well sadly, I never got the chance. Looked down one day and realized they were gone and had probably fallen off at some point. Now I don’t live in a major city so pick-pocketing is kind of low on my list of what could have happened to them. I really only use my backpack for going to and from class. I’m extremely disappointed that they’re gone so soon. I recommended them to everyone and barely even had them a month. I’m not trying to dissuade someone from buying this product, but this is something to keep in mind if you plan on using them the way I did.

author: J. C.
title: No complaints
content:
If you're a commuter and you're looking to block out ambient noises, there are some sounds you're just not going to block out with earbuds, period. At least this has been my experience no matter which earbuds I've tried. Sounds such as the subway train as it arrives, and super loud commuters. That said these earbuds do a decent job of blocking out most noises. For the super loud commuters, it won't drown out their voices completely but for the most part you won't be able to make out what the other people are saying, you'll just hear their voices. Think Charlie Brown's teacher.

I don't have much of an opinion on the bass because I don't pay much attention to it.

I can say that pairing was a breeze and the connections stays strong even if your phone or device is in another room and you've walked away. Also, the volume on the earbuds are separate from your phone. So if your phone's volume is at max and you can still hear that business person act like a complete and utter... jerk... you can turn up the volume on the earbuds and drown him out with some decent music.

The case they come with is great. You may want to eventually replace the carabiner that comes with it though. I haven't had any issues with it but it just seems fragile.

They definitely stay on my ears and fit around my industrial and daith piercings comfortably.

As for controls, like most earbuds, it comes with a multifunction button and volume buttons. Although it's by far the easiest pair to figure out. The manual helps but when you forget what does what it's super easy to figure out what makes your music skip or repeat.

So far the mic has been great. No one has complained, and in fact they couldn't tell whether I was in my office or walking around outside.

Overall it's a great purchase and j recommend them.

author: B L
title: Not as advertised - Dead in less than 3 months
content:
UPDATE 7-18-19: They have died. Will not charge. Bought 5-2-19
The good:
They sound OK, but I would never consider these noise cancelling.
The bad:
They are advertised as to stay in your ear. What they do is stay attached to your ear lobe with the hook, but move a lot.
The ugly:
It does have a great range, except when on for over 15 minutes. The sound  consistently  starts dropping after about 15 minutes of use. I thought it may be my phone, but used my old 4 year old pair for over an hour and never had the issue in the same environment.

Luckily I still have my old pair which is actually noise cancelling and does not drop sound.

author: Brandon Edwards
title: Excellent battery life, and great for working out.
content:
Overall, these headphones function perfectly and have to be the most comfortable in-ear headphones I’ve owned. I have worn them practically everyday for the past three weeks, mostly for several consistent hours during the day listening to the news and various audiobooks. I keep one headphone in one ear, and tuck the other away on the front of my shirt collar. Ive never had any issues with the battery draining down at all, so I’d say the hour rating is pretty accurate. Ive worn them during workouts also while having no issues with them falling out or any moisture issues. They also stay surprisingly clean compared to my white earbuds that I used prior to buying these. The sound quality is comparable to many headphones that I’ve owned for more than double the cost of these. The bass can be a bit much on some songs but I just prefer my music a bit more treble based. I solved this by changing the settings on my phones equalizer. They do have phone and Siri function too so if you’re looking for a set that you can make and receive calls on, these will do the job. I used them for several hour long phone calls while driving which kept me from having to hold my phone.

As for any issues I had, they were very, very minor. They turn on by holding the main button on the right down until you hear the chime, though thats not the same button you use to change or rewind songs. The main button serves the purpose of turning the on and off, pausing audio, and calling the last person in your recent call log, the latter being the most confusing to me since I’ve never had need for that function nor known a headset to have that function. I made a few accidental calls getting used to this. I have an iPhone, so in my case the Siri function, along with the song change and replay function was accessed through the volume buttons on the top of the right headphone. The button function between the two seems a bit odd to me, but overall this has nothing to do with the functioning of the headset itself. Other than that, you have to hang the other headphone on your shirt if you only want to have one in your ear because the second headphone will weigh the wire down making it pull on the headphone that is currently in.
Pros:
 -THE MOST comfortable in ear headphones I’ve owned
 -good bluetooth range and quick connection
 -great sound and bass
 -lightweight

author: HTM
title: Good customer serivce... but the earphone just fails to deliver
content:
I have had tried this earphone twice over 6 months.  I tried several wireless earphones...  5 different pairs.  Like everything else, it has its pros and cons... and I thought I'd share my own experience with the product here

Pros :
1.  I can run with this earphone on my ear and it would not fall off.  It is secured in its place and it would not move.  I had other earphones that kept falling off my ear while walking...  so compared to that, this earphone, especially with its over the ear hook design is a big plus.  I am not sure if I will ever buy an wireless earphone without the over the ear hook design.

2.  It does cancel out noise to a moderate extent.

3.  The customer service was great.  When I contacted them with the issue that I started experiencing, they were very responsive and sent me another pair as a replacement.  but the great things about this earphone pretty much end there.

Because of their great service, I really tried to like this earphone... and didn't want to write a bad review...  but ...  I decided that I would give it 2 stars due to the following reasons that I'm about to describe below.

Cons
1.  The biggest flaw of this earphone is that it keeps going blank every few seconds if the mp3 player moves around or if I put the player in my pocket.  It keeps losing the sound or the signal.  If I'm running on a treadmill where the mp3 player is sitting near by and I'm running... it plays fine.  However, if I run on the road where my mp3 player is moving back and forth in my grip or attached to my arm, the sound is keep getting cut off.  If I walk around while holding the mp3 player relatively steady at my elbow level... it would be somewhat ok...  but as soon as i put my hand down or place the mp3 player in my pocket or a bag behind me, it would lose sound again every few seconds.  It's just not listenable.  I tried other wireless (more expensive) headphone on the same mp3 player and tried the same thing and I had no sound issue.  I tried the earphone on other bluetooth devices and I am experiencing the same problem again.  I have tried few other devices switching back and forth to prove that it is the earphone issue, not my mp3 player issue.

The first earphone was fine for a month or two...  and I then started experiencing this issue.  After few weeks narrowing down the source of problem and debating what to do with it, I contacted the customer support.  They were very responsive and sent me another newer version of the earphone.  The second set was fine straight out of the box for a month... and then the same issue is happening again.

2.  The sound quality...  The ad promises "superb bass sound"...  but to me... it is basically a muffle sound with not much treble...  the sound quality is just a bit better than a free earphone that get from an airplane.  I have older wireless Avantree earphone that I purchased at a similar price.  That sound quality is so much better than this earphone.  Another earphone that I tried, SoundPEATS Bluetooth Headphones, also has a better sound.

If I run on a treadmill and watch a movie with other earphones, I can hear the conversation quite well.  With this earphone, I have to guess what they are saying...  because it's so muffled out that it's hard to clearly hear the conversation.... even with the loud volume.  The sound is loud enough...  but it's just that it's not a clear sound.

I give 2 stars for their excellent service....  but I'm sorry to say that the earphone has failed me and I will be searching for another earphone.

author: No thank you
title: Great cost-effective alternative to PowerBeats Wireless
content:
Clearly these headphones are a direct competitor with Powerbeats2 Wireless In-Ear Headphone - Black (Old Model), the brand-name Bluetooth wireless headphones from Beats by Dre. They look nearly identical, have comparable functionality, but are a fraction of the cost, as new PowerBeats carry a tag of ~$150 (even re-furbished ones go for ~$100).

I was a very satisfied owner of the PowerBeats Wireless for >1 year before purchasing these Otium headphones. As such, my review of the Otium headphones is structured relative to the PowerBeats.

Pros:
—GREAT LOOK AND FEEL. These are good looking headphones and comfortable to wear. The ear pieces are much softer and more flexible than PowerBeats, which at times irritated my ear with prolonged use. The packaging is aesthetic and includes a nifty carrying case.
—EASY SETUP/CONNECT. The setup is quick and easy with your smartphone and has more than enough range to be used from your pocket, on the treadmill, etc.
—GOOD SOUND QUALITY. Obviously there is limited bass with in-ear buds, but the sound quality is good and indistinguishable from PowerBeats in my opinion.
—COST. This is CLEARLY the biggest pro, as these earphones are nearly identical to PowerBeats, but sell at >80% discount.

Cons:
—POWER ISSUES. I have only had the Otium headphones for ~1 week, but I have persistent issues powering them on/off. There is a power button on the right earpiece, but it takes me several minutes of pressing/tapping/holding down the power button to actually turn them on. This is not a problem I ever had with PowerBeats and is THE ONLY REASON I AM NOT GIVING 5 STARS. I am not sure if other people are having this issue, but I would like to think I am sufficiently tech-savvy that I am not just being ignorant trying to use them.

OVERALL: While these aren't high-end headphones, in my opinion they are a fantastic alternative athletic headphone to the pricey PowerBeats Wireless, with near-identical look, better comfort, and indistinguishable sound quality / range / battery life.

If Otium corrects my issues with the power button, I will absolutely revise my review with 5 stars. There is just no beating headphones of this quality and functionality at such a low price.
