I see why these are popluar on Amazon.  The earphones are light weight, easy to use, and stay put while working out, or just working.
The sound quality is very good, they have a good amount of Bass, with out being overwhelming, the mids and highs are also good, although not as pronounced on some tracks, mostly a function of your phones music player I'd say, as I can adjust the sound to be comparable to my over ear headphones costing WAY more than these earphones. Between my tablet and phone the pairing took a couple tries, maybe my fault, but paired up okay.  And so far the battery life has been very good.  I haven't tried them until they are dead yet, but up to 4 hours they were good to go.  They came with three size in ear plugs to fit most people, and as I said stay put even without the over ear hook well.  I recommend these, for the low price on Amazon, you can't go wrong.

author: James Ringold
title: 4 MONTH REVIEW
content: As far as I am concerned these are an absolutely excellent pair of exercise earbuds. Not perfect, but excellent. The have very good sound quality (even after 4 months of VERY high volume use), background noise reduction and stay firmly in you ears even when working out and sweating. The earbuds have a pause button and volume control but no skip song options. The also have survived being put into jean pockets followed by physical activity and are just as structurally strong as the day they arrived. However, when the battery gets low, the earbuds pause whatever you are listening to and say "Low Battery". This would not be a problem except, there is perhaps a one thousandth of a second pause between what you are listen to and the low battery notification, which is said AT FULL VOLUME. There is NO WAY TO TURN IT DOWN either. The notification will be played at full volume regardless of what your phone volume is at or what volume the earbuds themselves are set at. So what will happen is your are laying in bed at night listening to some music on a nice low volume and without warning or pause your music will stop and the earbuds will scream "LOW BATTERY!" in your ears at full volume and scare you half to death. But if you keep them regularly charged this is not a problem. That flaw in the design of the earbuds is the ONLY thing keeping me from giving these earbuds a 5 star review. Overall I am very happy with these earbuds and how they have held up over time. excellent product.

author: Laurie M Rabinowitz
title: Otium stands behind an excellent product. Buy without hesitation.
content:
**EDIT** Otium contacted me, sent a replacement.. This is above and beyond what you expect a company making headphones at this price point to do. I can whole-heartedly recommend this product. The sound is rich, the battery life is above average, they are comfortable, the build quality seems to be very good. These are the best under $25 (I have gone through at least 6 models-about 10 pairs-at this price point), bar none.
Also the case is sweet. 11/10 would buy Otium again.**END EDIT**

One ear's speaker failed after showering with them in a few times, so I replaced with a different model.
If you get a year out of headphones like these, I would consider it a win. Overall these headphones performed above average amongst the ~5-10 cheap bt sets I've bought in recent years.

author: Bryan
title: Best Headphones ever!!!
content: So I have ordered at least 6 pairs of wireless headphones over the past 2 years from Amazon and this one by far is the best I've ever had. First is that they actually stay on my ears and don't fall out even if I'm outside being active. The bluetooh pairing connection strength is amazing. That may sound silly but I have several pairs of headphones that can't stay paired to my phone even if it's in my pants pocket or if I start to walk a few feet they disconnect. Once on these headphones give great sound and does an excellent job of blocking out background noise. They are reasonably priced and the fact that they come with their own semi-hard case and ear attachments puts these headphones above the rest.

author: Carol Williams
title: DOES NOT LAST
content: So i bought these to jog in and it lasted me a little over a year. It's not ideal for running because the ear kept slipping out and the wire piece at the back was annoying. Now all of a sudden a little over a year and it just keeps shutting off on me when it finally connects, and then i try to turn it back on and it won't and if it does it shuts off randomly again. I been trying for a few days and still same problem. I thought it was the charge but blue light still comes on and i fully charge it and it still shuts off randomly when i'm using or or running, so it was cheap 20 dollars I guess you get what you pay for 20 dollars bluetooth and lasted a year. I'm trying to invest in a better more expensive one- I LOVED my PLATRONICS one for jogging.. bought it for like $80 and it was stolen from me,  but it's going to take too long to ship to me from amazon this time. Any suggestions ?

author: christopher j hamilton
title: Good Sound, Flimsy Product
content:
Well, these earphones were comfy, easy to set up, had pretty good quality sound and worked well.
Until they didn't.
The right earphone just quit working while I was listening to a podcast.  No scrunching them up, no crimping the cord.
They just up and 'half quit'.
Probably an unfortunate occurrence and maybe not typical of the product, but I'll certainly be buying a sturdier set next time.
UPDATE:
Otium contacted me via email.  They offered to send me a new replacement set of earphones with no questions asked.
I've raised my rating of the product from two to four stars as a result.
That is some solid customer service.

author: Jamye H.
title: ... is my 2nd set of these headphones and I love them. I am hard of hearing and have ...
content:
This is my 2nd set of these headphones and I love them.  I am hard of hearing and have tried TV EARS ~ sent back even though the sound was amazing! The heaviness on my lower ear created so much discomfort...even using their "loops" to go over my ears didn't work nearly enough.
Next I tried the SIMOLIO ~ which was similar, but I had the same problem.  The SIMOLIO was incredible and yet painful, so back to Amazon they went...and then I found these little, light weight gems!!!  Easy to pair to Bluetooth, quick charge, SO COMFORTABLE I almost feel asleep with them on!  Not to mention the price!!!  For the $80.00ish dollars I sent on each of the other products, $20.00 was the ticket.  The only difference the $$$ reflects in the stethoscope models is the range ~ amazing long range hearing.  With the OTIUM, it's about 30ish feet and I'm OK with that.  YAY
OTIUM!!!

author: Desiree Claudio
title: Callers sound robotic and intermittent loss of audio
content: When I’m on a call, the person on the other line sounds like they’re a robot. When I switch to iPhone it’s fixed. So I know it’s the headphones. That’s the only issue I have with them. I also have the issue where sometimes I get no audio as well. I think this is a major issue because I use the headphones to talk on the phone and listen to videos and if I’m not able to do hat well then the product isn’t worth a high rating.  I would give them a 1 star for that but there is one thing I actually love about them, the fact that my phone actually rings outside of the headset when I get a call. That is extremely useful because if I take off my headset and forgot to unpair my phone, I won’t miss a call. My last pair didn’t do that. But the last paid didn’t have the robot issue and no audio problem, too bad I lost those. I was going to buy them again but these had the exact same specs for about $8 cheaper and had good reviews so I gave it a shot. I think I’d like to return them now though, unfortunately because I don’t like to have to do returns. By the way no physical damage or water damage. I just got them yesterday and used them for the first time today.

author: Crit +5
title: A Critical Review
content:
Very difficult pairing process, especially when switching between devices. It may fail several times.

When it does finally connect, the connection is strong. I can walk from the first floor to the basement and it maintains connection without any static or interruption, unlike some competing products.

The sound space is very isolated, or closed, with these headphones. The earpiece gels seal your ear cavity to deliver sound. This can be good when you're in a noisy location, but dangerous if you are crossing the street as you may hear less of your surroundings.

The ear hooks are large. Far too large for my ears. They are hanging in the air above my ears, and the full weight of the devices is weighing in my ear canal on the earpiece gels. This device would be better if they gave a few ear hooks of different sizes that you could change -- or if it was made bendable so you could form it to your ear size and shape.

Audio quality, is poor. While the sub-bass may boom more than other headphones, low frequencies and bass audio is completely crushed. The same is true with treble and higher frequencies, they are crushed as well. Low beats and high notes are very low. The vibrancy of any music will be lost when using these. If you judge that audio quality is better with strong bass beats and hits only, then this may be ok for you.

Charging is difficult. There is a small rubber tab under the right device. This seems flimsy and will probably detach later. A better design would have been a plastic piece that pulls in and out to release strain. The charging usb cable they give is extremely short. It is a USB-micro-b connector. If you have a longer cable, you might be able to use that. The product manual states, you must only use a 5v 1a charger. An iPhone mini charger will work for this, but an iPad square charger may be too much. Using a stronger charger would only be ok if there was a limiter in the circuit design, but it is unknown if that is the case.

The cord is sort of uncomfortable to put around the back of your neck. The cord is not very flexible. I feel it brushing on the bottom of my shoulders and my neck. I prefer to let it hang in front of my chin actually. It looks ridiculous, but is more comfortable in my opinion.

author: Sandra Whitley
title: Good sound and they'll fit...if you have big ears
content: These are good earphones...if you have massive ears. I have to admit, I have small ears and I was hoping these would work for me since I have a hard time getting some headphones to stay comfortably. I got these to use as an extra pair when I'm charging my Beats studio 3's but unfortunately they wont work at all. They feel heavy in my ear, the part that's supposed to wrap around your ear for support doesn't even hand onto my ear. I had to jam the one side in and it felt so uncomfortable just to get it to stay on. There is a hard bulky plastic piece right behind the rubber insert that goes in your ear and it makes it nearly impossible to stay in because it won't allow the rubber piece to go in any further than where the plastic begins. I'm sadly disappointed and will be returning. If you have small ears or have a hard time fitting earphones in, I don't recommend even thought they sound great.

author: Chris Collins
title: Great fit, many ear options
content: I needed another pair of headphones for mowing the grass. I used to have some tones, but after 5 years, they gave out. I bought these because of the price. Today I finally took them out while I trimmed the yard. They did great. At first, they felt uncomfortable and didn't fit right. Might be because I didn't notice the extra ear pieces. Yeah, total of 4 different ear pieces at different sizes. After finding the right fit, I went back to work in the heat. Sound was perfect and the fit was great. Although I was used to my LG tones for the longest time, these didn't take any time to get used to. They have held a great charge and I look forward to a long day in the yard with them.

author: Ryan Park
title: Good product, but the battery can be weird at times
content:
I've used this product maybe 5 times or so since purchase. Made sure to put it back in it's cool little case once done. The sound quality is great for the price and convenience, but there are some oddities or drawbacks to it. For one, the connection takes a while to establish. I've tried this product with 2 phones just to be sure, and it takes a solid 30-60 seconds to establish a connection to the headphones. There's also an issue with the battery. When I first received it, I discharged the battery completely like you're supposed to do with any battery powered item, and then fully recharged it. Took it to work with me the next day and everything was perfect, battery life was at 70% by the time I stopped using it. Thought that was pretty stellar since it was a total of 6 hours of usage. I went to use it the next day and the battery read 50%... thought that was odd, but ok, no biggie. I'd at least have several hours of listening time before it hit 0%. Wrong. Once the 30% mark rolled around, it keeps saying "BATTERY LOW" every minute, even when listening to something. As annoying as it was, I kept listening to my music, but after about 5 mins of "BATTERY LOW" the device shuts off. I turn it back on, and immediately get another alert, and it shuts off again. I look at the battery life expecting it to read 0% but it still reads 30%. I grabbed my other phone thinking it was getting a false positive percentage and that one also says 30%. After getting it home and recharging it that night, I tested the whole scenario out again, listened to music all day for a total of 7.5hrs. Same situation. 30% rolls around "BATTERY LOW!" and then shuts off.

Like I said, not a bad device by any means for the price, but you get what you pay for in every instance, so just make sure you keep in mind that a 30% battery life readout means next to nil.

EDIT: Since posting this, Otium has reached out to me and offered to replace my headphones. At this point, regardless of functionality, any company that is willing to do that after 2+ years with no warranty extension is good in my books. Hopefully the issue hasn't persisted past my original set.

author: Andy S.
title: Highly recommended
content:
I have had these headphones for about a week now and love them. They function great, and sound awesome.
Pros:
They sound great
They fit well, and come with different size ear pieces you can change out
They are rechargeable and the battery lasts a long time
They come with a semi-hard case that also stores a charging cable
They are comfortable
They are sweat proof
They stay put while jogging or riding my bike

Cons:
None, I would strongly recommend!

author: Andrew Harding
title: they're just sad they don't have those headphones
content:
flimsy earpiece is awful, they don't stick well in your ears since they don't have the support from that limp noodle thing attached. The sound is definitely subpar. Anything you read saying the sound is comparable to bose or beats don't believe it, they're just sad they don't have those headphones. I've only had them for a couple weeks now so lets see how long they last. My beats lasted 6 months, then another 6 months and i got a 3rd pair under warranty that lasted me 9 months. So if they beat the 7 month average life span of my beats experience then they will have one good thing about them.

IMO, spend the money, get a nice pair of headphones unless you just need something to hold you over for a few months like me.

author: Daniel Porter
title: After months of using these I can see why They have such a rating
content:
I got this pair of Bluetooth earbuds because of the amazon sale for about 11 or 10 dollars. I also saw a youtube video about them. I didn't expect much for the price but after using them on my nights at the gym for almost 4 months I now understand why this has so many reviews. They work. They audio is solid and the noise cancellation while not perfect still does a decent job.

Its not perfect with audio but it does a good enough job droning out others in the gym or having to hear weights drop.

So I would say if you need gym or workout earbuds give them a try.

author: Mauricio J. Garcia
title: Great expectations leads to greater disappointments.
content: These are it!  I said to myself......based on all of the good reviews I've read and some videos on youtube giving these headphones 5 stars. Well, it was not my case, I got to use them once and the second time they died on me. Went to Amazon for a full refund.  I do not know if I had a bad factory product but that was my experience.  Will keep looking ..........

author: Eugene Thompson
title: It's a nice solid unit especially for the money.
content: These seem to be a solid set of bluetooth earphones. Seems well made and consistent all with good frequency response (the bass is actually shockingly good comparable to much larger headphones).They seal really well and stay in my ear which is usually a problem for me and in-ear phones.  Bluetooth range is typical.  The bluetooth is a bit loyal to the last device used but will recognize multiple devices.  Comes with a nice case and extra ear pads and USB cable.  The software seems very robust in how it handles switching to and from other devices and he voice prompts are nice. Seem to be a really good product (not cheap) highly recommended.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Decent product that lasts no longer than a few months.
content: Good quality headphones besides when you're in call and the mic isn't the best. I've purchased this product twice and they both died around 3-4 months. I bought a 2 year warranty with squaretrade but after I contacted them they told me to contact the manufacturer instead. Now I'm told that I have to pay a shipping fee for a replacement which I didn't see on the warranty info.  I purchased TWICE for a product I believed I could invest in. I just wanted a replacement as soon as possible but a week has passed and I'm left with resentment. I knew for a fact my product was broken but I had to wait around 4 days to message both companies just to end up getting an email for troubleshooting directions. I'm done wasting my time. I won't be wasting yours anymore either.

author: Hibiscus
title: 5 stars for sound quality and customer support
content: These headphones are absolutely amazing in sound quality! I have bought several different headphones to try to find the best sound quality and these were perfect! The only thing is that my ears are a bit small so wearing them can become uncomfortable over prolonged use but they are pretty good for the price. The battery life is pretty good usually giving you about 7 hours until it notifies you that it needs charging. Another thing is, is that after two months they stopped charging and I was seriously disappointed because the sound quality is amazing and I didnt want to have to buy another and spend more money. I reached out to the company and asked for a replacement and they were very kind and helpful when responding to me saying that they will immediately send a new replacement free of charge. They delivered on that promise and I got a free replacement! Another thing to note is that I wouldn't charge these for more than 2 hours because the lithium battery can become overcharged and stop working as a result. I've seen many other similar headphones state this in there instructions manual not to do this. Also, something I did not catch when I was using this product was to not use a fast charger for it may cause unstable voltage and damage the battery. This is most likely the reason why my headphones stopped working but the company was nice enough to provide me a new one. So, 5 stars for customer service and support and 5 stars for the sound quality.

author: adam hunter
title: Not to shabby
content:
This is my second pair. My first pair burned up when I got splashed with Acetone at my job. I like them so much I got a second pair. This pair is as good, with 1 exception. This pair has developed a glitch where it hesitates for a while when I go to pause what ever I am listening to. So I end up hitting the button a second time and calling the last number I called.
After writing my review, the company got in touch with me. There were glad to here I liked the headphones, and disappointed in there performance.
They are sending my observations to R&D and are sending a new set.
I am very pleased to be getting a new set. I hope they last the course.

author: grg
title: Worked fine... until they didn't.
content: I had mine for almost 9 months and they worked fine. Sound quality as just ok, but not the greatest bass. Overall, I liked them.. then one day, they stopped working. When you turn these on and off, it plays an audio queue. "Power On - Your headset is connected". When the battery is low, you get like three audio queues over a period of about 5 minutes saying "Battery Low", then a final "Power Off - Your headset is disconnected" before it shuts off. Now, I can fully charge my headphones and turn them on, get the power/connected queue, then 15-30 seconds later, all sound stops and they are off. You can immediately restart them, get the audio queue, but no queue for when it shuts off at all - just dead. Tried charging them several times and with the original and other cords, it displays the correct LED for charging and charging complete - but still dies. Glad I got the SquareTrade extended warranty....

author: Amazon Customer
title: Better than Beats Buds
content: I was apprehensive to buy these because I had never heard of the brand, but decided to pick up a pair. I had previously been using a pair of Beats Powerbeats2 and got tired of the bud heads breaking off and having to superglue them back on. I'm ridiculously impressed with this pair of Otium headphones. I'm a big fan of big bass, and these blow Beats bass out of the water and into outer space. Very rich, clear sound. I also used these on a long flight for about 3hr and the battery was still at 90%. I'm only taking one star away because the over-ear things aren't adjustable, which really sucks for people like me with tiny ears. I'd 100% give 5 stars if it weren't for that one tiny detail. Over all, 9/10, would recommend. Plus... they're CHEAP!

author: Captain Falcon
title: If you're looking for a sub-$25 bluetooth headset, this is where to look!
content:
When I bought these headphones, I was expecting some weird off brand bluetooth headphones, but I was left pretty surprised after using it as my daily driver. For under 25 dollars, I would say this is one of the best headphones for your money.

GOOD:-
-Sturdy build quality,  feels pretty firm
-Adjustable eartips (THIS IS A BIG ONE!! As it's hard for me to find headphones that fits in my ears...)
-Wire is long enough to go around neck
-Sound quality is surprisingly very good! (maybe a bit less bass tho?)

BAD:-
-The battery life isn't as long as stated in the description, it says its around 8 hours when it lasts more for like 4.5-5 hours.
-The headphones dont stick, theyre pretty prone to falling out, especially if you run, they come out pretty easy.
-Earbuds are prone to getting extremely dirty, but this could be negated by doing a regular cleaning, however it affects sound quality if it goes under grill.

Overall, if you're looking for a pair of bluetooth headphones that you don't want to spend a lot on, these headphones are absolutely worth the money.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Fantastic Audio Quality
content:
I brought these by accident. I was looking at some beats by dre earbuds and somehow landed on these. The symbols on the buds look like beats.

When arrived i was pissed. I was thinking i just got taken advantage of. I looked at my order and yup this what i purchased.

Now i had very low expectations for these headphones (wrong move lol) these earbuds are FANTASTIC, the quality of the sound is probably the best in earbuds i have ever hear. Definitely worth triple the price of what they sell for. Also they fit nice and snugg and comfy in your ear.

Best mistake i ever made. I would strongly recommend these earbuds

author: L. Saunders
title: Reliable, Good Sound Quality, and Comfortable
content: I ordered my first pair 9 months ago.  I use them daily.  I have a farm and rely on these to allow me to talk to my family (sometimes for hours on end) and listen to music while I'm performing all sorts of chores and repairs.  I'm always kicking myself when I neglect to put them on charge when they run low.  All I need is a backup pair when I run out of charge.  Wasted ten bucks for a cheapo wired set at the big box stores which echoed my voice on all my calls.  I was ready to spend a lot more for a "good" set.  I did a lot of research today.  Bottom line, I'm coming back to Otium.  They are super comfortable, reliable so far, sound quality is more than good for me, stay in my ears no matter what, decent battery life, paired easily with Moto Z Play and Samsung Note 9, and warn you they are running low (my bad that I'm lazy to plug them in).  I hope the new pair is as good as the first.  Happy connections!

author: Paul
title: The Best Headphones I've Owned
content: I listen to a lot of music almost all the time. Throughout my teen years, I used wired headsets but I'd always wear them out after 4-6 months. So, about two years ago, I decided to switch to Bluetooth, and I chose these. They are still working just as well as when I first received them, and I am a very happy customer. They're comfortable, portable, don't tangle into an infinite knot, and they look good. There are only two things I'm not a huge fan of. First is the bass quality. It's good - great, actually - but not so excellent that it massages the inside of my skull. Second, and perhaps more important and relevant to normal consumers, the light. When the headphones are turned on and connected, there a very bright, blue, blinking light that is kinda annoying when you're listening in the dark (i.e., public transportation at night). These negatives are so minute though that they aren't worth taking off a star.

author: M. Wells
title: Overall good but needs some improvement
content:
Overall I am pleased with these headphones. The sound quality is good, I wasn’t expecting audiophile grade for this price but when driving or working out it’s just right. I don’t find myself needing to turn the volume up much more than half way to hear my music/movies/podcasts.
  The noise canceling ability is very good and someone talking to me from just a couple of feet away will be tuned out.
  As for comfort, anything that’s getting stuck in my ear will be noticeable after a while, however, unless I’m laughing a lot I can handle these for over 1.5 hours. I am not sure if they were designed to be worn in such a manner, but when I put these on I will rotate them backwards to feel more secure. This puts the ear hooks in a more conformed position with the back of my ear. These come with different sized ear pieces which is always nice and I figured they would. The hooks that go over your ear are flexible but they can’t be contoured into a different position that will stay that way.
  These have not fall out/off my ears, but they don’t feel 100% secure. I’ve tested with shaking my head around in an unnatural way  and they stay on. There’s just something about these that isn’t a perfect fit. However, as I stated they don’t fall off.
  As have been said in other reviews when the battery is getting low, roughly 30 minutes left, there is an automated voice saying “battery is low.” Yes it is annoying and they probably could have done it better but it’s not a complete deal breaker. On a full charge I get roughly 7.5 hours of play time.
  These are not fully hands free. There is a function to redial the last number called. Voice dialing or accessing Siri with these is not an option. I’ve even tried to use my Apple Watch to acess siri to make a call but if the headphones are on, it won’t work. It will answer a call if you push the power button and hang up if pushed again. I still swipe my phone to answer a call and it prompts my iPhone to switch to the built in speakers of the phone, however with an iPhone it’s a simple matter to switch back to the headphones. During one call I had one ear piece out and the person on the other line started to hear the ambient noise around me and was having trouble hearing me.  Syncing to my phone was not a problem.
  I would probably try a different headphone style after these die just to find a better fit, but would keep these in the back of my mind since I’ve been fairly content with these, despite the limited hands free abilities.

author: Slacker
title: The best feature on these to me is the battery life
content:
The best feature on these to me is the battery life.  Based on my limited use I charge them once a week. They did seem to last longer the first charge, but I may have just been using them less.

The don't fall off my ears which is nice. The power button functions as pause/play when you tap it.  Holding it turns the power off.  The volume buttons were backwards of what I expected, but I got used to that really fast.  Everything seems reasonably sturdy and the case they came with was handy.  I'm not audiophile enough to speak to the sound quality, but it it seems at least as good as the other earphones I have.

When I only want to have one headphone in the ear hook on the unused earphone makes it handy to hang of a shirt pocket or collar.

author: MrGCandia
title: Not happy with this purchase.
content: I bought these in preparation for summer workouts, upon arrival the packaging is fine. It came fully charged and worked with no problem right from the start, sound quality is surprisingly good. 2 days later and it was the first time I was just trying them out walking round the house and the sound started cutting out, a simple re-syncing and it start working fine again. For the past month it was alright I wasn't using the headphones on a daily basis only on the weekends for roughly 1-2 hours, but for the past couple times I have used them the same cutting audio issue started up again and this time only when I was running. This past weekend it was so bad I just stopped using them altogether, no matter how many time I re-synced the headphones after just moving around it the sound would cut off.  Not really happy with this purchase and going forward I may have to rethink ever buying anything for this company, which is sad because these are well designed headphones that stay in the ear when you exercise and when it worked sounded great.

author: January
title: Not the best reception...
content:
I find mine only really work properly when I'm within a few feet range of my device, as well as facing that direction. Even then sometimes it would be spotty with my mac on my lap while wearing them (I know headphones with a cord would reach but I got lazy okay). I wore them while cleaning around my room and whenever it was outside the few feet boundary and I was facing away the audio became spotty at best, until I got closer. I haven't tried running with them yet but I like how they stay in place. For cheap headphones I can't really complain but I wish the audio range was better.

Update:
It's been a while now since I started using these headphones. After I left this last review I was contacted immediately about any possible issues I'd had, and I appreciate the fast response and customer care there. I realized after a while of usage that it's only my Mac that has issues with them (I own a 2012/2013 Macbook Pro) but my iPhone 6 is totally fine. In my own room my Mac will have sound disturbances and pauses frequently, but with my phone I walked across the gym and back without a single interruption. I'll keep using them and keep updating if needed!

2nd update:
They work perfectly with my phone and I use them all the time for the gym and running outside.

author: David A. Ferriera
title: Maybe replacement will work for more than 3 weeks
content:
So I used theae headphones a lot. I paired with almost every device in my apartment. The PS4 did not work but thats because the PS4 can't use BT headphones (which I didn't know) but every single thing worked flawlessly. Sound is great.

Then one day I fired uo spotify and it just sounded like the speakers were blown. I never listened to the speakers at a bolume to bust the speakers. Always under half my iPhone XR volume. No idea why it happened. I asked for a return through Amazon and will change stars if the next one works.

UPDATE: the replacement headphones do exactly the same thing. Very unhappy and would not recommend.

author: Harris
title: 30% = dead
content:
I bought a pair of Powerbeats 2 over a year ago and after normal wear and tear, they began to fall apart so I thought these would be a great replacement instead of spending $100+ again. These are heavy with bass but this problem can be adjusted via EQ settings in your music app of choice. The reason this was given 2-stars was that they die at 30% battery (as seen from the indicator on notification screen). I've charged them numerous times and depleted them and the same thing happens, that it will die at 30% but to test a quick charge of 15-mins, they turn back on with 70%. Maybe I just got a pair with a bad battery, who knows.

Update April 2018: The left side now has a shortage. The battery never lasted close to 7 hours, more like 2 hours.

author: danarama
title: Remarkable Value
content:
These earbuds pair with my iPhone immediately and effortlessly.  They stay in and are, to my surprise, entirely comfortable.  The volume up/down/next song/last song controls are intuitive, easy to find, and work flawlessly.  They come in a nice zippered case.
I was initially very unhappy with the sound quality. The bass was muddy and the vocals fuzzy.  Following the recommendation of another reviewer I moved the earbuds out a little bit so that they had a looser seal.  Et voila!  The sound quality suddenly became quite good.
I intend to experiment with the smaller silicone covers to see if they will achieve the same effect.

author: Gregg
title: What works well, I love! One little problem may send them back. Update May 3rd
content:
These have been everything I have dreamed about for a long time. Extremely comfortable, stay put while working and working out, amazing sound quality, good battery life, great telephone quality for both ends and easy to use control buttons. What's wrong? I've been getting intermittent "skipping" in my music, I've tapped, bounced and jumped but nothing seems to cause the problem. If this was the good old days I would smile and move on for just $20 and I'm tempted to now. But what if it gets worse? Yikes! I'll update and keep an eye on my return date. I don't want to give these up.

Update May 3rd - I'm still getting the skipping problem so I called Amazon and spoke to Ryan who helped me double check the unit and then arranged to have new ones to me tomorrow! I have 30 days to return the defective pair via a prepaid UPS label. So nice to deal with Amazon!

May 5th update - Recieved my replacement earphones and I have used them every waking moment since. No problems, only perfection. Every single feature and claim made is 100% accurate. I could not be more happy. The product is amazing in general and most especially for the price and with Amazon's customer service it's a no-brainer.

author: Ricardo W.
title: Was really excited, ended up disappointed (updated) 1/18/2019
content:
I read many reviews and ordered these earbuds with much confidence. Confident especially about the sound quality. Once I received them, charged them and tried them I was extremely disappointed. The sound is Flat to say the least. It's like a monotone.... That is the best description I can write without going into many details. Imagine listening to something where everything sounds flat.

I tested out the songs with other Bluetooth and plug-in earbuds, so I'm positive it's not the songs. Sadly it is the earbuds.  The design and comfort level are good, did want to mention that.

Returning these.
------------------------------------
After this review I was contacted by customer support and was offered a new set of earbuds and apologized for the issue I had with the ones I purchased.  Upon arrival of the new earbuds I decided to test them out and right out of the box the sound was noticeable better, like increasingly noticeable better.  I have used these for 2 weeks not and I can say that for the price you pay the sound and the quality of the product is a good investment.  I heard some issues about the range of the earbuds away from the source (my cell phone) and I can say that before it started flickering or I even notice I had left my phone at the desk, I was more than 90 - 100 feet away from the source.  (More than the distance from home plate to first base for reference).

I would recommend this product if you want good earbuds, and want to still pay a reasonable price and am upgrading my review and rating.  Thanks to the customer service department for reaching out and try to solve the issue and create happy customers.  We dont see a lot of that going around.

author: Benjamin Guidry
title: Good sound and range, solid signal
content:
Excellent sound quality and volume. Longest range of any Bluetooth headset I've had. The range is so long as to be unnecessary really (probably 50ft indoors), but it's a nice feature.
  I remember seeing reviews about the headset falling off or earbuds not staying in, but I've never had that problem. I  listen to a lot of audiobooks and podcasts, so I wear these almost every day while working, excercising, driving, whatever. I've worn them in the shower a few times, but water can get inside of the earbud and you can't hear much until it's dry. All things considered it's a great headset and I'm considering buying another.
  I've had these for 8 months now, and I've really enjoyed them. I came back because my 1yo son got a hold of them and the right earbud is cutting out now. I've never had issues with the signal or audio cutting out before, so he probably pulled a wire loose. I wish they were made a little stronger, but that's kinof unreasonable considering I paid less than $20.

author: TuesdayTraveler
title: Good sound, bad product quality
content: I lose my headphones quite frequently so I only order cheap headphones. I love Bluetooth headphones as well for working out and walking to work. I ordered these to replace a pair of Magicbuds (another cheap brand of Bluetooth beats type headphones) after I left those in an Uber. Let’s just say that my Magicbuds were far superior. I usually could use my Magicbuds for a whole day or two without losing battery. I barely used this pair throughout the day and they died befor my walk home. Additionally, they seem to be buggy in that when I turn them on, they immediately turn back on. Only like the 5th time I try to turn them on do they actually work and connect to my phone. Overall, disappointing. Going back to Magicbuds which are only $4 more and way better quality. However, when these did work, they had awesome sound quality and a great microphone for wireless chats.

author: Duckylick
title: SWITCHED FROM OVER THE EAR BLUTOOTH PHONES - GOOD DECISION!
content: I had a larger on-the-ear bluetooth headphone before and lost them, and always hated these in-the-ear models because the sound always sucked. But these - BETTER than I expected! VERY pleased. Definitely worth the money. All of these types of 'phones say they have "amazing bass" - including these - but let's face it, no small earphone has *amazing* bass. BUT - given the limits of physics, this one does a great job! The sound is good provided you get the bud to seal inside the ear. These are the first of this type where the inserted bud part actually fits my ear (using the largest earbud tip). The BEST part (at least for me)??? The lady that talks to you when you successfully pair your device has a British accent! She says "You're headset is connected" and "You're headset is disconnected" which I love. Funny how it's the small things. Only issue I've had is with charging, as with many electronics, just because the USB cable fits doesn't mean it properly charges your device. Problem solved if you just use the cable it comes with. Oh and as for battery life - seems pretty long. I've never had to worry about recharging them. I went to sleep with them on listening to white noise for several hours then woke up to go to the gym and noted they still had 90% battery left. As for pairing, I don't think that's much of an issue (remember the old days when things would NEVER pair!) but these seem to pair easier and quicker than my previous bluetooth 'phones, which were all Skullcandy. Hope this review helps ya decided!

author: _jazt10
title: Great support and product
content:
I really liked these. Sound quality was great. Sound isolation was great. I talk on the phone for several hours daily for work. Really happy with them...Until...About a month after purchase, the sound started clipping in and out. Now it's a gamble if they are going to work on a client call or break up to the point I can't understand anything. They aren't reliable, and I can't depend on them for calls. I really wish I could do 5 stars here. If it's a faulty set and I can get a replacement, I'll definitely update the review.

Edit: Company reached out with a replacement very quickly. A few months later, I've had no issues. Would recommend fully!

author: Jus Brandon
title: Good for the price
content:
This was an impulse buy based on a recommendation from Amazon. The functionality was similar and the price was 1/3rd if what I was willing to pay so I figured why not.

First thing first, you get what you pay for. You can't expect  $100 quality from a $20 product. The headphones work as advertised and come ready to use straight out of the box. The function keys seem like they're backwards to me the volume + key is behind your ear love and it takes some effort to push.

The battery on these things is decent to say the least however 3 major complaints.

1. There is no way to check the power level on the battery
2. The battery discharges at the same rate regardless of weather it's on standby or powered off.
3. The headphones make and audible sound every few seconds once the battery is below 30% making them virtually unusable at that point.

Other than that these do exactly what they're supposed to do. While they do have a few quarks what do you expect for such a low cost?

author: A. Pann
title: Works well, controls are a bit fiddly
content: I use these while I'm out walking or exercising and they work well.  Sound quality is just ok compared to a wired/jacked-in headphone, but I think that's just a limitation of the Bluetooth codec.  As others have mentioned, the controls are "backwards".  When you're wearing the headphones, you'd think the rearmost button would decrease volume and go to previous track (and vice versa for the forward button), but it's the opposite.  You get used to it, but it's a bit odd.  Also, its self-reporting ("power on", "connected", "powering off", etc audio notifications) volume is very LOUD and does not seem adjustable (ignores the volume settings for music playback), but you can just turn it on/off when it's not in your ear.  Battery life is good, and it seems to hold the charge well even when left sitting unused for days.  All in all, I'd say it's a good value.

author: Castle Doe
title: Very happy with purchase
content: The sound quality is very good, the volume level is actually very good ... I have tinnitus so it's important that the volume can get high enough to drowned out the ringing in my ears. The earbuds that came on the headset were quite comfortable, several other sizes as well. The charging cord is quite short and does not have an an adapter for an outlet, you have to plug into your computer or get a charger that has the right amperage outlet to charge it. Play time is adequate. I found let the cord between the two ear pieces was better hanging on front rather than back of my sweaty neck. My friend told me voice quality and using it to speak over the phone was very good. I enjoyed using them while listening to the local radio station streaming over my phone and cutting the lawn with my riding mower, cancelled out a lot of mower noise.

author: Lewis
title: Excellent for the Money - But USB Port wears out
content:
These are really excellent Bluetooth headphone for the money. They have good sound, volume and excellent range before loosing connection. The battery life is very good and are comfortable. It lost one star for only having pause and answer/end call features. It will not initiate call or give only battery low notification automatically, no battery status on demand. But then for less than $20 you really can't beat these headset.

Update 9/21/2019: Overall headphones perform good, battery life is good, but now I can't charge them anymore because the usb port is worn out, it started a number of months ago where it would not charge if usb plugged all the way in. If i only inserted the plug partially I could get it to connect and charge but now it is over. I cannot find the sweet spot anymore. So If you are OK with replacing every 12 to 20 months then they are a good deal. I'm disappointed but they are inexpensive with good sound.

author: Pepsi
title: Great quailty, bad if you have small ears.
content: Volume and quality great. The problem I have with them is if you have small ears they don't do a very good job staying in. That's the main reason I got them, for them to stay put. But that is a challenge. The rubber band doesn't secure them enough and the ear bud doesn't stay in my ear canal all the way. If the band was adjustable then it would prob work ok.

author: Rick..
title: Nice quality vs price.
content:
My last pair was damaged so I was glad I was able to get this pair for the cost. The headphones arrived quickly and secured in a very nice storage and travel case which shows product quality, very nice touch. There is a total of 4 pairs of bud tips and a cord gather. I have normal to large ears so the tips that were installed are a perfect fit. I did the head shake and they did not fall out or come loose. The sound is terrific! The bass and highs are without dropouts and/or distortion. I did increase the output for a VERY brief moment and they maintained the quality sound (I won’t do that again). Volume up/down, pause and song skip works superbly. I also did voice commands and an “Ok Google” phone call which went perfectly clear for both parties.
Would I recommend these? Yes…
**UPDATE** I have been wearing the headsets for the last three hours and almost forgot I had them on. They are very comfortable. I could not sleep so I tried the headphones with the sleep app and it worked! This is the first bud type headphones that I truly like!!!

author: Pete
title: Great wireless sport headphones at great price
content:
Great product.  Was actually better than I expected. Great price, great sound. Have no problems with sweat or retention  when working out on the wood pile or operating machinery. Ear cups to fit any ear plus a decent hard case to store the headphones, charge cable, spare ear cups and change in.
Update:
After using them for a week, I am even more impressed with how well they work. The Bluetooth connects instantly and never drops out. Answers my phone seamlessly and very clearly. Charge lasts all day, and recharges very quickly.
I don't think you can find a better product at any price.

author: Gary Livingston
title: died ofter 5 days
content:
these worked fine for 5 days, now they won't charge or power on.
tried to contact the seller via amazon, got the following reply:
"Your e-mail(s) to OtiumDirect (bws9jz63t0wxckr@marketplace.amazon.com) cannot be delivered because there was a problem with the recipient's email system. "
i'll be returning these.

author: RocKin40
title: Buy these
content: I am a musician and music store sales rep so I am very familiar with all types of sound equipment. My college age grand sons were disappointed AT FIRST because these were not Bose or Beatz. But they immediately used them and were totally impressed with the sound quality, appearance, fit and features. I read all reviews on many, many different ear phones and was skeptical of these due to the low price. I took a chance on all the good reviews and figured if they turned out to be not so good, then I didn't lose much money and would go ahead and buy them the ones they wanted. My young men were totally happy with quality and I saved a ton of money! I did not personally try them out. But by the reaction of my grandsons being pleasantly surprised by the clarity and bass response I'm happy I decided to buy these. Bluetooth Headphones, Otium Best Wireless Sports Earphones w/ Mic IPX7 Waterproof HD Stereo Sweatproof In Ear Earbuds for Gym Running Workout 8 Hour Battery Noise Cancelling Headsets

author: Chucker B
title: Another one bites the dust.
content: Just like all the other off brand Wireless headsets I have bought on amazon in the past they only worked for about 4 months before dying on me. They were working out fine until then. You think I would have learned since this is my 3rd or 4th pair of off brand name devices that have died on me. I can see why Amazon takes away the "Return Item" link on these after like 3 months and also, why take the time and hassle to get in touch with customer service in China. Almost not worth the time. They know. I finally just had to bite the bullet and buy some name brand devices at Costco. At least if those die I can return them easily enough. We shall see, maybe it is just me. They all say sweat proof but I really think my sweat is seeping in the seems causing the damage to the electronics which means NOT sweat proof. Or it could just be crap electronics that only last a short time. Either way save your time and just go with a brand name pair for about $60.

author: Squidny
title: Great sound quality!
content: Great sound quality, very comfortable, and the sound cancellation is really good, when you find the right size ear nubbin thing for your ears. These are really great headphones, especially for the price. The only reason it's getting 4/5 rather than 5/5 is because it took me about 25 minutes of trying and failing to pair it to my phone. I'm usually quite tech savvy, I can get stuff to work almost every time without reading the manual, but for this one I read the little booklet front to back twice over and still had issues, it was basically refusing to pair to my phone, which is a pain. but after running the pairing cycle a fair few times, it finally paired and I couldn't be happier with them. I'll update my review with an estimation of the battery life in the near future, that may sway the star rating up to a 5 or down to a 3, because charging my headphones every day seems like a big hassle, but if the battery is good, it may compensate for the pairing debacle.

author: Ms. Dee
title: Amazing Earbuds
content: I really am impressed by the quality of theses headphones. I do have to admit I was a bit skeptical about the sound quality because of the price, but these headphones sound just great. I didn't have enough money to get the beats that I really wanted but as I read the review on these headphones I decided to try them. They arrived early and undamaged. and had all the accessories in the description. I really recommend these earbuds, they are great for the price.

author: Jaikey333
title: Stops working at 2 months - do not buy!
content: I'm very disappointed in this product, especially because it is an Amazon "Best Seller". I bought this 2 months ago and today it stopped working. It was working great until it just stopped. I had charged it and turned it on today, it turned on and I heard "Power On" but then after that nothing. I thought that maybe it wasn't charged enough, even though I had just charged it. I plug it in and the light doesn't come on. No red or blue light. Holding down the power button doesn't do anything. I am so mad that Amazon recommends this and it breaks after 2 months.

author: Really COOL MaN!
title: These earphone sound better than the  BEATS brand earphone
content:
I love how well these stay in your ear. I have been using these while I skateboard and mountain bike. They are very comfortable. I have worn them for long peroids and my ears were not sore at all after my use. I like how many replacement rubber ear pieces come with them. I know that I will never go through them all.  It is great having them be a wireless while. I had a pair of the beats earphone that looks just like these but they are $299. I work in the audio engineering field, and I would say these have better frequency range meaning they sound better than the beats brand earphones that these seem to be modeled after. They are less money than the beats, but they actually reproduce sound better than higher priced Beats Brand earphone. These are better BEATS brand earphones that these look like!!!

no joke save your money and get these.

author: Matthew J Harrell
title: Good choice for price for workout headphones
content:
I use these when watching videos while riding the bike machine at the gym (the only way I can tolerate doing an hour on a bike machine, which is incredibly boring compared to a real ride).  I've been impressed with these given the price.  The material quality is quite good (better than other cheap in-ear headphones I've tried), and they've lasted well, even with how much I sweat on those bike machines.

The sound quality isn't fantastic, but is reasonable for the price.  I'm a bit of an audiophile, so I would never choose these for serious listening, but that's not what I bought them for.  I would also never use expensive headphones for a workout.

The only functional complaint I have about them is a minor one:  the volume rocker is backwards compared to what I would think of as "normal," at least in Western/U.S. cultures.  When they're on your ear, increasing volume is on the back of the rocker switch, while reducing loudness is on the front of the switch.  Not a big deal, and you get used to it.

Overall, a big thumbs up if you're looking for inexpensive headphones.  If you want good sound quality for music and you're not going to ruin your headphones with sweat, spend $50+ and get something that sounds better.

author: David Little
title: Piece of junk they quit working after about a month ...
content:
UPDATE: We were not able to get a refund but we were sent a new pair. Hope these hold up for more than a couple of months.

Piece of junk they quit working  after about a month of use ~ won't power on or anything. These were used for  indoor gym work outs  and NOT stored in the heat. JUNK! Do not buy these! ~

author: Hayden Jackson
title: Amazing headphones at this price point
content:
Got these and was really excited to try them. I have a couple pairs of true wireless headphones but I just did not like them because the battery was ridiculously low and they kept falling out--among a number of other reasons. I'm happy to be back to wireless headphones with the connector wire in the back. I can string them over my neck when I pop them out to talk to someone, they're a lot harder to lose, and the battery lasts waaaay longer.

Anyway, specifically about these headphones--the battery lasts nice and long. In fact it hasn't run out on me yet and I am a VERY HEAVY music listener. I listen to music more hours than I don't during the day. I haven't yet tried to completely run them down but the fact that I haven't needed to says something. They are very nice and loud which is great for destroyed-from-too-much-loud-music ears like mine. The headphones fit nice and snug, and they have the ear hooks. I don't like ear hooks, and every other pair I've had I've been able to pop them out, so that's the only thing I don't like. They pair easily as long as you follow directions, and they don't come unpaired. They're easy to use. The three buttons on the right side phone have a lot of button combos you can use.

Overall these are great! You should definitely buy. They even come with a nice carrying case.

author: Mike H.
title: Very affordable bluetooth headphones with crystal clear sound, noise cancellation and great range.
content:
I've worn these headphones in the gym, at work, at the airport and on planes and it is by far the best quality headphones (wireless or not) I've heard in a while. I was able to tune out noises on the plane, focus in on my workout at the gym, and reduce the wires at my desk at work.

Music:
I'm not a huge music person, but I listen to music while doing various tasks that require focus and these have very good bass and treble for the price. The annoying hissing noise you get from some headsets when you have no audio playing is non-existent here.

Noise cancelling: I've never had a more enjoyable airport/plane experience until I bought these. No crying babies, no annoying conversations, just peace. Initially at work, I nearly missed an phone call or 2 had I not seen my phone lighting up.

Range: I've had good bluetooth headsets that I couldn't even walk 30ft to the opposite side of my apartment without the recipient telling me the dreaded "You're breaking up...". These I'm able to charge my phone on one end while walking around doing other various tasks without a single drop in music or call quality.

Mic/Call Quality:
Good, but I don't primarily use these to talk on the phone with. I prefer a dedicated headset for that purpose, but these get the job done so that's definitely a plus.

author: Amazon Customer
title: One size ear hooks, not interchangable.
content:
I have been using the headphones for about a week now. Battery has lasted four days without recharging. I use them to listen to music at the gym and I work out for about an hour each day. The headphones are light weight and very comfortable. I did receive a call on them, the sound is clear and I did not get any complains from the caller about the sound quality.  What I like the most about them is that the microphone is located on the ear piece so there is nothing that weights down on the cable behind my neck or below the ear. The headsets include different size buds for the ear and they usually stain in place.

Cons: It would be nice if they included different size hooks for the ear, sometimes they do feel slightly loose but for the most part they stay in place when lifting weights, they only fall out when doing bench press. I think that different size clips are not included becasue they are not removable.
